The proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tabling the Report of the Commission appointed in terms of the provisions of the Commission of Inquiry Act, No.17 of 1948 (Chapter 393)
decision_details: - A Commission of Inquiry has been appointed under the Chairmanship of Mr. A.H.M.D Nawaz, Judge of the Supreme Court as per the provisions of section 2 of the Commission of Inquiry Act, No.17 of 1948 (Chapter 393), in order to inquire into the investigation Reports submitted by the Commissions and Committees appointed in advance to investigate the violations of Human Rights and submit recommendations on the manner in which measures have been taken so far in accordance with the existing law and the measures to be taken to further implement the said recommendations in accordance with the existing Government Policy. The proposal made by the Hon. President to present the Report submitted by the said Commission in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply of 45 Sets of Distal Femoral Nailing Set with Tan Implants
decision_details: - International Competitive Bids have been called for the procurement of 45 Sets of Distal Femoral Nailing Set with Tan Implants which are used in Orthopedic surgeries in cases of severe fractures to promote bone healing and alignment. 02 bids have been received for that. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the relevant procurement to M/s Medisurg International, India, the substantially responsive lowest bidder based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the supply of Non Ionic Contrast Media
decision_details: - Bids have been invited under the International Competitive Bidding Procedure for the purchase of  Non Ionic Contrast Media which is used for CT and X-ray Imaging. 06 Bids have been received for the purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the relevant procurement to Unique Pharmaceuticals Laboratories, the substantially responsive lowest bidder as per the recommendation of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the operation of Tea Sales Shops at the Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake
decision_details:
- 05 Tea Sales Shops are currently operating in the Departure/ Transit area at Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake. Bids have been invited under the National Competitive Bidding process for operating the said shops. 08 bidders have submitted bids for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contracts to the following Companies as per the recommendation of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet. 

    • Euro - Scan Exports (Pvt) Limited
    • English Tea Shop (UK) Limited
    • Sunshine Consumer Lanka Limited
    • U H E Exports (Pvt) Limited
    • Ceylon Royals Teas (Pvt) Limited

title: Building Complex belonging to the National Social Development Institute 	to be constructed in the Seeduwa area
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2016‑07‑26 to construct a building complex belonging to the National Social Development Institute under an initial cost estimate of Rs. 1000 million. Accordingly, the said construction contract had been awarded to the State Engineering Corporation  and the construction activities of the same had been scheduled to be completed and handed over in the year 2020. Nevertheless, the period of the relevant contract has been extended owing to the crisis situation which prevailed in the country during the period from 2019 to 2023. Due to the increase of prices of good during this period, the State Engineering Corporation has requested a price variation with regard to the construction cost. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to pay Rs. 63.68 million, the value of the relevant price variation, to the State Engineering Corporation based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making the Kelaniya Vidyalankara Buddhist Conference Hall to the implementation condition
decision_details: - The International Buddhist Conference Hall, which is being constructed in the Kelaniya Vidyalankara Pirivena premises, has not been able to be fully completed and made to the implementation condition due to external reasons which impacted on the same in the past. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils & Local Government  and the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to make required provisions in the year 2025 to carry out necessary  constructions to make the Conference Hall building to the implementation condition, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving the infrastructure facilities in plantation schools under the Indian Government Aid
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2019‑06‑04 has granted approval to implement a project to improve infrastructure facilities in plantation schools through a Grant of Rs. 300 million of the Government of India whereas the concurrence of the Government of India has been granted to increase the total Grant for the said project up to  Rs. 600 million due to the increase of prices owing to the economic crisis which prevailed in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign the relevant documents to obtain the said Grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief for people who have pawned jewellery in Banks
decision_details: - The severe economic crisis in the country during the past has directly and indirectly affected unfavourably to all sectors of the economy, and as a result, the pawning of jewellery has increased rapidly. The	outstanding amount of pawning advances in year 2019, which was about Rs.210 billion, has shown a growth of 172% to around Rs.571 billion by March 2024. Taking this situation into consideration, the need to provide relief for low-income people who have obtained pawning advances from the licensed banks has been identified. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement a suitable programme to allocate an interest subsidy from the General Treasury, subject to maximum of 10% per annum for the pawning advances not exceeding Rs.100,000/- which have been obtained from the licensed banks by the customers on individual basis on 30th June, 2024 or before that, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑03‑25 has granted approval to amend	the National Minimum Wage of Workers Act, No.3 of 2016 enabling to 	increase the National Minimum Wage of Private Sector up to Rs. 17,500/- and	the National Minimum Daily Wage up to Rs.700/-. Accordingly, the Bill	prepared by the Legal Draftsman has received the clearance of the Attorney	General. The proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign	Employment to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the	same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Electricity Advisory Council and National	System Operator as per the provisions of the Act, No.36 of 2024
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka Electricity Act, No.36 of 2024 has made provisions for the	restructuring of the corporate structure of the power industry in order to	efficiently manage its functions. Under which, the Power Sector Reform	Secretariat, National System Operator and National Electricity Advisory	Council shall be established. By now, the Power Sector Reform Secretariat has 	been established. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and	Energy to establish National Electricity Advisory Council and to appoint Board	of Directors for the National System Operator as per the provisions of the	above Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tabling of Order gazetted under Colombo Port City Economic	Commission Act, No.11 of 2021 in Parliament
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet Decision dated 2024-04-29, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to designate China Harbour Engineering Company (Lanka) Limited as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance. Accordingly, an Order has been promulgated under Section 53 of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No.11 of 2021 through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2383/34 dated 2024-05-09 designating that company as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to table the said Order in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.09 of 2024	issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969, for	approval in Parliament
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.09 of 2024 imposed under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 and published in the Gazette Notification No.2390/19 dated 2024-06-28, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Public Assets Management Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑10‑17 has granted approval to identify and compile a National Asset Register of Non-financial immovable or movable assets fully owned, assigned, possessed, vested in, held or utilized by a public institution and to introduce a Law on state asset management, incorporating the provisions for updating the said Register from time to time and ensuring the receipt of proper returns of these Assets to the Government institutions. Accordingly, the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Agenda for Anti-Corruption
decision_details:
- When the present Government took over in July 2022, their priority was to restore the fiscal and debt sustainability and transform the economy by improving governance and eliminating corruption. Accordingly, the foundation for the Anti-Corruption Agenda was laid through the enactment of the Anti-Corruption Act, No.9 of 2023 repealing the Bribery Act (Chapter 26), the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption Act, No.19 of 1994 and the Declaration of Assets and Liabilities Law No.1 of 1975, in order to enforce the provisions of the United Nations Convention against Corruption and other relevant international norms and practices such as the Financial Action Task Force Standards. Also, currently, the preparation of the Proceeds of Crime Bill is at the final stage. Accordingly, the following measures have been identified as key action items in the Anti-Corruption Agenda in line with the Legal, Organizational and Strategic Frameworks for Anti-Corruption as stated in the International Monetary Fund Governance Diagnostic Technical Assistance Report.

* Enactment of the Anti-Corruption Act, No.9 of 2023

* Developing a National Anti-Corruption Plan for the period 2025-2029

* Amendment of the National Audit Act, No.19 of 2018.

* Establishment of an effective and transparent Asset Declaration and Conflict of Interest Systems.

* Introducing new methodologies to execute the Proceeds of Crime and Money Laundering.

* Strengthening Investigation and Prosecution of Corruption Cases.

* Introducing amendments to the Companies Act, No.07 of 2007 enabling to strengthen the Beneficial Ownership Framework and taking other relevant measures.

* Enactment of a Public Procurement Law to ensure the transparency of the Public Procurement.

* Publishing all the firms receiving tax exemptions under the Strategic Development Projects Act, No.14 of 2008 and through the Board of Investment.

* Temporary suspending the application of the Strategic Development Projects Act, No.14 of 2008, until the promulgation of an explicit and transparent process for the evaluation of proposals and costing of investment promotion conditions.

* Implementing a State-Owned Enterprises Reform Policy.

* Initiation of short-term Anti-corruption measures within each revenue department.

* Establishment of a new management arrangement for the Employee Provident Fund.

* Revision of legislation, regulations and processes relating to financial sector oversight in the banking sector.

* Empowering the Judicial Services Commission.

* Strengthening the Right to Information.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to confirm the Anti-Corruption Agenda as the National Agenda of the Government for Anti-Corruption in principle and direct all the relevant authorities to comply with the said Agenda, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Online Safety Act No.9 of 2024
decision_details: - Subsequent to the passage of the Online Safety Act in Parliament adhering to the decision given by the Supreme Court pertaining to the said Bill, the Online Safety Act No.9 of 2024 is in force at present. Even though, experts in the field had proposed amendments with regard to certain clauses in the said Bill prior to the passage of the said Bill in Parliament, it was not possible to incorporate such amendments to the Bill at the Committee Stage. Accordingly, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑02‑12 to prepare a Bill to amend the Online Safety Act No.9 of 2024 by incorporating the said amendments. As such, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The Proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and to submit the same thereafter to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Regulatory Institution in the Name of "Films Sri Lanka" 	instead of the proposed "National Films Development Commission"
decision_details: - The proposal submitted to establish the "National Films Development Commission" to establish a new institutional framework enabling the National Film Corporation to move away from the current business activities and carry out regulatory-based activities, provide opportunities and facilities to enter the digital platform thereby moving the local cinema to the international arena, was taken up for discussion at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑04‑29. In this instance, it has been decided that all stakeholders in the film industry should be consulted and views be obtained regarding the proposal. Accordingly, it has been decided to replace the name of the "National Films Development Commission" with "Films Sri Lanka" based on the matters furnished at the discussion held with the relevant parties and to take into account the proposals presented at the said meeting in the preparation of the proposed Bill.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for the establishment of "Films Sri Lanka" based on the above matters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017 to expedite the Tax Appeals Process
decision_details: - As per the provisions of the Inland Revenue Act, any taxpayer aggrieved by a decision of the Department of Inland Revenue can submit an appeal to the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue on such decision. The Commissioner General of Inland Revenue should give his decision in that regard not later than 02 years. Any taxpayer aggrieved by the said decision too can submit an appeal to the Tax Appeals Commission to review the said decision, and the decision of the Tax Appeals Commission must be given within 270 days from the date of receipt of such review request. Accordingly, the said appeal process may take almost three years whereby approximately 73 billion rupees of tax could not be charged to the government revenue during the past. Taking into account the said matters, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to introduce appropriate amendments to the Inland Revenue Act, No. 24 of 2017 to expedite and regulate the tax appeal process, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conserving the 'Gedige' tradition Statue Chamber in the Gadaladeniya Sadhdarmathilaka Rajamaha Viharaya
decision_details: - The Gadaladeniya Sadhdarmathilaka Rajamaha Viharaya was built during the Gampola Era according to the Pallawa architecture under the patronage of a thero known as Dharmakeerthi. It has been proposed to build a covering roof for the purpose of conserving the chamber of Gedige tradition of the said temple. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to assign the above task to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau which is an institution possessing the capacity and resources for that purpose, since the Department of Archaeology does not possess required human resources and technical equipment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a special programme for the economic empowerment of women and youth engaged in the handloom industry
decision_details: - Allocations amounting to 300 million rupees have been allocated to the Ministry of Industries through the Budget 2024 to implement a special programme for the economic empowerment of the community engaged in the handloom industry. Accordingly, a joint project proposal has been prepared to provide solutions to the issues such as securing raw materials by industrialists engaged in the handloom industry, lack of entrepreneurial skills, minimizing the environment-friendly and adequate infrastructure, absence of the technology required to create innovative products that meet the market demands and lack of adequate marketing facilities, and the recommendation of the Department of National Planing has been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to implement the development programmes identified by the said project proposal through the National Enterprise Development Authority, Department of Textile Industry, Lanka Salusala Institute and the National Design Centre falling under the purview of the Ministry of Industries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Deployment of Dry-bulk Carriers belonging to the Ceylon Shipping Corporation during the years from 2024 - 2027
decision_details: - Bids have been invited for time chartering and commercial management of vessels, Mv. Ceylon Breeze and Mv. Ceylon Princess owned by the Ceylon Shipping Corporation during the period from 2024/2025 to 2026/2027. Two bids have been received for the same and the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contract to M/s Wallem Shipping (Singapore) Pte Ltd for a period of 03 years based on the recommendations submitted by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee after evaluating the said Bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Maintenance of the Mahinda Rajapaksa National Tele-Cinema Park under the Public-Private Partnership
decision_details: - It has been decided at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑05‑02 to obtain recommendations of the National Agency for Public‑Private Partnership in order to manage the Mahinda Rajapaksa National Tele-Cinema Park under the Public‑Private Partnership. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to follow the procurement process to identify a suitable investor to implement and maintain the Mahinda Rajapaksa National Tele-Cinema Park under the Public‑Private Partnership and to enter into a Lease Agreement with the investor so identified for a period of 30 years, based on the recommendations of the said Agency, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Act on Burial and Cremation according to Religious Wishes
decision_details: - As referred to at the Guidelines published by the Ministry of Health on Clinical Management of COVID-19, the cremation of dead bodies of persons succumbed to the COVID virus was made mandatory. This decision caused concern among various religious groups, human rights activists and particularly those who are professing the Islam. Pursuant to the later studies made thereon, it has been confirmed the fact that the primary source of transmission of the COVID virus to the water sources including groundwater is merely through faeces and urine and not through the safe burials. Therefore, attention has been focused on introducing a law that allows a person or a relative to choose the burial or cremation of the deceased as per their wish in order to avoid such situations in future. Further, it has appeared that it would also be appropriate to introduce relevant laws for donation of bodies to Faculties of Medicine, if found necessary. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Foreign Affairs to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to introduce a new law, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tendering an apology for the Mandatory Cremation Policy enforced in Sri Lanka during the COVID-19 pandemic
decision_details: - As stated in the Guidelines on Clinical Management of Covid-19, published by the Ministry of Health, cremation has been recommended as the method of disposing of those who have died of the virus. Accordingly, 276 individuals who succumbed to Covid-19 from the Muslim population were cremated and subsequently in February 2021 such individuals were permitted to bury with strict restrictions. In July 2021, the then Ministry of Water Supply with the assistance of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura initiated a study to identify the SARS-CoV-2 virus in the aquatic environments of Colombo and Kandy, including river water, waste water discharged from hospitals, quarantine centres and other potential sites. The study revealed that there is no virus in the surface water. A second study was also completed in March 2024 by the China-Sri Lanka Joint Research and Demonstration Centre for Water Technology under the Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development, which confirmed that primary source of transmission of the SARS-CoV-2 virus to water sources including groundwater was through faeces and urine and not safe burials. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Justice, prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to tender an apology by the Sri Lankan Government from the social groups affected due to the mandatory cremation policy enforced in Sri Lanka amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting the plot of land located at Kurulu Island, Beira Lake to the 'Sri Jinarathana Bhikku Abhyasa Vidyalaya' Committee on long term lease basis
decision_details: - In the year 2000, as part of the Colombo City Development Plan, the Kurulu Uyana Island with 143 perches in the southwest Beira Lake has been vested with the Urban Development Authority, under the Beira Lake Restoration Project. A request has been made by the Chief Incumbent Thero of the Gangarama Temple to use the said plot of land which is currently underutilized to be developed as a Buddhist sacred site and as a place of tourist attraction where cultural heritage is displayed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to grant the said plot of land to the Sri Jinarathana Bhikku Abhyasa Vidyalaya Committee for development activities, on lease basis for a period of 50 years, based on the tax value determined by the Chief Government Valuer, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vest the plots of land with old canals at New Hospital Road, Thalapathpitiya, Maharagama with the Urban Development Authority
decision_details: - A land in extent of 27.5 hectares located at Thalapathpitiya village of Maharagama Divisional Secretariat Division has been vested with the Urban Development Authority in the year 1984. However, the land plots in the above land which depict the already developed old canals located at New Hospital Road,Thalapathpitiya, Maharagama have not been formally transferred to the Urban Development Authority. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to vest the said land plots in the said Land which depict the old canals with the Urban Development Authority, as a free grant without charging a fee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of Cup Lumps and Cup Lump Sheets under the Scheme for Temporary Import for Export Processing (TIEP)
decision_details: - There is an annual demand of about 60,240 metric tons of technically specified rubber for Solid Tire Manufacturing Factories in Sri Lanka, and due to the severe shortage of Ottapalu in the country, there is a situation where local manufacturers cannot meet that demand. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to grant permission to Technically Specified Rubber Factories in Sri Lanka registered with the Rubber Development Department and approved by the Rubber Research Institute of Sri Lanka, to import Cup Lumps and Low Dirt Cup Lump Sheets under the Scheme for Temporary Import for Export Processing.

title: Upgrading Diploma Programmes of the Institute of Engineering Technology (IET), Katunayaka to Degree Level
decision_details: - The Technician Training Institute, Katunayake was established in 1985 under the National Apprentice and Industrial Training Authority and this institute was upgraded to the Institute of Engineering Technology in 2006. This Institute awards the National Diploma in Engineering Sciences for the students who complete an academic period of 04 years. The University of Vocational Technology and the National Apprentice and Industrial Training Authority have agreed to upgrade the said Diploma to a Degree in Bachelor of Engineering Technology. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the said two institutions to award the Degree in Engineering Technology, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting a plot of Land with the University of Colombo for residential requirements of the Faculty of Indigenous Medicine
decision_details: - A land in extent of about 0.1765 hectares belonging to the Department of Irrigation and along with the buildings located therein have been vested with the then Ministry of Higher Education, with the approval of the Cabinet, on 50 years lease basis for the hostel requirement of female students studying in the Institute of Indigenous Medicine. By the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2023‑02‑13, the Institute of Indigenous Medicine has been transformed into a Faculty of the University of Colombo and the said Faculty has decided to utilize the aforementioned land to be utilized for the hostel requirement of  female students. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to vest the plot of land located at No.330, Dr. N.M. Perera Mawatha, Colombo 08 with the University of Colombo, enabling to utilize the said land for the hostel requirement of the female students of the said Faculty, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of Reports to be submitted to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
decision_details: - According to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and the Paris Agreement, Sri Lanka is obliged to prepare National Communication Reports on Climate Change and submit the same to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. Accordingly, the First Biennial Transparency Report is scheduled to be submitted by 2024‑12‑31 and the Second Biennial Transparency Report by 2026‑12‑31. Also, Sri Lanka should submit its Fourth National Communication Report in 2027. The Ministry of Environment has submitted a Project Report to the Global Environment Facility in order to secure funds required to prepare such Reports and submit the same during the period of 2024‑2028. The Global Environment Facility has agreed to provide a Grant of US$1.23 million for the preparation of related reports based on the said Project Report. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Environment to enter into relevant Agreements to obtain the said Grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Social Protection Policy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Disjointed programmes, schemes, institutions and products which are integral in the current Social Protection System are proven to have limited effectiveness in the said Social Protection System and less contribution to the National development. Accordingly, the Ministry of Finance,Economic Stabilization and National Policies has identified the necessity of having a Social Protection System for Sri Lanka. The National Social Protection Policy has been formulated to provide a strategic guidance for the development of a well-coordinated and harmonized Social Protection System with the contribution of all relevant parties. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to implement the said Policy was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Suraksha  Student  Insurance-2024
decision_details: - The  Cabinet  at  its  meeting  held  on  2024‑05‑06  has  granted  approval  to  resume  the  Suraksha  Student  Insurance  Programme  and  invite  bids  from  the  Sri  Lanka  Insurance  Corporation  for  the  same.    Accordingly,  the  Cabinet  Appointed  Negotiating  Committee,  having  evaluated  the  price  proposal  submitted  by  the    Sri  Lanka  Insurance  Corporation,  has  recommended  to  implement  the  Suraksha  Student  Insurance  Programme  at  Rs.  6.027  billion  (excluding  VAT)  for  the  years  of  2024/2025,  2025/2026  and  2026/2027.  Accordingly,  the  joint  proposal  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  and  the  Minister  of  Education  to  award  the  contract  for  the  Suraksha  Student  Insurance  to    Sri  Lanka  Insurance  Corporation  General  Limited  for  a  period  of  three  years  as  referred  to  above  and  to  provide  the  parents  death  benefits  entitled  under  the  life  insurance  of  the  Suraksha  Student  Insurance  Programme  for  the  students  of  families  whose  annual  income  is  lesser  than  Rs.  180,000/-  to  the  students  of  families  belonging  to  the  "Aswesuma"  programme  as  well,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendments  to  the  Companies  Act,  No.  07  of  2007
decision_details: - It  has  been  identified  the  necessity  to  amend  the  Companies  Act  to  empower  the  domestic  law  to  combat  money  laundering,  terrorist  financing  and  other  unlawful  activities  and  accordingly  the  policy  approval  has  been  granted  at  the  Cabinet  meeting  held  on  2024‑07‑09  to  amend  the  said  Bill.  Clarence  of  the  Attorney  General  has  been  received  for  the  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman  for  the  same.  As  such,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Industries  to  publish  the  said  amending  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  submit  the  same  thereafter,  to  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendments  to  the  Code  of  Criminal  Procedure  Act  (Increase  of  Fines)
decision_details: - The  Cabinet  at  its  meeting  held  on  2023‑11‑27  has  granted  approval  to  amend  the    the  Criminal  Procedure  Act  so  as  to  increase  the  fines  in  the  Code  of  Criminal  Procedure  based  on  the  current  monetary  value.  Accordingly,  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  General  has  been  received  for  the  amended  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman.  As  such,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Justice,  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  submit  the  same  thereafter,  to  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Colombo  Port  City  (Fees)  Regulations  No.2  of  2024
decision_details: - Colombo  Port  City  (Fees)  Regulations  have  been  imposed  through  the  Gazette  Notification  dated  2024‑06‑06  as  per  the  provisions  of  the  Colombo  Port  City  Economic  Commission  Act  No.  11  of  2021.  As  per  the  provisions  of  section  71  of  the  said  Act,  every  Regulation  so  made  should  be  submitted  to  Parliament  for  approval  within  03  three  months  from  the  date  of  publication  in  the  Gazette.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Investment  Promotion  to  submit  the  Colombo  Port  City  (Fees)  Regulations  No.2  of  2024  published  through  the  Gazette  Extraordinary  Notification  No.  2387/38  dated  2024‑06‑06  to  Parliament  for  approval,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendments  to  the  Bank  of  Ceylon  Ordinance,  No.  53  of  1938
decision_details: - The  Bank  of  Ceylon  which  has  been  established  under  the  Bank  of  Ceylon  Ordinance,  No.  53  of  1938  is  a  leading  entity  operating  within  the  financial  market  in  Sri  Lanka  and  it  provides  an  outstanding  contribution  towards  the  growth  of  national  economy  as  a  state  owned  commercial  bank.  It  has  been  found  that  there  are  a  number  of  challenges  and  restrictions  in  the  said  Ordinance  which  is  currently  in  force  which  limits  the  achievement  of  optimum  return,  while  operating  in  the  competitive  and  dynamic  financial  market.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  to  instruct  the  Legal  Draftsman  to  prepare  a  Bill  based  on    the  initial  draft  prepared  to  amend  the  Bank  of  Ceylon  Ordinance,  No.  53  of  1938  to  suit  the  present  day  needs,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendments  to  the  Bills  of  Exchange  Ordinance
decision_details: - The  Cabinet  at  its  meeting  held  on  2024‑01‑24  has  granted  approval  to  amend  or  remove  the  obsolete  provisions  in  the  Bills  of  Exchange  Ordinance  No.25  of  1927.  Accordingly,  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  General  has  been  received  for  the  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman.    The  joint  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President:  and  the  Minister  of  Justice,  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  to  submit  the  same  thereafter  to  Parliament  for  approval,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Commission  for  Truth,  Unity  and  Reconciliation  in  Sri  Lanka  Bill
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  on  2023‑12‑18  to  publish  the    Commission  for  Truth,  Unity  and  Reconciliation  in  Sri  Lanka  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette.  Since  various  parties  have  proposed  further  amendments  to  the  said  Bill  thereafter,  action  has  not  been  taken  to  present  the  said  Bill  in  Parliament.  Having  conducted  several  rounds  of  consultations,  the  Interim  Secretariat  for  Truth  and  Reconciliation  Mechanism  has  identified  amendments  to  be  made  to  the  relevant  Bill.  Accordingly,  the  joint  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Defence;  the  Minister  of  Justice  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitution  Reforms:  and  the  Minister  of  Foreign  Affairs  to  instruct  the  Legal  Draftsman  to  prepare  a  Bill  based  on  the  initial  draft  prepared  incorporating  the  said  amendments  as  well  and  to  revoke  the  Gazette  Notification  issued  publishing  the  relevant  Bill  earlier,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Agriculture  Modernization  Programme
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  at  the  meeting  held  on  2024‑03‑04  to  implement  the  first  stage  of  the  of  the  Agriculture  Modernization  Project.  As  the  second  stage  of  the  said  programme,  it  has  been  decided  to  select  another  03  Divisional  Secretariat  Divisions  from  each  district  and  implement  Agriculture  Modernization  Projects.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President,  to  implement  the  second  stage  of  the  Agriculture  Modernization  Project  utilizing  Rs.  750  million  from  the  provisions  allocated  in  the  Budget  for  the  year  2024,  to  75  Divisional  Secretariat  Divisions,  Rs.10  million  each  for  a  Divisional  Secretariat  Division,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendment  of  the  Constitution  of  the  Democratic  Socialist  Republic  of  Sri  Lanka
decision_details: - Policy  approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  on  2024‑07‑09  to  amend  the paragraph (b) of  Article 83 of  the  Constitution of the Democratic Socialist  Republic of Sri Lanka by the substitution  of  the  words  “to  over  six  years”  with  the  words  “to  over  five  years” as  stated in  paragraph  (b)  of  Article  83  of  the  Constitution.  Accordingly,  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  General  has  been  received  for  the  Bill  drafted  by  the  Legal  Draftsman.  The  joint  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  and  the  Minister  of  Justice,Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms,  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  thereafter,  present  the  same  in  Parliament  for  approval,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Amendments  to  the  Primary  Court's  Procedure  Act,  No.44  of  1979
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  on  2024‑03‑18  to  amend  the  Primary  Court's  Procedure  Act  in  order  to  overcome  the  issues  faced  by  the  applicants  who  make  applications  under  section  66  of  the  said  Act.  Accordingly,  the  Certificate  of  Constitutionality  of  the  Attorney  General  has  been  received  for  the  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Justice,  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms,  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  thereafter,  present  the  same  in  Parliament  for  approval,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Obtaining  approval  for  the  amendments  proposed  to  the  Animal  Welfare  Bill  by  the  Sectoral  Oversight  Committee
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  on  2022‑01‑10  to  submit  the  Animal  Welfare  Bill,  to  Parliament  and  accordingly,  the  said  Bill  has  been  submitted  to  Parliament.  The  said  Bill  has  been  submitted  to  the  Sectoral  Oversight  Committee  on  Food  Security  and  Agriculture  for  its  recommendations  and  the  said  Committee  has  proposed  several  amendments  to  the  said  Bill.  The  Legal  Draftsman  has  prepared  the  said  amendments  so  that  it  could  be  presented  at  the  Committee  Stage  of  the  said  Bill  in  Parliament  and  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  general  has  been  received  for  the  same.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Agriculture  and  Plantation  Industries  to  present  the  relevant  amendments  at  the  Committee  Stage  of  the  Animal  Welfare  Bill  in  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Procuring  medicinal  Ginger  required  for  manufacturing  purposes  in  the  Sri  Lanka  Ayurvedic  Drugs  Corporation
decision_details: - Medicinal  ginger  is  used  as  an  ingredient  for  87  types  of  medicines  manufactured  by  the  Sri  Lanka  Ayurvedic  Drugs  Corporation,  and  currently  there  is  a  severe  shortage  of  medicinal  ginger  in  the  market.  There  is  a  stock  of  50  tons  of  medicinal  ginger  that  has  been  confiscated  by  the  Sri  Lanka  Customs,  and  the  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Health  to  get  the  said  stock  of  medicinal  ginger  at  concessional  prices  to  the  Sri  Lanka  Ayurveda  Drugs  Corporation,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Launching  the  SMART  Youth  Exhibitions  &  Nights-2024  Programme  implemented  by  the  National  Youth  Services  Council,  islandwide
decision_details: - The  young  community  had  to  face  an  extremely  stressful  situation  due  to  the  restrictions  of  travel,  mutual  relationships,  personal  meetings  and  gatherings  in  groups  amidst  the  severe  impact  of  the  Covid-19  pandemic,  which  prevailed  globally  for  two  years  from  the  year  2019.  It  has  been  found  that  it  is  advisable  to  hold  recreational  programmes  islandwide  aimed  at  preventing  the  youth  from  being  subjected  to  such  pressures,  developing  their  entertainment,  enjoyment  and  mental  wellness,  providing  opportunities  for  the  young  community  to  maintain  social  relationships  physically,  and  giving  them  the  opportunity  to  work  together  as  well.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Sports  and  Youth  Affairs  to  implement  the  SMART  Youth  Exhibitions  &  Nights  -  2024  programme  covering  the  entire  island,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Completion  of  the  work  of  the  Nanu  Oya  Railway  Station  Modernization  Project
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  at  the  Cabinet  meeting  held  on  2023‑04‑03  to  implement  the  Nanu  Oya  Railway  Station  Modernization  Project  utilizing  the  funds  of  the  Sri  Lanka  Tourism  Development  Authority  and  the  Sri  Lanka  Tourism  Promotion  Bureau.  Due  to  revision  in  the  prices  of  construction  materials,  the  contract  value  of  Rs.74.63  million  for  the  modernization  of  Nanu  Oya  railway  station  has  increased  to  Rs.101.81  million.  Accordingly,  Cabinet  approved  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Tourism  and  Lands  to  complete  the  relevant  modernization  works  under  the  Central  Engineering  Consultancy  Bureau,  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Department  of  Sri  Lanka  Railways  and  to  secure  additional  provisions  required  for  the  purpose  from  the  Sri  Lanka  Tourism  Development  Authority  and  the  Sri  Lanka  Tourism  Promotion  Bureau.

title: Allocation  of  Funds  from  the  Saudi  Fund  for  Development  to  complete  	the  	section  I  of  the  half  completed  work  of  the  Godagama-Homagama  	Road
decision_details: - Funds  of  the  Saudi  Fund  for  Development  have  been  utilized  to  implement  the  Kurinchakerny  Bridge  Project  in  Trincomalee  District.  After  completion  of  the  procurement  process  of  the  said  project,  there  is  still  a  loan  balance  of  US$  10.5  and  it  has  been  decided  to  utilize  the  said  balance  amount  for  the  completion  of  Section  I  of  the  Godagama-Homagama  road,  which  is  half  completed.  In  order  to  complete  the  rest  of  the  said  road,  an  amount  of  US$  12  million  is  needed  and  the  Saudi  Fund  for  Development  has  agreed  to  provide  the  remaining  US$1.5  million  from  the  loan  amount  of  the  Road  Network  Development  Project  funded  by  the  Saudi  Fund  for  Development.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Transport  and  Highways,  to  secure  funds  and  complete  section  I  of  the  Godagama-Homagama  road,  which  is  half  completed,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Awarding  the  Contract  for  provisioning  of  Automated  Seat  Upgrade	Bidding  Services  and  Associated  Ancillary  Services  for  SriLankan  	Airlines  	Limited
decision_details: - SriLankan  Airlines  Limited  is  currently  using  the  Plusgrade  system  for  Automated  Seat  Upgrade  Bidding  Services  and  Associated  Ancillary  Services.  This  service  increases  the  revenue  of  the  Airline  service  by  providing  an  opportunity  for  a  passenger  holding  an  economy  class  flight  ticket  to  bid  for  a  business  class  ticket  when  there  are  unreserved  seats  available  in  business  class.  Bids  have  been  invited  under  the  International  Competitive  Bidding  Procedure  for  maintaining  this  service,  and  02  bids  have  been  received  for  that.	The  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Ports,  Shipping  and  Aviation  to  evaluate  said  bids  and  thereafter,  to  award  the  Contract  for  provisioning  of  Automated	Seat  Upgrade  Bidding  Services  and  Associated  Ancillary  Services  for	SriLankan  Airlines  to  Plusgrade  Inc.  for  a  period  of  five  (05)  years,  based  on  the  recommendations  of  the  Technical  Evaluation  Committee  and  the  Standing  Cabinet    Appointed  Procurement  Committee,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Implementation  of  Currency  Exchange  Counters  at  Arrival  Post  Customs	Area  at  Bandaranaike  International  Airport  (BIA),  Katunayake
decision_details:
- In  terms  of  the  Cabinet  decision  dated  2024-01-08,  Airport  and  Aviation Services  (Sri  Lanka)  (Pvt)  Limited  has  invited  Limited  Competitive  Bids  to implement  the  Currency  Exchange  Counters  at  Arrival  Post  Customs  Area  at Bandaranaike  International  Airport  (BIA),  Katunayake.  05  bids  have  been submitted  for  that.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Ports,  Shipping  and Aviation  to  evaluate  the  said  bids  and  thereafter,  to  award  the  contracts  as  follows  for  a  period  of  three  (03)  years,  based  on  the  recommendations  of  the  Technical  Evaluation  Committee  and  the  Standing  Cabinet Appointed  Procurement  Committee,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

*    Counter  No.  05  -  Bank  of  Ceylon

title: Implementation   of  the  Tariff  Policy  and  Formula  to  review  the  tariff  for  	the  National  Water  Supply  and  Drainage  Board
decision_details: - The  new  Tariff  Policy  and  Formula  of  the  National  Water  Supply  and  Drainage  Board  was  discussed  at  the  Cabinet  meeting  held  on  2024-04-08,  where  it  has  been  directed  to  present  the  new  Tariff  Policy  and  Formula  by  incorporating    the  necessary  revisions  in  consultation  with  all  the  relevant  parties.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Water  Supply  and  Estate  Infrastructure  Development  to  implement  the  revised  Water  Tariff  Policy  and  the  revised  Water  Tariff  Formula  prepared  accordingly,  from  year  2025,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Leasing  out  a  plot  of  land  located  at  Mudun  Ela,  Kelaniya  to  Storight	Logistics  (Pvt)  Ltd.
decision_details: - Bitsuthra  IT  (Pvt)  Ltd.  has  submitted  a  request  to  provide  a  plot  of  land 	located near  the  Port  of  Colombo  for  logistics  services  and  storage  facilities  	upon the  approval  of  the  Board  of  Investment  of  Sri  Lanka.  Since  the  project	proposal  submitted  by  the  said  company  has  fulfilled  the  relevant  basic 	requirements,  a  new  company  named  Storight  Logistics  (Pvt)  Ltd.  has  been	established  as  per  the  provisions  of  the  Board  of  Investment.  A  plot  of  land  	with  the  extent  of  02  acres  1.08  perches  owned  by  the  Sri  Lanka  Land  	Development Corporation  located  in  Mudun  Ela  area,  Kelaniya  has  been  	identified  as suitable  for  the said  project.  Accordingly,the  proposal  made  by  	the Minister  of  Urban  Development  and  Housing  to  lease  out  the  said  plot  of  	land  to  Storight Logistics  (Pvt)  Ltd.  for  a  period  of  30  years  based  on  the  	current  valuation submitted  by  the  Government  Chief  Valuer,  was  approved  by  	the  Cabinet.

title: Providing  a  land  located  at  Wedamulla,  Kelaniya  to  H.M.K.  Property	Developers  (Pvt)  Ltd.  for  a  Housing  Project  approved  by  Board  of	Investment  of  Sri  Lanka
decision_details: - Approval  has  been  granted  previously  at  the  Cabinet  Sub-Committee  meeting	on  Investment  Promotion  to  grant  approval  to  provide  a  land  of  about  12  	acres in  extent  located  in  Wedamulla,  Kelaniya  owned  by  the  Sri  Lanka  Land	Development  Corporation  to  H.M.K.  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Ltd.  However,	due  to  the  company's  failure  to  adhere  with  the  relevant  agreements,  no  steps	have  been  taken  so  far  to  hand  over  the  relevant  plot  of  land  to  the  said  	company.  H.M.K.  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Ltd.  had  made  a  request  again  	through  the  Board  of  Investment  of  Sri  Lanka  to  obtain  the  relevant  plot  of  	land  in  order  to  implement  a  Housing  Project  under  03  stages  of  that  land.  	Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Urban  Development  and  	Housing  to  provide  a  plot  of  land  with  the  extent  of  08  acres  -  02  roods  -  	16.26  perches  identified  for  the  implementation  of  the  proposed  project,  to  the  	said  company  based  on  the  current  valuation  submitted  by  the  Government  	Chief  Valuer,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Provision  of  facilities  for  the  admission  of  Foreign  Students  to  Degree	Awarding  Institutes
decision_details: - Currently,  a  percentage  of  5%  is  allocated  annually  for  foreign  students  in  17  universities  under  the  University  Grants  Commission.  In  addition,  it  has  been  identified  that  the  aim  of  making  Sri  Lanka  the  Knowledge  Hub  in  Asia  can  be  achieved  by  expanding  the  opportunities  for  admission  of  foreign  students  to  the  26  Degree  Awarding  Institutions  recognized  by  section  25A  of  the  Universities  Act  as  well.  However,  it  is  observed  that  there  is  no  specific  methodology  to  determine  the  ability  to  comply  with  the  recognized  minimum  qualifications  considered  for  university  entrance  by  each  country,  as  a  requirement  for  admission  to  a  degree  in  a  Degree  Awarding  Institution  recognized  under  section  25A  of  the  Universities  Act  in  Sri  Lanka.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Education  to  consider  the  minimum  qualification  used  for  university  admission  in  193  member  countries  of  the  United  Nations  as  the  minimum  qualification  for  entering  into  Degree  courses  offered  by  the  recognized  Degree  Awarding  Institutions  under  section  25A  of  the  Universities  Act  in  Sri  Lanka  and  to  obtain  confirmation  from  the  UK  NARIC  Institution  for  exceptional  occassions  not  disclosed  by  the  said  qualifications,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: The National Traditional Medicine Policy of Sri Lanka 2024-2034
decision_details: - The  Ayurveda  Act,  No.  31  of  1961  amended  by  the  Ayurveda  (Amendment)  Act,  No.  19  of  2023,  has  provided  the  legal  framework  for  the  implementation  of  Traditional  Medicine  System  in  the  country.  However,  no  single  National  policy  has  been  drafted  that  steers  the  direction  of  the  Government  Policy  for  the  Traditional  Medical  Service.  The  need  for  an  Traditional  National  Medical  Policy  has  arisen  in  the  National  Health  Policy  of  the  mainstream  in  order  to  solve  the  problems  that  have  arisen  in  the  current  service  delivery  and  to  present  a  quality  and  strong  medical  system  to  the  future  generation  by  preserving  the  Traditional  Medicine  System.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  to  implement  the  National  Traditional  Medicine  Policy  of  Sri  Lanka  2024-2034  prepared  through  an  extensive  participatory  process  by  a  panel  of  experts,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Uninterrupted  functioning  of  teaching  in  schools  and  patient  care	services  in  	hospitals
decision_details: - The  attention  of  the  Cabinet  was  drawn  to  the  pressure  imposed  and  irregular    actions  carried  out  by  certain  groups,  hindering  the  teaching  in  schools  during  school  hours  and  causing  disruption  to  the  patient  care  services  in  hospitals  and  the  Cabinet  decided  to  take  necessary  action  to  introduce  new  laws  to  prevent  the  injustices  caused  to  school  children  and  patients  through  such  unlawful  acts.

title: Difficulties  encountered  by  certain  Regional  Plantation  Companies	pertaining  to  the  payment  of  a  reasonable  remuneration  to  the	plantation  	workers
decision_details: - The  Secretary  to  the  Ministry  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  was  instructed  at  the  Cabinet  meeting  held  on  2024-05-22  to  estimate  the  salary  to  be  paid  for  a  plantation  worker  per  day,  giving  due  consideration  to  the  cost  of  living  and  the  impact  caused  by  the  economic  crisis  which  has  arisen  in  the  country  recently.  And,  it  was  also  decided  at  the  Cabinet  meeting  to  appoint  a  committee  to  determine  the  capacity  of  each  Regional  Plantation  Company  to  pay  the  said  remuneration.  The  Cabinet  decided  to  expedite  the  process  of  enacting  necessary  legislation  to  cancel  the  Land  Lease  Agreements  entered  into  by  the  Government  with  the  Regional  Plantation  Companies  which  do  not  pay  the  due  remuneration  to  their  plantation  workers,  inspite  of  having  the  capacity  to  do  so  based  on  the  recommendations  of  the  said  committee.

title: Amendment  to  the  Constitution  of  the  Democratic  Socialist  Republic  of  	Sri  	Lanka
decision_details: - It  is  observed  that  there  is  an  inconsistency  among  Article  30(2),  Article  62(2)  and  Article  83(b)  of  the  Constitution  regarding  the  term  of  Office  of  the  President  and  the  duration  of  Parliament.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  to  prepare  a  draft  for  the  Constitution  to  amend  Article  83(b)  of  the  Constitution  by  substituting  the  words  “to  over  six  years”  with  the  words  “to  over  five  years”  to  avoid  doubt  and  eliminate  any  inconsistency  in  that  regard,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Appraisal  of  the  Public  Servants  of  Non-Executive  Service  Category	reported  for  duty  on  08th  and  09th  July  2024  without  engaging  in  	Trade	Union  Actions
decision_details: - The  Trade  Unions  of  certain  services  of  Non-Executive  Service  Category  of  the  Public  Service  have  announced  trade  union  actions  of  taking  sick  leave  and  enagaging  in  strike  on  2024-07-08  and  09.  However,  it  is  observed  that  some  public  servants  have  understood  the  current  situation  of  the  country  and  performed  their  responsibility  for  the  country  in  a  manner  that  does  not  cause  inconvenience  towards  the  public.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  to  grant  a  special  salary  increment  which  is  not  applicable  for  the  calculation  of  pension,  to  the  public  officials  of  the  Non-Executive  Service  categories  who  reported  for  duty  on  both  08th  and  09th  July  2024, without engaging  in  trade  union  actions  causing  inconvenience  towards  the  public and  to  issue  a  special  certificate  of  commendation  to  all  of  them  to  be  used  for  future  promotions,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Establishment  of  new  Settlement  Villages  in  the  Plantation  Sector
decision_details: - Since  the  communities  living  in  the  existing  housing  settlements  in  the  plantation  areas  are  not  systematically  receiving  the  services  provided  by  the  Government  institutions  at  village  level,  the  necessity  of  converting  the  plantation  housing  settlements  into  settlement  villages  has  been  identified  in  order  to  treat  them  with  respect  and  dignity.  Accordingly,  it  is  expected  to  introduce  a  new  legislation  to  amalgamate  the  plantation  housing  settlements  and  line  rooms  currently  found  in  the  plantation  areas  and  convert  them  into  villages.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  to  instruct  the  Legal  Draftsman  to  prepare  a  Bill  for  the  same,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: The  First  Programme  of  Cooperation  in  the  fields  of  Education,  	Science,	Culture,  Mass  Media,  Youth  and  Sports  between  Sri  Lanka  	and  	Romania
decision_details: - The  Government  of  the  Democratic  Socialist  Republic  of  Sri  Lanka  and  the  Government  of  Romania  have  entered  into  an  agreement  in  order  to  promote  cultural  cooperation  between  the  two  countries.  According  to  the  said  agreement,  the  relevant  parties  have  agreed  for  the  First  Programme  of  Cooperation  in  the  fields  of  Education,  Science,  Culture,  Mass  Media,  Youth  and  Sports.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Acting  Minister  of  Foreign  Affairs  to  sign  the  Memorandum  of  Understanding  on  the  implementation  of  the  said  Programme  of  Cooperation  during  the  official  visit  to  Romania  to  be  made  by  the  Minister  of  Foreign  Affairs,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Protection  of  Occupants  Bill
decision_details: - The  approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  at  the  meeting  held  on  2023-09-04  to  introduce  a  new  law  with  the  aim  to  protect  the  rights  of  the  tenant  and  the  landlord  equally  after  repealing  the  Rent  Act,  No.  7  of  1972.  Accordingly,  the  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman  has  received  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  General.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Justice,  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  thereafter  present  the  same  for  approval  in  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: An  Act  to  repeal  Rent  Act,  No.  7  of  1972
decision_details: - The  approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  at  the  meeting  held  on      2023-09-04  to  prepare  a  Bill  to  repeal  the  Rent  Act,  No.  7  of  1972.  Accordingly,  the  Bill  prepared  by  the  Legal  Draftsman  has  received  the  clearance  of  the  Attorney  General.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Justice,  Prison  Affairs  and  Constitutional  Reforms  to  publish  the  said  Bill  in  the  Government  Gazette  and  thereafter  present  the  same  for  approval  in  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Mid  -Year  Fiscal  Position  Report  -  2024
decision_details: - In  terms  of  the  Section  10  of  the  Fiscal  Management  (Responsibility)  Act,  No.3  of  2003,  the  Minister  in  charge  of  the  subject  of  Finance  is  required  to  table  the    Mid-Year  Fiscal  Position  Report  in  Parliament  and  release  the  report  to  the  public  by  the  last  day  of  the  month  of  June  in  year  2024.  Accordingly,  Mid-Year  Fiscal  Position  Report  has  been  published  on  the  website  of  the  Ministry  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  to  table  the  said  Report  in  Parliament,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Launching  the  "Vidyawardhana/Arivezhchi/Empower  STEM"  Teacher  Training  Programme  for  Teachers  in  the  Plantation  Sector
decision_details: - The  Government  of  India  has  agreed  to  provide  a  grant  of  Rs.3  billion  for  the  implementation  of  projects  identified  to  improve  the  living  conditions  of  the  plantation  community.  As  one  of  the  projects  under  the  same,  it  has  been  identified  to  provide  the  necessary  facilities  to  encourage  to  pursue  the  subjects  of  Science,  Technology,  Engineering  and  Mathematics  (STEM)  among  the  students  in  the  plantation  community.  Accordingly,  the  joint  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Education  and  the  Minister  of  Water  Supply  and  Estate  Infrastructure  Development  to  implement  the  "Vidyawardhana/Arivezhchi/Empower  STEM"  Teacher  Training  Programme  to  meet  the  severe  dearth  of  qualified  STEM  teachers  in    schools  in  the  plantation  sector,  under  the  said  project,    was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Designating  Businesses  as  Secondary  Businesses  of  Strategic  Importance
decision_details:
- The  Proposals  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Investment  Promotions  to  designate  the  following  businesses  as  Secondary  Businesses  of  Strategic  Importance  under  the  provisions  of  the  Colombo  Port  City  Economic  Commission  Act  No.  11  of  2021  and  to  grant  exemptions  and  incentives  proposed  through  the  Acts  stated  under  Schedule  II  of  the  above  Act  to  the  said  businesses  and  to  publish  the  Orders  for  the  same  through  the  Notifications  published  in  the  Government  Gazette,  were  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Submission  of  Regulations  to  Parliament  for  approval
decision_details: - The  Money  or  Value  Transfer  Service  Providers  Regulations  No.  1  of  2024  under  section  17  of  the  Payment  and  Settlement  Systems  Act,  No.  28  of  2005  to  be  read  with  section  11  therein  have  been  published  through  the  Gazette  Extraordinary  Notification  No.  2382/11  dated  2024‑04‑30.  The  Proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Finance,  Economic  Stabilization  and  National  Policies  to  submit  the  said  Regulations  to  Parliament  for  approval,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Commemoration  of  the  100th  year  after  the  establishment  of  Berlin  	Buddhist  Centre  in  Germany
decision_details: - A  centenary  celebration  is  scheduled  to  be  held  in  Berlin  to  mark  the  100  years  of  the  establishment  of  the  Buddhist  Center  in  Berlin,  Germany  by  the  year  2024.  In  parallel  with  the  said  centenary  programme,  arrangements  have  been  made  to  conduct  a  programme  centering  Colombo.  The  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  Prime  Minister  to  launch  the  book  'Das  Buddhistische  Haus  (1924-2024)'  printed  by  Vijitha  Yapa  Publishers  and  to  issue  a  Commemorative  Stamp  by  the  Department  of  Posts  -  Sri  Lanka,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Introduction  of  a  Special  Provisions  Act  to  provide  for  re-registration  of  Companies  incorporated  or  registered  under  the  Companies  Act  No.  7  of  2007
decision_details: - The  procedures,  operations  and  other  requirements  relating  to  companies  operating  in  Sri  Lanka  are  indicated  under  the  Companies  Act  No.  7  of  2007  and  the  number  of  companies  incorporated  or  registered  under  the  said  Act  is  approximately  199,484  as  at  2024‑03‑31.  Since  there  are  no  provisions  in  the  existing  Act  to  identify  the  active  number  of  companies  out  of  the  companies  which  are  currently  incorporated  or  registered  under  the  said  Act,  it  has  been  identified  that  it  is  appropriate  to  enact  a  new  law  for  that  purpose.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Industries  to  introduce  a  new  law  to  provide  for  re-registration  of  Companies  incorporated  or  registered  under  the  Companies  Act  No.  7  of  2007  and  to  instruct  the  Legal  Draftsman  to  prepare  a  Bill  based  on  the  Concept  Paper  prepared  for  the  same,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Supply  of  Equipment  of  High-Quality  Radiotherapy  with  High  Energy  Radiation  for  Cancer  Patients  in  Sri  Lanka
decision_details: - An  Agreement  has  been  entered  into  between  Electra  Ltd  UK  and  the  Ministry  of  Health  in  the  year  2013  for  the  supply  of  14  Linear  Accelerators  (LINAC)  machines  under  two  phases,  utilized  for  cancer  treatments.  Accordingly,  the  first  phase  of  the  said  project  has  already  been  implemented  whereas  the  second  phase  of  the  same  has  not  yet  been  implemented.  Since  many  important  features  which  are  standards  of  modern  cancer  treatments  utilized  at  present  are  not  available  in  the  specifications  of  the  Initial  Agreement  signed  in  2013,  a  proposal  has  been  submitted  by  Oncologists  in  Sri  Lanka  to  secure  upgraded  machines.  Accordingly,      the  Cabinet  granted  its  approval  to  upgrade  the  LINAC  machines  provided  to  the  National  Hospital  of  Kandy,  National  Hospital  of  Karapitiya,  Teaching  Hospital  of  Jaffna  and  the  Teaching  Hospital  of  Batticaloa  under  the  first  phase  and  to  secure  the  modern  Radiotherapy  equipment  for  05  Hospitals  of  Rathnapura,  Badulla,  Hambanthota,  Anuradhapura  and  Kurunegala  under  the  second  phase  within  the  Medium  Term  Budgetary  Framework  2024‑2026  on  priority  basis,  taking  into  consideration  the  proposals  submitted  by  the  Minister  of  Health  and  based  on  the  recommendations  submitted  by  the  Oncologists  and  those  of  the  Technical  Evaluation  Committee.

title: Obtaining  Ambulances  for  the  1990  Suwa  Seriya  Foundation  as  Free  	Grants
decision_details: - "1990  Suwa  Seriya  Foundation"  was  commenced  utilizing  297  Ambulances  obtained  from  TATA  Sons  (Pvt)  Ltd  under  a  grant  of  the  Government  of  India  in  the  year  2016  to  provide  pre-hospital  care  and  emergency  treatments.  At  present,  322  Ambulances  including  25  Ambulances  granted  by  the  Government  of  Sri  Lanka  have  been  deployed  for  the  same.  As  per  the  target  of  the    Suwa  Seriya  Foundation,  450  Ambulances  and  25  Back-up  Ambulances  are  required  to  provide  the  service  expeditiously  and  it  has  been  identified  that  there  is  a  shortage  of  150  Ambulances  at  present.  Accordingly,    TATA  Sons  (Pvt)  Ltd  of  India  has  agreed  to  provide  50  Ambulances  as  a  free  grant  whereas  the  Asian  Development  Bank  is  in  agreement  to  provide  45  Ambulances  as  a  grant.  As  such,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Health  to  take  necessary  action  to  obtain  the  said  Ambulances  to  the  "1990  Suwa  Seriya  Foundation",  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Expansion  of  the  Sisu  Seriya  Service  Project  implemented  by  the  National  Transport  Commission
decision_details: - The  National  Transport  Commission  has  started  the  Sisu  Seria  Project  since  2005,  with  the  aim  of  providing  a  more  reliable  bus  service  under  a  concessionary  fare  system  so  that  school  children  can  come  to  school  punctually  without  mental  or  physical  discomfort  and  go  home  safely  after  completing  their  educational  activities.  Under  that  project,  students  are  transported  by  the  the  Sri  Lanka  Transport  Board  and  private  buses.  1,537  Sisu  Seriya  bus  services  are  currently  operating  covering  all  the  district  in  Sri  Lanka,  providing  transportation  facilities  to  about  one  lakhs  of  school  children  per  day.  As  students  are  charged  only  half  of  the  bus  fare  under  the  project,  subsidy  payments  will  be  made  at  the  rate  of  Rs.105/-  per  kilometer  for  a  maximum  of  110  kilometers  per  day  to  compensate  for  the  loss  incurred  to  the  bus  operator.  The  requests  made  by  the  parents  and  schools  who  have  not  been  able  to  secure  private  transport  facilities  and  are  economically  distressed  owing  to  the  increase  of  fuel  prices,  have  been  increased.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Transport  and  Highways  to  allocate  provisions  amounting  to  Rs.202  million  required  to  start  500  new  Sisu  Seriya  bus  services  in  the  year  2024  from  the  revenue  earned  by  the  National  Transport  Commission,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Establishing  60  smart  classrooms  in  selected  Plantation  Schools  located  in  Nuwara  Eliya,  Kandy  and  Badulla  districts
decision_details: - Approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  at  the  meeting  held  on  2023‑12‑18  to  enter  into  a  Memorandum  of  Understanding  with  the  Government  of  India  in  order  to  implement  the  project  of  the  Construction  of  60  smart  classrooms  in  selected  Plantation  Schools  located  in  Nuwara  Eliya,  Kandy  and  Badulla  districts,  under  the  financial  assistance  of  the  Government  of  India  and  the  contribution  of  the  Government  of  Sri  Lanka.  Taking  into  account  the  practical  problems  of  implementing  the  said  project  targeting  only  Advanced  level  students,  it  has  been  decided  at  a  discussion  held  with  the  officials  of  the  Indian  High  Commission,  the  Ministry  of  Education,  the  Department  of  External  Resources  and  the  Department  of  National  Budget  to  remove  the  said  restriction.  Accordingly,  the  Cabinet  noted  the  information  furnished  by  the  Minister  of  Water  Supply  and  Estate  Infrastructure  Development  that  relevant  measures  are  taken  to  implement  the  project  by  amending  the  said  MoU.

title: Providing  a  land  plot  in  Kollupitiya  area  to  Expo  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Limited  for  a  housing  project
decision_details: - In  the  year  2007,  approval  of  the  Cabinet  has  been  granted  under  the  provisions  of  the  Urban  Development  Authority  Act  for  the  dispossession  of  a  plot  of  land  in  extent  of  40  perches,  at  Sea  Avenue,  Kollupitiya  belonging  to  the  Urban  Development  Authority,  to  Expo  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Limited,  on  a  long  term  lease  basis  of  50  years  and  an  amount  equivalent  to  25%  of  value  of  the  said  land  has  also  been  charged.  However,  due  to  the  presence  of  an  unauthorized  occupant  of  that  land,  the  land  has  not  been  transferred.  Expo  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Limited  has  requested  asking  the  entire  land  of  52  perches  also  including  12  perches  located  adjacent  to  the  land,  on  99  years    lease  basis  for  the  implementation  of  a  housing  development  project.  For  the  purpose,  approval  of  the  the  Board  of  Management  of  the  Urban  Development  Authority  has  been  received.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Urban  Development  and  Housing,  to  transfer  the  said  land  plot  to  Expo  Property  Developers  (Pvt)  Limited,  on  99  years  lease  basis,  on  the  current  assessed  value  of  the  Chief  Government  Valuer,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Development  of  a  water  retention  land  portion  located  adjacent  to  Buthgamuwa  Road,  Rajagiriya,  as  an  Urban  Park
decision_details: - The  Sri  Lanka  Land  Development  Corporation,  under  the  Greater  Colombo  Flood  Control  Project  to  minimize  flooding  in  the  area  around  Colombo  and  Sri  Jayewardenepura  Kotte,  has  acquired  marshy  land  plots  in  Colombo,  Sri  Jayewardenepura  Kotte,  Kolonnawa,  and  Kaduwela  divisional  secretariat  divisions,  to  the  Government  to  keep  them  as  water  retention  areas.  Certain  parties  are  attempting  to  utilize  the  water  retention  lands  located  adjacent  to  Buthgamuwa,  Rajagiriya  road  acquired  accordingly,  for  unauthorized  constructions  and  other  purposes,  and  it  seems  that,  it  is  suitable  to  utilize  such  lands  for  appropriate  development  purposes  under  the  guidance  of  the  Sri  Lanka  Land  Development  Corporation,  without  causing  a  harm  to  the  purposes  behind  taking  them  over  while  preserving  the  same.  Accordingly,  Cabinet  approved  the  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Urban  Development  and  Housing  to  call  for  proposals  to  develop  a  plot  of  land  identified,  as  an  Urban  Park  with  income  generating  sources,  by  obtaining  the  contribution  of  the  private  sector  as  well.

title: Implementation  of  the  Green  Hydrogen  Technology  for  Development
decision_details: - The  Green  Ammonia  which  is  a  value  added  product  of  Green  Hydrogen  has  been  identified  as  an  eco-friendly  alternative  to  conventional  fossil  fuels  for  the  transportation  of  energy  over  high  seas  for  long  distances.  The  demand  for  merchant  Green  Ammonia  which  can  be  used  to  carry  energy  is  being  significantly  increased  in  the  global  market.  It  has  also  predicted  that  the    demand  will  increase  to  billions  of  tons  by  2030.  Sri  Lanka  has  a  great  potential  to  be  established  as  a  green  energy  producer,  exporter  and  a  regional  energy  hub  due  to  its  unique  geographical  advantages  such  as  the  facts  that,  it  boasts  abundance  of  renewable  energy  resources  and  its  close  proximity  to  East-West  naval  route.  Therefore,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Investment  Promotion  to  appoint  a  project  committee  comprising  of  the  representatives  of  relevant  institutions  to  evaluate  the  investment  proposals  of  the  private  sector  regarding  green  hydrogen/ammonia  production  and  submit  recommendations  to  the  Cabinet,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Multi-Sectoral  National  Action  Plan  to  address  Sexual  and  Gender-based  Violence  in  Sri  Lanka  -  II  (2024  -  2028)
decision_details: - Multi-Sectoral  National  Action  Plan  to  address  Sexual  and  Gender-based  Violence  in  Sri  Lanka  has  been  implemented  with  an  intergrated  approach  during  the  period  of  2012-2020  in  Sri  Lanka,  since  policy  interventions  are  needed  to  ensure  the  right  to  live  in  a  just  and  violence  free  society  for  women,  men,  children  and  all  gender  identities.  During  the  follow  up  and  evaluation  process  carried  out  regarding  the  impact  of  the  said  Action  Plan,  the  need  of  a  new  national  action  plan  has  been  identified.  Accordingly,  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  President  in  his  capacity  as  the  Minister  of  Women,  Child  Affairs  and  Social  Empowerment  to  implement  the  Multi-Sectoral  National  Action  Plan  to  address  Sexual  and  Gender-based  Violence  in  Sri  Lanka  -  II  (2024  -  2028)  which  has  been  prepared  seeking  the  views  of  all  relevant  stakeholder  institutions,  was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.

title: Construction  of  the  Historical  Kelani  River  Udakukkepa  Seema  Malaka
decision_details: - The  Kalyani  Samagri  maha  Sangha  Sabha  of  Shyamopali  Maha  Nikaya  of  Mahavihara  ancestry  is  performing  its  rites  of  higher  ordination  for  more  than  150  years  in  the  Udakukkepa  Seema  Malaka  which  has  been  temporarily  constructed  on  the  Kelani  River.  Considering  the  high  cost  and  also  the  labour  that  may  take  in  constructing  the  said  temporary  Seema  Malakaya  in  each  year,  the  Sangha  Sabha  has  decided  to  construct  a  permanent  Uposathagaraya  at  the  Kalyanawanshikaramaya  owned  by  the  said  Sanga  Sbha  located  adjacent  to  the  Kelani  River  in  Wennawatta.  Taking  into  account  the  proposal  made  by  the  Hon.  Prime  Minister  on  this  matter,  Cabinet  decided  to  grant  its  approval  to  construct  the  historical  Kelani  River  Udakukkepa  Seema  Malaka  building,  based  on  the  recommendations  and  consultations  of  the  Department  of  Irrigation.

title: Implementing the “Work Culture” Project to motivate Sri Lankan young	entrepreneurs and workforce
decision_details: - The National Youth Services Council has prepared a project proposal for the implementation of the "Work Culture" Project, a national initiative, designed to uplift the economy of Sri Lanka by enhancing the productivity and efficiency among the youth. This project is expected to be implemented from June to August 2024 and aims to promote productivity, recognize excellence, engage youth, encourage a working culture and sustain motivation among Sri Lankan youth. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the “Work Culture” Project to motivate young Sri Lankan entrepreneurs and workforce through the National Youth Services Council from the funds allocated to the Presidential Secretariat under the Youth Development Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Third Amendment of the Assistance Agreement No.383-128 signed with the Government of the United States of America
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of the United States of	America have entered into an Assistance Agreement on 2022-08-31 to obtain a	Grant to finance the “Programme for a Democratic, Prosperous and Resilient	Sri Lanka” and has granted USD 9.069 million to Sri Lanka accordingly. The	value of the grant has been revised up to USD 28.299 million in 2023, in 02	occassions.The United States Agency for International Development (USAID)	has proposed to further increase the value of the Grant up to USD 52.835	million. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity	as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to	amend the Assistance Agreement by increasing the Grant Fund under the	“Programme for a Democratic, Prosperous and Resilient Sri Lanka” up to USD 	52.835 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting “Wigamanika Harasara” Programme
