decision_details: - Migrant workers were requested to contribute at least USD 500 million per month	through legal channels to reduce the trade deficit faced by Sri Lanka in early 2022.	Based on the positive response given by the migrant workers to that request, the	worker remittances have been raised up to USD 11 billion during the period from	June 2022 to May 2024. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Labour and	Foreign Employment to implement a programme named as “Wigamanika Harasara”	in appreciation of the great contribution	made by the migrant workers during the	finance and economic recession.

title: Obtaining Asian Development Bank Funds to implement the Power Sector	Reforms and Financial Sustainability Programme
decision_details: - Initial discussions have been held between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Asian Development Bank for the implementation of the Power Sector	 Reforms and Financial Sustainability Programme. The proposed programme consists of 03 sub‑programmes and it is expected to receive a loan amount of	USD 300 million by USD 100 million for each sub-programme. The	proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to obtain a USD 100 million loan from the Asian Development Bank to finance the proposed sub‑programme‑01 for the implementation of institutional structural reforms in the Ceylon Electricity Board and the Lanka Electricity Company (Pvt) Ltd., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Comprehensive Strategies to uplift the Small and Medium Scale Enterprise Sector in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Micro, Small and Medium Scale Enterprises make a direct contribution for generating employment, fostering innovation and for economic growth in Sri Lanka. Due to the economic difficulties faced by Sri Lanka in the past period, the Micro, Small and Medium Scale entrepreneurs were severely affected. Therefore, taking into account the need to province investment and working capital assistance to revitalize those entrepreneurs, the Government has taken steps to implement a number of strategies. Accordingly, the project for re‑empowerment of the Micro, Small and Medium Scale Enterprises sector has been implemented under Asian Development Bank funds, in order to implement the loan projects in the Small and Medium Scale Enterprise sector and about 40 billion rupees have been allocated for the year 2024 for the same. In addition, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑02‑24 for the implementation of an Incentive Loan Scheme worth 20 billion rupees with the aim of re-energizing the Micro, Small and Medium Scale entrepreneurs as well. It is planned to allocate 02 billion rupees from the said provisions and implement a special loan scheme for women entrepreneurs as well by creating a Revolving Fund and the said loan scheme is scheduled to be implemented from 2024‑07‑01. The information presented by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies was considered by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No.15 of 1958
decision_details: - The Employees' Provident Fund has been established by the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No. 15 of 1958 for the social security of the private and semi‑government sector employees who are not entitled to a pension. It has been identified the necessity of amending the said Act to increase the number of members covered by the Act in accordance with the current socio-economic changes and to provide quality and efficient service to the members to suit the present. The proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill based on the initial Draft prepared accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Criminal Procedure (Special Provisions) Bill
decision_details: - The Criminal Procedure Amendment Act, No.25 of 2024 has been passed in Parliament on 2024‑05‑31 in order to provide for Judges to take into account the time spent by an accused in custody prior to his conviction as a part of his sentence for the offense for which he is convicted. However, since the above Bill does not apply to persons convicted prior to the passage of the said amendment Act, it has been identified that a mechanism to take into account the time spent in custody prior to their conviction or pending determination of the appeal is needed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minster of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to introduce a special provisions law to execute the powers vested with the President under Article 34 of the Constitution so as to take necessary action with regard to the said convicted persons as well, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Orders made under the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021
decision_details:
- As per the Cabinet decisions dated 2024‑03‑25 and 2024‑04‑08, the companies named Codegen Innovation (Pvt) Ltd, Port City BPO (Pvt) Ltd, IVIVA PTE Ltd, Echelon Trade (Pvt) and 99X Technology AS, have been designated as Secondary Businesses of Strategic Importance and the proposed exemptions or incentives to such businesses have been published through Orders in the Government Gazette. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to table the following Orders issued under section 53 of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No.11 of 2021 in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	Order published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2378/35 dated 2024‑04‑05.

*	Order published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2380/36 dated 2024‑04‑19.

*	Order published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2380/33 dated 2024‑04‑19.

*	Order published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2380/35 dated 2024‑04‑19.

*	Order published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2380/34 dated 2024‑04‑19.

title: Obtaining additional allocations for youth development activities implemented by the Youth Services Council
decision_details: - The National Youth Services Council has planned to implement programmes such as creating one million young entrepreneurs, guidance on national and global labour market, conducting youth camps at Divisional Secretariat Level and conducting National Youth Conferences in view of empowering patience, self - esteem and a sense of purpose among youth, equipping them with the skills needed to cope with life's challenges successfully and making maximum use of opportunities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to conduct the said programmes and to grant the provisions required for the same to the National Youth Services Council, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of 934 Rainwater Harvesting Tanks in Jaffna District by the Government of India
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2016‑10‑25 to sign a Memorandum of Understanding with the Government of India to construct 3,000 rainwater harvesting tanks in the District of Jaffna using the funds offered by the Government of India to supply clean potable water in the said District. Even though the project was scheduled to be completed within a period of 03 years, due to the financial and technical problems which have arisen, the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022‑10‑10 has decided to extend the project period up to June 2024 and to install 1,831 PVC rainwater tanks instead of ferro-cement tanks. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to establish 934 water harvesting tanks using the remaining funds under the Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Quality Council
decision_details: - The necessity of establishing a National Quality Council has been pointed out through the National Quality Policy submitted in the year 2016, the National Quality Infrastructure Strategy 2018-2022 and the National Export Strategy of Sri Lanka 2018-2022. At present, National Quality Institutions and other National Quality Regulatory Agencies are functioning as independent institutions under the scopes of various Line Ministries. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to appoint a Working Committee with the representations of the relevant Line Ministries and National Quality Institutions to implement the proposal for the establishment of the National Quality Council, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the Renewable Energy Purchase Tariff under the Standardized Power Purchase Agreement
decision_details: - A Standardized Power Purchase Agreement should be entered into under a technology-based, Cost-reflective Feed in Tariff System pertaining to the Renewable Energy Projects with a capacity of 10MW or less as per the Sri Lanka Electricity Act, No. 20 of 2009 and its subsequent amendments. Accordingly, although approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2023‑03‑13 to implement a variable renewable energy purchasing tariff, only a few developers have signed the Agreement for that purpose. Therefore, a Committee comprising of representatives from the Ministry of Power and Energy, the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, the Ceylon Electricity Board, the Sustainable Energy Authority of Sri lanka and the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has been appointed in order to obtain recommendations on the renewable energy tariff calculation. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to accept the price calculation formula submitted by the said Committee and to implement the proposed tariff revisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting a portion of Land in Kalmunai with the Urban Development Authority
decision_details: - Kalmunai town is one of the main service centres in the Ampara district and it is considered as an administrative, trade and commercial centre of the province. According to the Development Plan for the Kalmunai Municipal Council area, the coastal area of Kalmunai has been designated as a suitable area for tourism and recreational activities, but it has been recognized that the facilities available in the town are not adequate for tourism and recreational activities. Accordingly, in order to meet such requirements, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to take over a plot of land in extent of 01 rood 29.44 perches located in Rest House road in the coastal area of Kalmunai to the Urban Development Authority for a project to construct a Tourism Facility Centre, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Handing over the Henry Pedris Ground to the Isipathana College for Sports Activities
decision_details: - Non‑availability of a permanent playground to the Isipathana College, Colombo where there are many talented players, has become a severe impediment to improve the skills of such players. Therefore, an Agreement was reached between the two parties in the year 2016 to use the Henry Pedris Ground owned by the Colombo Municipal Council to the sports activities of the Isipathana College, and the period of the said Agreement has ended in the year 2017. By handing over the Henry Pedris Ground to the Isipathana College, it can be properly improved and maintained and it will pave the way to productively utilize the said ground for the sports activities of the students of the College and also surrounding schools as well as the people of the area. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to hand over the Henry Pedris Ground to the Isipathana College, keeping the name of the ground unchanged, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project on sustainable and efficient Electric Mobility System in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The United Nations Environment Programme, an organization accredited by the Green Environment Fund, has granted US$ 1.09 million for the implementation of the project on Sustainable and Efficient Electric Mobility System in Sri Lanka. According to the project implementation plan, the Ministry of Environment has been identified as the National Designated Entity. However, since the scope of the project falls under the Ministry of Transport and Highways, the Ministry of Transport and Highways has the ability to take necessary measures to implement the project more efficiently together with all the relevant parties. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways, for the Ministry of Transport and Highways to become the executing agency of the said project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project Agreement between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the Swiss State Secretariat for Economic Affairs on Global Textile and Clothing Programme
decision_details: - It has been proposed to enter into a Project Agreement between the Swiss State Secretariat for Economic Affairs and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board to implement the second phase of the Global Textiles and Clothing Programme for Sri Lankan Textile and Clothing Sector. By entering into the said Agreement, Sri Lanka will be able to obtain the support of the Global Textiles and Clothing Programme for a transformation of Textile and Apparel Industry based on the shift towards quality green products by promoting digitization. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to sign the said agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocating a plot of land for the establishment of the Mahabage Police Station
decision_details: - The Mahabage Police Station which serves nearly 50,000 people living in 08 Grama Niladhari Divisions, is currently maintained in a small plot of land in extent of 21.5 perches bordering the Colombo - Negombo main road. Under this backdrop, due to the facts that there is no suitable place for vehicle parking and to keep court productions in safe custody, inadequate barracks and non availability of quarters for the officers, both the general public and the serving police officers encounter severe difficulties. Therefore, the proposal made by the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government to allocate a plot of land in extent of 40 perches from the land where the Wattala divisional Secretariat Division has been previously established for the development of required facilities for the said police station, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Economic Empowerment of Women in the Micro, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (MSME) Sector
decision_details: - It has been observed that, in Sri Lanka, participation of women in economic activities is lower than other regional and Asian countries due to various reasons. According to the Sri Lanka Labour Force Survey conducted in the year 2022, out of the economically active population, 35% is women and it shows a significant disparity in the gender contribution rates of economic participation. Limited financial literacy and the factors such as that women do not have property or other collateral required for obtaining loans and lack of opportunities to access financial resources have been identified as the main obstacles encountered by women entrepreneurs in Sri Lanka. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement a special loan scheme in order to remove barriers preventing women from entering economic activities, utilizing Rs. 02 billion, out of Rs.20 billion which has been allocated to re-energize Micro, Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (MSME) Sector by the Cabinet decision dated 2024‑02‑26, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Mediation Boards Act, No.72 of 1988
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023‑09‑25 to amend the section 7 of the Mediation Boards Act, No.72 of 1988, in order to overcome administrative issues such as unavailability of constituted or functioning mediation boards or delay in issuing the Certificate of Non‑settlement by the Mediation Board and to fulfill the requirement of not preventing the parties from resorting to the Court of Law, in the event both parties accept that there is no settlement. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared the amending Bill and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the National innovation Agency Act No. 22 of 2019
decision_details: - National innovation Agency established in the year 2022 makes national policies and submits recommendations pertaining to social, science and technology, defence, eco and service innovations. According to the present day needs, the necessity of introducing several amendments to the the National Innovation Agency Act No.22 of 2019 has arisen in order to achieve the objectives of the institution. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Completion of the remaining works of the Construction Projects of the Sri Lanka Police
decision_details:
- Although a number of construction projects have been started with the aim of providing the necessary infrastructure for the Sri Lanka Police, the following projects scheduled to be completed in the years 2021 - 2023 could not be completed as expected due to the spread of COVID - 19 pandemic in the year 2020 and the economic crisis which has arisen in the country:

*	Project for the construction of Married Quarters for Junior Police Officers at Kumaran Ratnam Road, Colombo 02.

*	Project for the construction of Resident Building at the Katana National Police Academy.

*	Project for the completion of remaining works of the building in the Kollupitiya Police Station.

	The proposal made by Minister of Public Security to revise the total cost estimate 	and to extend time period of completing projects up to 2024‑2027, so as to 	complete the remaining works of the said projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Term Contract for the procurement of four (04) shipments of Gas Oil (0.05% M.S.)
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from the registered suppliers for the term contract for the purchase of four (04) shipments of Gas Oil (0.05% M.S.) to Ceylon Petroleum Corporation for the period from 2024‑08‑01 to 2024‑12‑31. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the contract for the purchase of four (04) shipments of Gas Oil 280,000 Bbls+/-5% during the relevant period to M/s Zhongxi Energy Development (Ningbo) Co. Ltd., China, based on the recommendation made by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee after evaluating the bids received accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 200MW Natural Gas Fired Internal Combustion Engine Power Plant with Duel Fuel Capacity at Kerawalapitiya
decision_details: - Project of 200MW Natural Gas Fired Internal Combustion Engine Power Plant with Duel Fuel Capacity at Kerawalapitiya is a project identified by the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan 2023-2042 approved by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka. The land area adjacent to Kerawalapitiya Sobadhanavi Limited has been allocated for this project and it is expected to develop this power plant as an Independent Power Producer under the built‑own‑operate‑transfer (BOOT) basis for 20 years. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to identify a suitable investor by following the Competitive Bidding Procedure for the relevant task, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renewal of Warranty, Operation and Maintenance Contract at Thambapavani Wind Power Station
decision_details: - Full commercial operations of the Thambapavani Wind Power Station belonging to the Ceylon Electricity Board have been commenced on 2021‑05‑18. The Ceylon Electricity Board has signed a Contract Agreement with Vestas Wind Lanka (Pvt) Limited for securing warranty, operations and maintenance service of the said Power Plant for a period of three (03) years and the contract period of the said Agreement has expired on 2024‑05‑17. As such, a new service supplier is required to be selected for the said activities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to select a suitable service supplier, following the Competitive Bidding Procedure, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of Diyagama Mahinda Rajapaksa Sports Complex
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2024‑01‑08 to get the construction works of the new sub-projects that are currently being implemented and proposed to be implemented, done by the Sri Lanka Army. Accordingly, it has been planned to construct the roofs of the junior pavilion of the said ground and the second pavilion of the new athletics playground. The proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to get the said construction work done by the Sri Lanka Army, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 75th Anniversary of Sri Lanka UNESCO partnership
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka-UNESCO partnership completes its 75th anniversary in this year, and in order to commemorate the anniversary, the Sri Lanka UNESCO National Commission, the Ministry of Education, other relevant Ministries and Institutions have planned to implement several programmes together. The proposal made by the Minister of Education to conduct the 75th anniversary celebration on 2024‑07‑16 at Nelum Pokuna theatre, with the objectives of commemorating the 75 years partnership and achievements with UNESCO, promoting the tourism industry by making the both local and international community aware on the UNESCO listed cultural heritage in Sr Lanka, further increasing the existing awareness between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the project period of the Gandara Fishery Harbour Construction Project and revision of the Total Cost Estimate
decision_details: - Approval of the cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2019‑07‑07 for the construction of a Fishery Harbour at the existing Gandara landing site. Although the project was supposed to be completed by December 2023, owing to the Covid-19 pandemic and the economic crisis, constructions of the project could not be completed as expected. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to extend the period of the project from December 2023 to December 2026, enabling to complete all construction works including the shore facilities of the project as well; and to revise the total cost estimate based on price variations, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Introduction of Digital Technology for Pirivena Education
decision_details: - The Ministry of Technology together with the Ministry of Education have planned to implement a programme to empower the pirivena education by introducing digital technology for pirivena education. Through this, the teachers affiliated to the Pirivenas and Bhikkus/lay students will be able to utilize digital technology to explore and analyze the Sri Lankan national Buddhist heritage. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology, and the Minister of Education to implement the proposed programme so that at least two computers, a smart board and a printer can be provided for each pirivena, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Hingurakgoda Airport
decision_details: - It has been identified the necessity of developing the Hingurakgoda Airport, which is currently operated under the management of Sri Lanka Air Force, in accordance with the International Civil Aviation Standards. Accordingly, a committee consisting of the representatives of Sri Lanka Air Force, Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Pvt) Ltd. and the Road Development Authority has been appointed for the preparation of the Master plan for the above airport and other related tasks. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to take necessary action to develop the Hingurakgoda Airport as a fully-fledged Airport, as per the recommendations of the above Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Leasing out the land located at Rajagiriya which has been leased out to the Ceylon College of Physicians again, for a period of 50 years
decision_details: - A plot of land with an extent of 30 perches at Welikada, Rajagiriya owned by	 the Urban Development Authority, has been provided to the Ceylon College of Physicians for a period of 30 years with effect from 1999‑05‑13 on a concessionary lease basis for the construction of a building for research purposes. In view of the fact that the Head Office building of the Ceylon College of Physicians, which has been built in the above land, needs to be repaired and a considerable financial investment has to be made for it, the institution has submitted a request to provide the land in concern, back on lease basis for a longer period of time. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Acting Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide the relevant portion of land to the Ceylon College of Physicians for a period	of 50 years on long-term lease basis, based on charging an annual rent determined by the Chief  Government Valuer, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a plot of land located at Pitipana, Homagama to the Ceylon	Electricity Board
decision_details: - With the increase in the electricity requirement for urban development projects related to science and technology cities, the Ceylon Electricity Board has made a request to the Urban Development Authority to provide a portion of land from the land called Mahenawatta in Pitipana, Homagama to construct a grid substation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide the portion of land with the extent of 02 acres, 03 roods and 15.41 perches that has been identified, to the Ceylon Electricity Board based on the valuation of the Chief Government Valuer, on 30 year lease basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into an agreement on Educational Cooperation between Sri	Lanka and Vietnam for the period 2024 - 2026
decision_details: - The need for further development of bilateral cooperation in the field of higher education between Sri Lanka and Vietnam has been identified and serving that purpose, the two parties have agreed to implement the agreement that has been entered into during the period of 2017 - 2020, for the period of 2024 - 2026 with amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to enter into the Agreement on Educational Cooperation between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam as valid for the period of 2024-2026, with the objectives such as exchanging information and experience related to development and innovation in the field of higher education, conducting joint research, promoting bilateral cooperative programmes between universities and research institutes of both parties, exchanging scholarships for bachelor degree or postgraduate degree studies in the fields mutually agreed upon by the two parties and exchanging of students and scholars between universities/research centres of the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Mangrove Conservation projects through donations from the Commonwealth Blue Charter Project Incubator
decision_details: - In 2023, the Commonwealth Blue Charter Project Incubator has called for project proposals from Commonwealth countries to provide grants for the mangrove conservation. Two (02) project proposals submitted by Sri Lanka for this purpose have been selected by the Commonwealth Blue Charter Project Incubator. Accordingly, that institution has decided to grant donations for the Project of preliminary mangrove carbon stock assessments for Sri Lanka and the Project on a study on faunal pioneers to restore mangroves and mapping sea grass mangrove interphases using satellite and drone technology. The proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to implement the above projects through the Department of Wildlife Conservation and the Department of Forest Conservation under the supervision of the Ministry of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation and enter into relevant agreements accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a Pledge Loan Scheme at a concessionary interest 	rate	through Banks to purchase paddy for Yala season 2024
decision_details: - The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-01-08 to implement a Pledge Loan Scheme at a concessionary interest rate through Banks to purchase paddy for the Maha season 2023/24 and the Yala season 2024. Under this, a discussion has been held pertaining to the implementation mechanism of the Pledge Loan Scheme to purchase paddy for the Yala season 2024 under the chairmanship of a Deputy Secretary to the Treasury with the participation of representatives from relevant Ministries, Departments and State and Private Banks. According to the outcome of the above discussion, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to issue the Pledge Loan of Rs.6000 million to the Small and Medium Scale Paddy Millers, Paddy Storage Owners and Paddy Collectors at a concessionary interest rate through the participatory Banks in Yala season 2024 and take other related actions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchasing Pre-printed Policarbonate cards for printing National 	Identity Cards
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the recommendation of the Cabinet appointed Procurement Committee and the recommendations of the Procurement Appeal Board regarding the procurement carried out for the purchase of 05 million Pre-Printed Polycarbonate cards required for the printing of Identity Cards for the Department for Registration of Persons, it was decided to cancel the said procurement at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-05-06. Further, approval has been granted at that Cabinet meeting to purchase only the amount of cards essential to print National Identity Cards as a reorder from the previous supplier until a new procurement is carried out and a suitable supplier is selected, enabling to continue the process of issuing National Identity Cards without interruption. Accordingly, a Project Committee and a Cabinet appointed Negotiation Committee have been appointed to obtain the relevant recommendations on the quantity of cards to be purchased from the previous supplier and to evaluate the price proposal submitted by the supplier. The proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to purchase 2.3 million Pre-Printed Polycarbonate cards as a reorder from the previous supplier, Just In Time Technologies (Pvt) Ltd. based on the recommendations of the said Committees, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re-implementation of the continued programmes implemented under the 'Samata Sewana' housing programme during the period 2015-2019
decision_details: - Housing programmes, such as the Model Villages Programme, 'Visiri' Loan Programme, Gramashakthi Visiri Assistance, 'Visiri' Loan Assistance, 'Viru Sumithuru', Housing Assistance Programme for Families with Kidney Patients, Flood Relief Programme have been launched by the National Housing Development Authority during the period of 2015-2019 under the "Samata Sewana" housing programme, targeting the low-income community who are in need of a house and could not complete the construction of the houses. The construction continued in 229,580 housing units out of 387,520 housing units of which the constructions have been commenced under the above programmes and some of the said houses have been completed by non-governmental organizations, with various grants and by beneficiaries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to secure necessary provisions to complete the construction work of 45,117 housing units that have not yet been completed, on stage basis on priority, with the intervention of the National Housing Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Paving works of Jaya Container Terminal-V Yard in the Colombo Port
decision_details: - Plans relating to the paving of the Jaya Container Terminal - V of the Colombo Port have been prepared by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to call for National Competitive Bids and select a suitable institution for this work, and to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and a Technical Evaluation Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Printing and Supply of computerized draw lottery tickets for the Development Lotteries Board
decision_details: - National Competitive Procurement Process has been followed for printing and supply of lottery tickets of Lagna Wasanawa, Ada Kotipathi, Shanida, Super Boll, Jayoda, Kapruka and Sasiri for computer based draw, to the Development Lotteries Board. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to award the contract for the printing and supply of lottery tickets to Toppan Forms (Colombo) Ltd., DPJ Holdings (Pvt) Ltd. and Grand Export (Pvt) Ltd, for a period of one year, based on the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and the recommendation of the Procurement Appeal Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Plantation Youth Conference
decision_details: - The Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development has planned to hold a Youth Conference as a part of the National Programme to mark 200 years for the Sri Lankan Plantation Community(NAAM 200). The said Conference titled "Future Fusion" is scheduled to be held on 2024‑06‑22 at the Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology, Kandy with the participation of youth. The Conference is organized by the Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development in collaboration with AIESEC a voluntary organization comprising stakeholders including the University of Peradeniya, Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology and university students and youths. Simultaneously, the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce has agreed to hold a career fare. Cabinet noted the information submitted by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development in this regard.

title: Colombo International Film Festival - 2024
decision_details: - It has been planned to hold the 'Colombo International Film Festival' from 08th to 14th July of this year at Colombo, with the main objective of promoting global cinematography in Sri Lanka by creating a revival in the Sri Lankan film industry and also making Sri Lanka a tourist hub in South Asia by gaining high tourist attraction. This film festival will provide the opportunity to Sri Lankan audiences to watch movie masterpieces from many countries including Iran, France, India, South Korea, China, Japan and Germany that are awarded with local and overseas awards and also it paves the way for Sri Lankan students to gain a broad understanding and experience on the global cinematography. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media; and the Minister of Tourism and Lands to hold the said film festival under the initiative of the National Film Corporation and the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Admission of Children for Grade One of Schools - 2025
decision_details: - Admission of children to Grade One of schools are carried out in accordance with the circulars issued by the Ministry of Education so as to be minimized the malpractices with transparency ensuring the equitable access in education. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to amend the Circular Instructions which are currently in force, based on the experience gained in previous years and to admit children to the Grade One from the year 2025 and onwards as per the said amended Circular Instructions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cooperation between the Virginia Ports Authority and the Sri Lanka Ports 	Authority
decision_details: - The Virginia Ports Authority and the Sri Lanka Ports Authority have agreed to enter into a Cooperation Agreement on cooperation in sharing competences between ports under the 'Port and Maritime Skills Development Programme' jointly implemented by the United States Embassy in Sri Lanka and the Colombo Plan. Accordingly, enhancement of professional capabilities of the executive staff of both parties are mainly expected through the entry into the proposed Cooperation Agreement. The Proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to sign the Cooperation Agreement for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and 	the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia on Cooperation of Promotion of Direct 	Investment
decision_details: - Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia have agreed to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding with a view to attracting direct investment to the country through policy and legal reforms, provision of advance and integrated infrastructure, process reengineering etc. and improving the investment environment of both countries. Accordingly, the Cabinet noted the information presented by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion that the Minister of Foreign Affairs signed the relevant MoU during the Special Meeting of the World Economic Forum held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia on 28th and 29th of April, 2024.

title: Agreement on the Maritime Transport Cooperation among the Member Countries of the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC)
decision_details: - The Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) has decided to enter into an Agreement on the Maritime Transport Cooperation among its member countries. The proposal regarding the signing of the Cooperation Agreement for the same was submitted to the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑01‑08 by the Minster of Ports, Shipping and Aviation and an Officials' Committee was appointed to further examine the said proposal. Concurrence of the Cabinet was granted for signing the Agreement on the Maritime Transport Cooperation which will be prepared taking also into consideration the recommendations mentioned in the said Officials' Committee Report submitted by the Hon. President.

title: Final Budget Position Report - 2023 of the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies
decision_details: - Under section 13 of the Fiscal Management (Responsibility) Act No. 3 of 2003, the Report on the Final Budget Position is required to be submitted to Parliament and the General public prior to the expiry of 05 months after the end of the financial year by the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies. Accordingly, the Report on the Final Budget Position for the the year 2023 covering the fiscal policy, strategy and challenges in respect of managing the macroeconomy of Sri Lanka in the year 2023, economic trends in the year 2023, fiscal sector, real sector, domestic demand and supply, investment and savings, developments in the external and monetary sectors, inflation and global economic developments has been published on the website of the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies on 2024 05 31. The proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to table the said Report in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of a new Order under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017
decision_details: - An order has been enforced with effect from 2020 04 02 under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 in order to ensure the financial stability of the country by imposing temporary suspensions and limitations on outward remittances related to certain capital transactions made by residents during the period in which the forex reserves were depleting in the country. The said Order has been continuously issued from time to time with a validity period of 06 months, and the Order currently in force is valid until 2024 06 19. Issuance of a new Order for a period of 06 months to be effective from 2024 06 20 under section 22(1) of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 by further removing/relaxing certain suspensions/ limitations in order to facilitate resident companies to expand their businesses overseas, in particular, has been recommended by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to issue an Order under section 22(1) of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 in order to implement the said recommendation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the term contract for the procurement of 05 shipments of Gasoline 92 Unl
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to secure 1,5000,000 Bbls+/-5% of Gasoline 92 Unl to the said Corporation for a period of 06 months from 2024 07 15 to 2025 01 14. Based on the recommendation of the Standing Technical Evaluation Committee, the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee has awarded the said procurement to the M/s Aditya Birla Global Trading (Singapore) Pte. Ltd. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to the said company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.07 of 2024 and Standardization and Quality Control Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 to Parliament for approval
decision_details:
- Even though, importation of vehicles into Sri Lanka has been temporarily suspended in terms of the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 02 of 2023, as per a proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands, approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2024 04 01 to import 250 mini coaches and 750 vans for tourist transportation. Accordingly, in order to implement the said decision, Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.07 of 2024 have been promulgated under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969.
 
Further, Cabinet has granted approval on 2024 03 11 to impose Regulations enabling to facilitate expeditious, safer and effective trade flows as well as to ensure a level playing field for domestic products and imported products by canceling the Imports and Exports Control (Standardization and Quality Control) Regulations 2017 which had been imposed under the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 in order to establish standards and quality on importation of 122 categories of goods, classified under 217 HS Codes with a view to safeguarding the national economy, public health and environment. Accordingly, Standardization and Quality Control Regulations under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 have been promulgated. The proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the said Regulations published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notifications, to Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Consumer Affairs Authority Act, No.9 of 2003
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023 05 02 to draft a Bill to amend the Consumer Affairs Authority Act, No.9 of 2003. The Attorney General has submitted observations for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. The proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to instruct the Legal Draftsman to expeditiously complete the drafting process of the relevant Bill, based on the aforesaid observations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the New Immigration and Emigration Bill to Parliament
decision_details: - Even though the Immigration and Emigration Act, No. 20 of 1948 has been amended at many instances, the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022 12 12 has granted approval to introduce a new Act for the same, taking into account the rapid changes taking place in the field covered by the said Act, rapid development of technology as well as the international trends.  Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Penal Code to strengthen the legal provisions to prohibit sexual harassment and sexual assault
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022 12 12 to introduce amendments to the Penal Code by making sexual harassment and all forms of sexual assaults including in public places, a crime. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bill to establish the Institute for Food Science & Technology of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted to prepare a Bill to establish the Institute for Food Science & Technology of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared the relevant Bill and the Attorney General has proposed a number of amendments for the same. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to instruct the Legal Draftsman to expeditiously finalize the task of preparing the Institute for Food Science & Technology of Sri Lanka Bill by incorporating the said amendments as well, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Protocol of Agreement on Accession of the Republic of Uzbekistan to the World Trade Organization (WTO)
decision_details: - The Republic of Uzbekistan has been in the process of negotiating with other member countries to become a member of the World Trade Organization. The General Council of the WTO has established a Working Party to examine the application of Uzbekistan and submit to the General Council the relevant recommendations with a draft Protocol of Accession. Sri Lanka also has become a member of the relevant Working Party with the intention of exporting tea to Uzbekistan and the relevant officials in Sri Lanka have negotiated with the Uzbekistan officials in that regard and have reached the initial consensus on the lower binding tariffs for tea products anticipated to be exported to that country. Accordingly, Uzbekistan requires to sign the "Protocol of Agreement on Accession" with Sri Lanka being a member of Working Party, confirming that bilateral discussions were held as per the relevant provisions of the  World Trade Organization. The Proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to sign the said Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting the Gampola Old Court Complex land with the Urban Development Authority
decision_details: - It has been decided at the Udapalatha Regional Coordinating Committee Meeting to modernize the old Court building located at the land where the Gampola Court Complex had been housed without demolishing it and to develop the said premises as a car park. Approval of the the Board of Management of the Urban Development Authority has also been granted to implement a Mixed Development Project in the said land. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing in that regard, the Cabinet granted approval to vest the land where the Gampola Old Court Complex is located with the Urban Development Authority to implement a Mixed Development Project  and a public car park under the Gampola Town Development Project subject to the payment of the value determined by the Chief Government Valuer by the Urban Development Authority to the Consolidated Fund.

title: Establishment of 'District Industry Promotion Councils'
decision_details: - Regionally established micro, small and medium scale industries have to encounter many conflicts at present and the need for a more suitable, easily accessible and inclusive approach has been identified in order to create an enabling environment to face these challenges. Therefore, it has become essential to establish, network and promote strong linkages among all the relevant institutions enabling to provide quality and efficient institutional assistance and service delivery at the regional level for micro, small and medium scale industries through a multi-sectoral and integrated approach. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to establish 25 "District Industry Promotion Councils" covering the entire island and appoint a Steering Committee consisting of the representatives from the public sector, private sector and other relevant institutions to determine the structure, functions and responsibilities and to oversee the whole process of the above councils, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Tariff Policy of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Existence of a clear, simple, coherent and predictable tariff regime is a critical factor in maintaining a competitive environment for trade and investment within a country. The competitive environment for investments in Sri Lanka has been adversely affected due to the revision of the Tariff Policy according to the various policies introduced by the previous governments from time to time. Taking this situation into consideration, a Technical Committee has been appointed under the Chairmanship of the Director General of the Trade and Investment Policy Department of the General Treasury with the composition of members from the relevant agencies to prepare a National Tariff Policy as per the instructions of the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies. The Committee has prepared a National Tariff Policy under the guidance of trade experts and the Secretaries of the subject related Ministries in consultation with the Business and Industry Community. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the above National Tariff Policy under three (03) phases from January 2025 and publish the same through a Gazette Notification under section 101 of the Customs Ordinance with a view to ensure the stakeholders' awareness and compliance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of Import Control Regulations under Imports and Export (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 to enable the import of selected spices for reprocessing and re-exporting for businesses approved by the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka
decision_details:
- The Secretary, Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, the Secretary, Ministry of Investment Promotion and the Secretary, Ministry of Agriculture and Plantation Industries have been informed to re-review the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.03 of 2024 issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 and submit a Comprehensive Report, at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024 03 18. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the following recommendations included in the above Report, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Allow importation of selected spices for processing and re exporting for BOI approved enterprises under the Procedure for Importation and Processing of selected spices and re exporting in the form of oil extracts, Oleoresins and Spent.

*	Promulgate Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations under the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 for the above purpose.

title: Proposed Sri Lanka - Malaysia Free Trade Agreement
decision_details: - The significance of attracting export-oriented Foreign Direct Investment, diversifying exports and expanding market access for goods and services, has been identified in order to regain the economic stability in Sri Lanka. For that purpose, it is essential for Sri Lanka to further economic integration with countries having strong and strategic economies. Malaysia, a key member of the ASEAN and the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership, stands as the 34th export destination for Sri Lanka and value of the total exports to Malaysia in 2023 is USD 58.3 million. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to take into consideration the importance of entering into a Free Trade Agreement between Sri Lanka and Malaysia and initiate the negotiations for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to the communities who are affected by the flood situation	in Kolonnawa area
decision_details:
- The Hon. President has paid a visit to Kolonnawa area during the afternoon on 2024-06-03 to observe the situation faced by the people in Kolonnawa due to the heavy rain in the last few days. Taking into account the matters submitted by the communities of the region during the visit, the approval has been granted for the following proposals made by the Hon. President.

*	Providing food and other essential services to the people who are  affected by the floods in Kolonnawa area as well as to the people who are affected in other parts of the country.

*	Removal of illegal constructions that have caused flooding in the Divisional Secretariat Division, Kolonnawa, suspension of land filling activities and repairing the drainage systems of the area and taking other relevant measures.

* 	To appoint a committee chaired by the District Secretary of Colombo with the representatives from the relevant institutions to identify the possible root causes of the floods in the area and recommend measures to be taken to avoid such recurrences in future and to prepare a comprehensive development plan for the re-planning of the city of Kolonnawa by utilizing the available land within the territory of the Divisional Secretariat Division, Kolonnawa in the most productive manner.

title: Providing relief to the communities who are affected by the SouthWest	Monsoon
decision_details: - Thousands of families have become temporarily helpless due to heavy rains in many districts of the island, resulting in landslides, tree falls, floods andsevere damage to public infrastructure systems owing to the weather changes that are developing unexpectedly with the activation of the Southwest Monsoon this year. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to provide relief for the families who are affected and implement a prompt programme with immediate effect to restore the damaged public infrastructure facilities to a state of normality by obtaining the service of Triforces and Civil Security Forces and with the fullest  contribution of other relevant Ministries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Value Added Tax Act, No.14 of 2002
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon.President in his capacity as the Minister ofFinance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Value Added Tax Act, No.14 of 2002 to prevent the unintended effects of the removal of exemptions from the VAT Act, maintain clarity of the Act, implement the VAT reforms introduced by the Value Added Tax (Amendment) Act, No.32 of 2023 and to incorporate the amendments identified as recommended by the Temporary VAT Committee appointed as per the instructions of the Integrated Committee headed by the Committee on Public Accounts including the Committee on Public Finance, the Committee on Ways and Means, the Sectoral Oversight Committee on National Economic and Physical Plans and the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Alleviating the Impact of the Economic Crisis and other amendments identified from time to time based on various Cabinet decisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Enterprise Sri Lanka
decision_details: - After a review made with the assistance of experts, taking into account the international best practices, it has been identified the need to establish a consolidated agency for more effective management and development of small and medium scale enterprises. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion and the Minister of Industry to establish the proposed institution called "Enterprise Sri Lanka" as a single entity dedicated for small and medium scale enterprises through re-modeling the institutional and legal frameworks of the Export Development Board, the National Enterprise Development Authority, Industrial Development Board, Sri Lanka Export Credit Insurance Corporation and the Small Enterprise Development Division of the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs and instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for that purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Criminal Procedure Code
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑03‑07 has granted approval to amend the Criminal Procedure Code enabling to introduce the plea agreements to the legal framework in Sri Lanka with a view to resolving criminal cases expeditiously, minimizing the backlogs of cases by reducing delays in court proceedings and reducing prison overcrowding. According to the proposed amendment, the accused person and prosecution enter into an agreement where the accused will plead guilty instead of going to trial, in consequence of which, recommendation could be obtained to minimize sentence and reduce fine or restitution amount. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Criminal Procedure Code. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the relevant Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the Technical Assistance of the World Meteorological Organization to improve forecasts on high impact weather, flood, landslides and early warnings in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement the Climate Resilience Improvement Multi-Programmatic Approach funded by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development and the World Bank, under three phases over a period of 09 years. Skills, technology and infrastructure facilities are planned to be improved in the relevant institutions so as to forecast whether conditions accurately and early warnings as the first component of the said Programme which comprises of 5 components. By pursuing action accordingly, it is expected to forecast high risk whether and climate conditions swiftly and accurately and to minimize the estimated cost of US$ 313 million incurred annually by the Government for the post-disaster management. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to obtain the service of the World Meteorological Organization which is an international organization having a wide range of experience in the field of meteorology and hydrology along with the technical skill to upgrade the emergency disaster warning systems in order to implement the said component, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Progress of Mega Scale Development Projects by the end of First Quarter 2024
decision_details: - The Department of Project Management and Monitoring, having reviewed the performance related data and information submitted by the relevant Ministries pertaining to the financial and physical progress of the Mega Scale Development Projects being implemented by the Line Ministries by the end of First Quarter 2024, has submitted the Progress Report of the Mega Scale Developments Projects. According to the said Report, 171 Mega-Scale Development Projects are being implemented in the year 2024 and except 09 projects out of which, all other projects are planned to be completed by the end of the year 2026. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to complete the activities of 58 projects with more than 80% of physical progress in the year 2024 and to refer the currently suspended projects due to the lack of adequate provisions to the National Operations Room to carry out the necessary studies on the same prior to further investing on such projects, taking into consideration the necessity of completing the ongoing projects expeditiously so as to securing fiscal space for new capital projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting a block of land located in the New Town Ratnapura with the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council
decision_details: - Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council has made a request to the Urban Development Authority to provide a block of land to establish a Hela Bojun Hala close to the Provincial Council Complex in the New Town Ratnapura. A block of land in extent of 23.10 perches which has been acquired by the Urban Development Authority has been identified for the said purpose. The market value determined by the Chief Government Valuer for the said land has already been paid by the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council to the Urban Development Authority. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to release the said block of land to the Commissioner General of Lands enabling to transfer the same to the Sabaragamuwa Provincial Council through the Divisional Secretary, Ratnapura, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of a Public Private Partnership Programme on improving 	sport skills of school level athletes targeting the Brisbane Olympic Games 	in 2032
decision_details: - The Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs have planned to implement a joint programme with the support of the private sector and civil society in view of developing Sri Lanka as a "Medal Winning Country" at the Brisbane Olympics 2032. Similarly, It is expected to provide the opportunity to the talented athletes to participate in the Olympics to be held in Los Angeles in 2028 and achieve a significant level of performance. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Education and the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to implement the proposed programme to achieve those objectives, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reforming the Education Administration System for Drastic Transformative Change in Education
decision_details:
- The National Education Policy Framework 2023-2033 prepared in accordance with the vision of "a fully developed Sri Lanka by the year 2048" aiming to provide equal opportunities and quality education to each and every student in the country, has presented facts about the transformative change that should take place in education. Accordingly, the need for a new transformation in the organizational structure, curriculum and evaluation method has been identified to ensure a long-term learning methodology. Accordingly Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Education for taking necessary action as follows, with a view to establishing an appropriate administrative structure for the efficient and effective implementation of the overall educational reforms, based on the recommendations of the Cabinet Sub-Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of the Hon. President regarding the preparation of the National Education Policy Framework:

*	Classification of schools in compliance with the international standards.

*	Establishment of 09 Educational Reform Units in the 09 provinces.

*	Increasing the number of Zonal Education Offices from 100 to 122 in stages, based on a scientific and priority order.

*	Establishment of 350 School Boards also including the existing 314 Divisional Education Offices aiming to ensure the school supervision, 	monitoring teachers and verifying the validity of school-based evaluations.

*	Designating one or more selected secondary schools as leading schools and inclusion of the entire school system into 1,220 school clusters of which a single cluster school contains approximately 8‑12 numbers of schools.

*	Recruitment of required officers for the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service and Teacher Advisors' Service.

title: Implementation of the Article 6 of the Paris Agreement in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Paris Agreement, which is a legally binding international treaty on climate change, has been adopted by 196 parties at the 21st Conference of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (COP21) held in 2015 in Paris, and Sri Lanka has signed the said Agreement in 2016. The main objective of the Paris Agreement is to maintain the increase in the global average temperature to well below 02 degrees Celsius above the pre-industrial levels and to limit the temperature increase to 1.5 degrees Celsius above the pre-industrial levels. As per the provisions of the said Agreement, the Parties should implement "Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs)", for which 02 market mechanisms have been introduced. It paves the way for the countries to bilaterally exchange the outcomes of greenhouse gas mitigation, to report such exchanges of greenhouse gas and to utilize them to achieve the Nationally Determined Contributions of the partner countries. Further, it has been introduced a new international carbon crediting mechanism through this Agreement. Under that situation, Sri Lanka is preparing Carbon Market Strategy and Guiding Principles with the technical support of the Regional Collaboration Centre, Dubai of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, and it is expected to complete the work by the end of this year. In the meantime, various project developers have submitted project proposals related to the main sectors of electricity, industry, waste management, transport, agriculture and forestry identified by Sri Lanka to mitigate greenhouse gas emissions. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Environment to appoint a Committee chaired by the Secretary, Ministry of Environment to evaluate the said project proposals and reach decisions until the Carbon Market Strategy and Guiding Principles are implemented, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Removal of the requirement of Import Control License for importation of selected edible grains
decision_details: - As of 2024‑05‑01, selected edible grains and commodities which have been classified under 126 HS Codes, have been subjected to the Import Control License whereas issuance of import control license relating to 53 HS Codes has been suspended as of now. In this backdrop, it has been found appropriate to remove the requirement of Import Control License for importation of grains in order to achieve the multiple objectives of eliminating black-market operation, illicit importation of grains, preventing the inflated retail price in an unfair and unjust manner and ensuring affordable price to the consumer and protection of domestic production by imposition of appropriate rate of duties and quarantine procedures. Accordingly, taking into account the recommendations made by a Committee chaired by the Secretary to the President and comprising of the Members of the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka; Secretary to the General Treasury and the Senior Economic Advisor to the President, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to remove the requirement of Import Control License for importation of green gram, black gram, cow peas, kurakkan, flour of soya beans and ground nuts while taking necessary measures so as to protect the local manufacturers, subject to  submission of the National Plant Quarantine Permit of the National Plant Quarantine Service and based on the recommendations of the Ministry of Agriculture and Plantation Industries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Committee to deal with the salary anomalies in the Public Sector
decision_details: - Taking into account the representations made from time to time by the various employee categories in the Public Service and the relevant Trade Unions pertaining to the prevailing salary anomalies among said employee categories, the Cabinet decided to appoint a Committee of Experts to examine the said salary anomalies and submit a Report enabling to rectify those anomalies through the Budget for the year 2025.

title: Amending the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act, No.2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act, No.3 of 2018
decision_details: - During the preparation of the Economic Transformation Bill, it has been found the necessity of introducing consequential amendments to the Anti‑Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act, No.2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act, No.3 of 2018. The Bills for that purpose have been prepared by the Legal Draftsman and the Attorney General has given clearance for those Bills. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to publish the Amendment Bills for the Anti‑Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act, No.2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act, No.3 of 2018 in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for the approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Receiving financial Provisions to Construct the General Hospital and the 	Hospital for Children in Biyagama, Gampaha
decision_details: - As the demand for healthcare services in the Gampaha district is increasing day by day, the need to improve the healthcare service system in the said district has been identified. For that purpose, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑02‑12 to construct a general hospital and a hospital for children equipped with all modern facilities under a public - private partnership approach and to take over 02 plots of land called Millagahawatta and Delgahawatta (07 acres and 03 roods) in the Biyagama Divisional Secretariat division, based on the assessed value of the Government. Sontell Group Hong Kong International Limited has submitted a proposal expressing its willingness to provide the necessary funds for the construction of the proposed hospital. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Health to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the said Institution and the Government of Sri Lanka to secure funds for construction of the said hospital, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Compulsory Retirement Compensation Scheme to be implemented with 	the amalgamation of Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited (CFC) and 	Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Limited (CCFC)
decision_details: - Under the Compulsory Retirement Compensation Scheme to be implemented for the employees relating to the amalgamation of Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Limited, 267 employees have expressed their consent to retire. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to implement the Compulsory Retirement Compensation Scheme to be implemented for the employees relating to the amalgamation of Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited and Colombo Commercial Fertilizer Company Limited and incur Rs.844 million from the funds of the two fertilizer companies in order to implement the proposed Compulsory Retirement Compensation Scheme, subject to the recommendations of the Officials' Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Prime Minister regarding the retirement of excess employees of State Owned Enterprises under the oluntary Retirement Scheme.

title: Subjecting the Samurdhi Community Based Banks and Samurdhi	Community Based Banking Societies to the Government Audit
decision_details: - 1,092 Samurdhi Community Based Banks and 335 Samurdhi Community Based Bank Societies are functioning throughout the country for the promotion of microfinance activities. These Community Based Banks and Community Based Bank Societies are audited annually by the Internal Audit Division of the Department of Samurdhi Development as per the provisions of the Samurdhi Act and the provisions mentioning that they should be audited by the National Audit Office are not included in the Samurdhi Act. It has been identified that through auditing the Samurdhi Community Based Banks and Samurdhi Community Based Bank Societies by the National Audit Office as well, will enable them to maintain transparency in their operations and develop credibility and recognition. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to amend the Samurdhi Act, No.1 of 2013 amended by the Divineguma (Amendment) Act, No.2 of 2017 imposing provisions for that purpose and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Settling the outstanding statutory dues of Sri Lanka State Plantation	Corporation, Janatha Estates Development Board and Elkaduwa	Plantation 	Company Limited
decision_details: - More than 2,000 cases are pending in the courts of various provinces due to the non-payment of outstanding statutory dues by Sri Lanka State Plantation Corporation, Janatha Estates Development Board and Elkaduwa Plantation Company Limited. Since the earnings of these institutions are not sufficient to pay the said outstanding statutory dues, it has been identified that it is appropriate to provide the required cash amount for that purpose as a loan by the General Treasury and recover the relevant loan in installsments from the earnings of these institutions. After fully settling the total contribution of the Employees' Provident Fund by these institutions, the Commissioner General of Labour has the ability to reduce the surcharge payable with regard to that amount, in accordance with the provisions of the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No. 15 of 1958. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to provide necessary funds from the General Treasury for the payment of outstanding statutory dues of the institutions, Sri Lanka State Plantation Corporation, Janatha Estates Development Board and Elkaduwa Plantation Company Limited and to instruct the Commissioner General of Labour to reduce the maximum amount that can be deducted from the surcharges to be paid by the said institutions as per the provisions of the Employees' Provident Fund Act, No. 15 of 1958 after settlement of the outstanding statutory dues, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Hosting the 60th Session of the International Coconut Community (ICC) and Ministerial Meeting in Sri Lanka in the year 2024
decision_details: - It has been proposed to host the 60th ICC Session and Ministerial Meeting in Sri Lanka in this year in order to achieve the objectives of increasing foreign exchange earnings, promoting Sri Lankan Coconut Industry among the member countries and improving collaboration among the key stakeholders of the coconut sector. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to host the said Session and the Ministerial Meeting in Colombo in November in this year with the contribution of revenue generated by the Coconut Development Authority and of the several private institutions in the coconut sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of infrastructure in the Wildlife Circuit Bungalows belonging 	to the Department of Wildlife Conversations
decision_details: - There are 52 Circuit Bungalows managed by the Department of Wildlife Conversations at present and it has been found necessary to develop the physical facilities in those Bungalows in order to provide more qualitative services through the said Bungalows. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to physically develop the said Circuit Bungalows so as to provide a high quality service, with the participation of private sector institutions and parties who are interested in voluntarily contributing to those activities, in a manner that does not contravene the provisions of the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to call for Expressions of Interest from the said parties and enter into Memoranda of Understanding with the parties selected accordingly and the Department of Wildlife Conservation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of Wages for Plantation Workers
decision_details:
- Although the Government has recently announced an increase in daily wage for plantation workers, some plantation companies have made representations to the Government on the inability to pay the increased wages. Taking into consideration the said situation, the proposal made by the Hon. President to take the  following measures, was approved by the Cabinet.

(i) 	To estimate the minimum wage be paid to a plantation worker by the 	Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, 	taking 	into account the current cost of living and the impact of the recent 	economic crisis.

(ii)	To appoint a Committee to examine the capacity of each Plantation 	Company 	on the payment of the salary so estimated.

(iii)	Further, if any company fails to pay salaries due to its poor management,	to 	take necessary action to introduce laws enabling to cancel the Land 	Lease 	Agreements entered into with such companies.

title: Amendments to the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act No. 2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act No. 3 of 2018
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024 05 13 to publish the Economic Transformation Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament. During the preparation of the said Bill, it has been found necessary to make consequential amendments to the the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act No. 2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act No. 3 of 2018. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Anti-Dumping and Countervailing Duties Act No. 2 of 2018 and the Safeguard Measures Act No. 3 of 2018, was approved by the Cabinet.
