The loan obtained under the proposed loan facility should be settled by the borrower in foreign currency remitted through legal channels during the period in which the borrower is engaged in a foreign employment and he/she would be able to pay it in Sri lankan Rupees after returning to the country having completed the foreign employment. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to implement the proposed Housing Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Holding of the International Sacred Bhagawath Geetha Festival in Sri Lanka in the year 2024
decision_details: - The Bhagawath Geetha Festival is held annually by the Kurukshetra Development Board of Haryana Pranth, India, to commemorate the series of events related to the Bhagawath Geetha, which is considered as the sacred book of Hindus and pay homage to the Bhagawath Geetha. In the recent	years,	the festival has also been held in foreign countries and it has been proposed to hold the International Sacred Bhagawath Geetha Festival of the year 2024 in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to hold the festival from 2024-03-01 to 2024-03-03 at the Nelum Pokuna premises with	the financial support of Kurukshetra Development Board, Haryana Pranth, India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Transport of Russia and the Ministry of Transport and Highways of Sri Lanka on the Development of Cooperation in Preparation and Retraining of Personnel in the Transport Sphere
decision_details: - During the official visit of the Minister of Transport and Highways to Russia recently, discussions have been held regarding the importance of entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Transport in Russia and the Ministry of Transport and Highways in Sri Lanka in order to develop cooperation between the two parties. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to sign the said Agreement between the two parties, subject to obtaining the clearance of the Attorney General's Department for the draft Memorandum of Understanding that has been prepared, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cessation of continuing a wildlife reserve area of the land section within the Madu	Road National Park, which was excluded from the reservation status by the Department of Forest Conservation
decision_details: - According to a proposal made through the Strategic Environmental Assessment of the Northern Province to upgrade the Madu Road Sanctuary as a National Park, the said sanctuary has been declared as a National Park by a Gazette Notification dated 2015-06-22  by removing certain settlements in the sanctuary and including adjacent forest sections. It has been decided that the paddy lands cultivated since a long period of time and the lands developed as settlements should be released from the Reserve, and accordingly, land content of 56.8 Hectares has been excluded from the reservation status by the Gazette Notification dated 2023‑08‑08. The proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to release the lands that was excluded from the reservation status by the Department of Wildlife Conservation following the procedure mentioned in the Fauna and Flora Protection Ordinance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Accession of Protocol relating to an amendment to the Convention on	International Civil Aviation
decision_details: - Sri Lanka has signed the Convention on International Civil Aviation (Chicago Convention) in 1948, and thus Sri Lanka has become a State party to that Convention. In the 25th  General Assembly of the International Civil Aviation Organization held on 1984-05-10 has approved the amendment of the Chicago Convention to prevent the use of weapons by States Parties against a civil aircraft in flight, and the said amendment came into effect on 1998-10-01. A Committee has been appointed to obtain recommendations regarding Sri Lanka's accession of Protocol relating to the amendment to the Chicago Convention (Article 3 bis), and the Committee has recommended that there is no obstacle for the accession of the said Protocol, since the Article 3 bis is included in the Schedule of the Civil Aviation Act No. 14 of 2010. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to access the Protocol (Article 3 bis) relating to the amendment to the Convention on International Civil Aviation signed in Montreal on 1984-05-10, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing Courses on Artificial Intelligence to the Education 	System
decision_details:
- During the deliberations regarding the introduction of courses on Artificial Intelligence to the Education System, at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑10‑02, it was decided that it is appropriate to introduce the proposed courses adhering to the recommendations made by the Task Force that has been appointed to prepare a National Strategy and a Plan on Artificial Intelligence. Accordingly, as a part of the relevant Strategic Plan, it has been planned to implement a pilot project to introduce courses on Artificial Intelligence in relation to General Education. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology; and the Minister of Education to implement the said pilot project as follows with the support of Microsoft Sri Lanka (Private) Limited, was approved by the Cabinet:
	*	Revising the international syllabuses executed by Microsoft Sri Lanka 	(Private) Limited at present as per the recommendations of the National 	Institute of Education and Commence a pilot project from grade 8 in 	the schools where the required basic human resources are available.

	*	Digitization of schools selected for the pilot project under the 	facilities provided by  Microsoft Sri Lanka (Private) Limited.

	*	Training 100 teachers who are teaching the subject of Information and 	Communication Technology, as trainers by Microsoft Sri Lanka 	(Private) Limited.

title: Setting up a National Hospital and a Hospital for Children in Biyagama, 	Gampaha
decision_details: - The Gampaha district functions as a key supply centre parallel to its rapid population growth and industrialization. As a result, the demand for health services is increasing and the need to establish a national hospital and a Hospital for children has been recognized to meet that demand. Accordingly, it has been planned to establish a national hospital and a hospital for children in the said district under the Public-Private Partnership Methodology. As such, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Health to acquire two plots of lands in extent of 7 acres and 3 roods in the Grama Niladhari Division of Biyagama North and implement the proposed project after providing basic infrastructure facilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Management of Commercial Plantations
decision_details: - In the budget speeches for the years 2023 and 2024, the Hon. President has pointed out that a large extent of lands belonging to the Government Plantation Institutions such as the Janatha Estates Development Board and the Sri Lanka State Plantation Corporation remains uncultivated or without a productive use over a long period of time owing to various reasons, such as legal issues, institutional conflicts, lack of capital, etc. It has been found appropriate to lease out such large-scale and underutilized lands to potential investors on long term basis for cultivation of exportable crops, establishment of livestock farms for export and production of other exportable goods and services. The Non-Cabinet Ministry of State Plantation Enterprises Reforms has prepared a programme in order to use such lands productively in a way that brings multiple benefits to the society by getting involved the local entrepreneurs for the same. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet was granted to the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the said programme.

title: Conducting Elections in 2024
decision_details:
- The Cabinet noted that the within the prevailing limited fiscal space of the Government, an amount of Rs.10 billion has been allocated in the Budget Estimates for the year 2024 to conduct elections and that the relevant expenditure pertaining to the Presidential Election and the General Election will have to be managed within the said allocation. 

	Further, the Cabinet observed that the required funds for conducting the Provincial Councils Election and the Local Government Election have to be provided through the Budget for the year 2025 within the available fiscal space of the Government. However, the Cabinet further noted that prior to conducting the said two elections in 2025, required amendments to the relevant laws, if found necessary, have  to be introduced in Parliament, based on the recommendations to be submitted by the Commission of Inquiry appointed in terms of the Commissions of Inquiry Act, No.17 of 1948 (Chapter 393) and  published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2354/06 dated 2023‑10‑16. 

	The Cabinet granted its concurrence to pursue required action based on the said facts presented by the the Hon. President.

title: Technologies Sri Lanka (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - Hon. Gamini Waleboda, Member of Parliament, has submitted the Technologies Sri Lanka (Incorporation) Bill to Parliament as a Private Members' Bill. It has been submitted to the Minister of Education to obtain a Report on the same as per the provisions of Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the said Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Amendments to the existing Foreign Exchange Regulations in 	order to implement the phase-out plan on exchange restrictions
decision_details: - Sri Lanka is committed to phase out administrative measures in reaching the balance of payments in the country a stable condition as per the Report of the International Monetary Fund on Sri Lanka. In keeping with that, the Governing Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka has recommended to implement measures under the phase-out plan for relaxation of exchange restriction pertaining to the prohibition on converting Sri Lankan Rupees into foreign exchange for certain current international transactions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the Regulations made under the provisions of section 7(1) of the Foreign Exchange Act, No. 12 of 2017 and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for providing full ownership to 50,000 low-income households under the Urban Home Ownership as per the Budget Proposals  2024
decision_details: - As per a Budget proposal 2024 presented by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, necessary actions have to be taken to stop charging of rentals for flats granted on rental basis to low-income families through Urban Housing Programmes and grant the ownership of those housing units legally to those beneficiary families themselves.  Under various housing projects, the Urban Development Authority, National Housing Development Authority and Urban Settlement Development Authority have provided houses on the basis of lease purchase, installment purchase, freehold and rent. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to stop charging the rental from all urban housing units provided to low income earners on monthly rental basis of Rs. 3000/- or less than that, and to take necessary action to transfer the freehold title of the houses to those low income earners, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of Cashew Nuts in Shell
decision_details: - Although the annual Cashew Nuts in Shell of the country is about 25,000 metric tons, currently only 12,500 metric tons can be procured locally. Due to the failure to yield the expected harvest in the last season, there has been a very unfavorable situation for the existence of the cashew industry in the country. Taking into account this situation, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to import  a maximum of 15,000 metric tons of  Cashew Nuts in Shell for this year; and thereafter to import a stock of  Cashew Nuts in Shell which is determined by a Committee comprised of the senior officers of relevant Ministries, for next 04 years, during the period from December to April, when the local cashews are not harvested, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of driving licenses for light vehicles for persons with total hearing impairment
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted its approval on 2022‑11‑14 to implement a pilot project centered on Gampaha district to provide driving license for light vehicles for people with total hearing impairment. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to take necessary action to issue driving license for light vehicles to the persons with total hearing impairment on bi-annual renewal basis so as to cover the entire Island, based on the outcome of the said pilot project and the recommendations of the Committee appointed under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Transport and Highways pertaining to the implementation of this project.

title: Declaring the 21st  of March as the National Seafarers’ Day
decision_details: - In order to appreciate the contribution made by seafarers to the local economy of Sri Lanka, it has been recognized that it is appropriate to declare a National Seafarers' Day. It will enable creating opportunities to earn foreign exchange  through attracting interested people for the maritime profession and to increase the contribution of the maritime sector to the national economy by improving the services of the maritime sector. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to declare the 21st  day of March  every year as 'National Seafarers’  Day', was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Accession to the 1988 Protocol of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974 (SOLAS) and the 1988 Protocol of the International Convention on Load Lines, 1966 as amended in 2003
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has contributed tremendously to the development of Sri Lanka as a Maritime Nation by ratifying 19 Maritime Conventions and Protocols over the past 40 years. Member States are required to comply with the Conventions of the International Maritime Organization  and in order to meet that requirement and to be able to include provisions for the 1988 Protocol of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, 1974 and the 1988 Protocol of the International Convention on Load Lines, 1966 as amended in 2003, measures have been taken to amend the Merchant Shipping Act, No.52 of 1971. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Services to access to the aforesaid Protocols by depositing the instruments of accession documents through the Ministry of Foreign Affairs along with the depositories related to the Protocols, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) grant funded 	promoting Autonomy, Literacy and Attentiveness through Market 	Alliances (PALAMA) Project in Sri Lanka - Phase II
decision_details: - In 2018, the Government of the United States of America has provided a grant of US$ 26 million to Sri Lanka through the United States Department of Agriculture and the 'Save the Children' institute to implement the Promoting Autonomy, Literacy and Attentiveness through Market Alliances Project. The said project is due to be completed by the second quarter of 2024, and the Government of America has taken action to provide a grant of US$ 32.5 million through the 'Save the Children' institute to implement its second phase. It has been planned to implement the second phase of the said project aiming to  bridge the short-term resource gaps within the Government-run “School Meals Programme”, improve the reading outcomes and literacy of school age children, promote good health and hygiene across schools and communities, strengthening of support systems and capacity building for sustainability. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to implement the said project after entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between the relevant parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strategy to promote Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses to achieve the	Sustainable Development Goals in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Purpose-driven enterprises that use commercially viable models to generate positive social and environmental impact ranging from green businesses and social enterprises to models empowering vulnerable communities are called Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses (ISBs). The inadequate access to information, skills training, partnerships, financial facilities and formal recognition for the existing Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses in Sri Lanka has constrained the growth and the positive impact of those businesses. As such, in supporting and facilitating the development of Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses, the need for specific strategies has arisen to integrate the provisions related to the promotion of Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses with the government policies related to national business, industry, finance and investment. Accordingly, the Sri Lanka Sustainable Development Council, with the support of the Trade, Investment and Innovation Division of the United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (UNESCAP) has obtained the views of all relevant parties and formulated “Strategy to promote Inclusive and Sustainable Businesses to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals in Sri Lanka". The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the said strategy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project Grant Assistance from the Government of Japan for the project for	stabilization of power supply using renewable energy at hospitals in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government of Japan has agreed to provide a project grant assistance amounting to Japanese Yen 1230 (approximately LKR 2.8 billion) through the Japan International Cooperation Agency to secure electricity	facility by installing solar power generation systems in Sri Jayawardenepura General Hospital, Kurunegala Teaching Hospital and Rathnapura Teaching Hospital. The objectives of this project are to minimize the usage of non-renewable energy in the health sector, enhance the overal efficiency of the health care sector and the promotion of sustainable development. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon.President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies with related to implementation of the said project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Disaster Management Plan - 2023-2030
decision_details: - The preparation and implementation of the National Disaster Management Plan in	terms of the provisions of the Sri Lanka Disaster Management Act, No.13 of 2005 is 	one of the foremost responsibilities of the Disaster Management Centre. 	Accordingly, the National Disaster Management Plan 2023-2030 has been prepared 	in compliance with the Sendai Framework of Action, the Sustainable 	Development 	Goals and the Conventions on Climate Change and in coordination with all the 	relevant agencies. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in 	his 	capacity as the Minister of Defence to table the National Disaster Management Plan 	2023-2030 in	Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Payment Scheme
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the ongoing Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Payment Scheme including the following amendments, was approved by the Cabinet.

    • to extend the beneficiary validity period for the vulnerable social category from 2024‑04‑01 to 2024‑12‑31 and for the transitional social category (whose income has temporarily decreased due to the economic crisis) from 2024‑01‑01 to 2024‑12‑31, from among the social categories eligible for Aswesuma.

    • to treat eight hundred thousand families as the vulnerable category with effect from 2024‑01‑01 by combining the existing vulnerable social category and the transitional social category (whose income has temporarily decreased due to the economic crisis) and to pay an allowance of Rs. 5000/- to those families from the said date to 2024‑12‑31. 

    • to pay a monthly allowance of Rs. 7,500/- for patients with chronic kidney disease of unknown etiology, Rs. 7,500/- for disabled persons and Rs. 3,000/- for elderly persons, who are in the family list of Aswesuma, after  an information verification process.

    • to increase payments to Rs. 7,500/- for patients with chronic kidney disease of unknown etiology, Rs. 7,500/- disabled persons and Rs. 3,000/- for elderly persons, who receive benefits at present and are registered in the waiting lists, to be effective from 2024‑01‑01 and to make these payments through District Secretaries/ Divisional Secretaries, outside the Aswesuma Programme. 

    • To call for applications for the second round in the first quarter of 2024 and conclude in the month of June 2024 and make payments from the month of July and revise the total number of eligible families up to a maximum  of 2.4 million in order to include additional eligible families.

title: Introducing legislation for resolving disputes among Government entities
decision_details: - It has been found necessary to introduce appropriate legal provisions so as to resolve disputes arising among Government entities expeditiously. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to 	prepare a Bill for that purpose in consultation with the Attorney General, was 	approved by 	the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Investment Infrastructure Corporation
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President to establish a statutory corporation in the name of  Investment Infrastructure Corporation to establish and manage the Investment Promotion Zones with a view to providing necessary integrated infrastructure facilities for investors and to vest with the said Corporation,  the responsibility for providing essential infrastructure facilities such as roads, electricity, water, and housing to the Investment Promotion Zones, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Agreement between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Kingdom of Thailand
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2018‑06‑19 to sign a  Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and Thailand. The clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Minister of Foreign Affairs have been received for the Air Services Agreement prepared thereafter incorporating  amendments submitted by the Thailand party. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to sign the proposed Bilateral Air Services Agreement between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Colombo Port City (Development Control) Regulations 	No. 1 	of 2023
decision_details: - Regulations have been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2358/70 dated 2023‑11‑17 by amending the Colombo Port City (Development Control) Regulations No. 1 of 2023 issued as per the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No. 11 of 2021, incorporating the plot subdivision, change of land use and few nontechnical corrections.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Acting Minister of Investment Promotions to submit the said Regulations to Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gazette Notifications for the approval of Parliament
decision_details: - The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to present the Order issued on 2023‑09‑21 imposing a tax of 10% on imported milk powder in terms of the provisions of the Ports and Airports Development Levy Act, No.18 of 2011 and the Order issued on 2023‑12‑19 in terms of the provisions of the Value Added Tax Act No. 14 of 2002 in relation to the increase of Value Added Tax from 15% to 18% with effect from 2024‑01‑01, for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Banking Act, No.30 of 1988
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Meeting held on 2023‑06-26 to prepare a Bill to amend the Banking Act, No.30 of 1988 by incorporating provisions enabling to strengthen existing regulatory standards in areas including bank licensing, bank ownership, consolidated supervision, capital and liquidity framework, large exposures and related party transactions, governance requirements, regulation and supervision of State owned banks. Clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the  the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, to present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.01 of 2024  to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - As a measure to ease the pressure on the foreign exchange market, the Government has temporarily suspended the importation of motor vehicles except construction vehicles and ambulances. However, the Cabinet had decided on 2023‑12‑11 to grant approval to the requests made by the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation; the Ministry of Health; the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment; and the Ministry of Education, to Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies respectively to import three (03) Economy Class Ramp Coaches for the use of Sri Lankan Airlines Ltd., to obtain three (03) mobile maternity units donated by the United Nations Population Fund and 21 double cabs supplied by the United Nations Children's Fund, to receive a motor vehicle for the use of Korean Funded Project supplied as per the Agreement entered into between Sri Lanka and the Republic of Korea in establishing the Employment Permit System and to receive 02 buses for the Science and Technology Human Resource Development Project funded by the Asian Development Bank. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 01 of 2024 made under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No.1 of 1969 and published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2366/19 dated 2024‑01‑11, to Parliament, for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Paddy Purchasing Programme for the Maha Season 2023/2024
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement a pledge loan scheme at a concessionary interest rate through State and Private Banks to purchase paddy for Maha season  2023/24. Accordingly, loan funds will be allocated based on the average production of each district in the Maha seasons of last 05 years. Under the proposed loan scheme, it is expected to issue pledge loans worth Rs.09 Billion. A maximum loan of Rs 50 million will be given to small and medium scale paddy millers and a maximum of Rs 25 million to paddy storage owners and paddy collectors. The loan repayment period is 180 days.  Out of the 15% annual total interest rate, 4% will be borne by the General Treasury. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the proposed paddy purchasing program, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commencing the Operations of the National Credit Guarantee Institution
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted its approval on 2021‑04‑27 to establish the National Credit Guarantee Institution with a view to providing relief measures for small and medium scale enterprises. As of now, the said institution has been incorporated as a public limited company and measures are being taken to obtain an amount of US$ 50 million from the Asian Development Bank as its initial capital. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to commence the operations of the National Credit Guarantee Institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Supply of Food items (fresh, dry rations and others) required	for Tri-forces for year 2024
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defense to award the procurement for the supply of food items (fresh, dry rations and others) for the Tri- Forces for the year 2024 at a total value of 84.2 Billion Rupees (without VAT) to the suppliers recommended by the Cabinet appointed Standing Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Wind Farm projects in Mannar Island
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2020-10-26 to implement a project to enhance electricity generation by installing 06 additional turbines by spending 47 million US Dollars under Asian Development Bank funds to operate a wind power plant in Mannar Island. However, it is not possible to utilize Asian Development Bank funds until the government's foreign debt restructuring programme is implemented. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to implement the said project by private sector investors who will be selected on competitive basis under the Build, Own and Operate (BOO) basis with an operational period of 20 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Export of Metal Stone subject to restrictive conditions
decision_details: - Due to the relatively low requirement of metal stones for construction and development activities in the country at present, the livelihoods of the miners engaged in the metal mining industry and the community associated with it have been severely affected. Taking that situation into consideration, it has been identified the appropriateness of implementing a short-term programme to earn foreign exchange for Sri Lanka through the export of metal stones subject to restrictive conditions. A stock of metal stones removed during the construction of Hambantota Magampura Port is currently remain heaped near the Administrative Building of the Port and in the Hambantota New Hospital premises and the said metal stock needs to be removed immediately. Considering a proposal made by the Minister of Environment, the Cabinet decided to grant approval to take the necessary steps for the immediate export of the said metal stocks under the supervision of the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau, and appoint a Committee to examine the matters on the possibility and appropriateness of exporting up to one million metric tons of metal stones and submit a report with recommendations.

title: Proposed Policy Support to the Presidential Secretariat by the Bill and Melinda	Gates Foundation
decision_details: - The Presidential Secretariat plays an important role within the ongoing reform programme by providing guidance on policy matters and monitoring government programmes. In performing this task, coordination with number of multilateral agencies suh as International Monetary Fund's Extended Fund Facility, World Bank's Development Policy Operation Programme, Asian Development Bank's policy assistance programme as well as engaging with various government and private sector stakeholders are carried out. Global Health Strategies, an international organization established by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, one of the largest charitable foundation in the world and Connect to Care, the local partners of Global Health Strategies  have agreed to act as on-ground partners for the Government of Sri Lanka, establishing a Programme Support Unit dedicated to assist the Presidential Secretariat with related to above programmes. An Executive Committee consisting of Senior officials will be established to create required coordination for proper implementation of various programmes carried out to assist the Government of Sri Lanka by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. The matters presented by the Hon.President on the proposed policy support to be given to the Presidential Secretariat by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation were considered by the Cabinet and it was decided to grant the concurrance of the Cabinet to take future actions in that regard.

title: International Institute of Theravadha (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - International Institute of Theravadha (Incorporation) Bill has been submitted to  Parliament as a Private Member's Bill by former President and current Member of Parliament Hon. Maithirapala Sirisena. The relevant Bill has been duly prepared by the Legal Draftsman and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the relevant Bill in terms of the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Kelaniya Buddhist Women's Charitable Society (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - The Kelaniya Buddhist Women's Charitable Society (Incorporation) Bill has been submitted to Parliament as a Private Member's Bill by Hon. (Ven) Athuraliye Rathana Thero, Member of Parliament. The clearance of Attorney General has been received for the preliminary Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the relevant Bill in terms of the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Penal Code
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meetings held on 2021‑01­‑18 and 2021‑06‑28 to introduce amendments to the Penal Code in order to amend the law on statutory rape in the Penal Code and fill the gaps in the law of rape and make the rape of boys a heinous crime. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, No.15 of 1979
decision_details: - Upon the recognition that it is not fair for the accused or appellants to languish in custody for a long period of time in addition to their period of sentence owing to the law's delays, approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Meeting held on 2023‑02‑20 to amend the sections 323(5) and 333(5) of the Code of Criminal Procedure, enabling to be considered the time spent in custody by the accused/appellant be remitted from the period of imprisonment required under his jail sentence. Accordingly, a Bill has been drafted by the Legal Draftsman and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Bills of Exchange Ordinance
decision_details: - Some of the provisions of the Bills of Exchange Ordinance No. 25 of 1927, which is currently in force, have raised some contentious issues, while some other provisions have become obsolete. Therefore, a Committee has been appointed under the chairmanship of President's Counsel Mr. Nihal Jayawardene to obtain recommendations on the amendments to be made to the Bills of Exchange Ordinance in order to clarify and improve the law of negotiable instruments. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, based on the recommendations containing in the Report submitted by the said Committee, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the  Bills of Exchange Ordinance No. 25 of 1927, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the support of the Fleming Fund of the United Kingdom to implement the National Strategic Plan on Combating Antimicrobial Resistance for Sri Lanka (2023-2028)
decision_details: - Antimicrobial Resistance has been identified as one of the top 10 public health threats faced by humans. In 2019, the World Health Organization has estimated that annually 1.27 million deaths are directly caused by drug-resistant bacteria due to the effect of antimicrobial resistance and 4.95 million deaths are associated with drug-resistant bacteria. In addition, the World Health Organization has recognized that antimicrobial resistance causes significant economic costs to the countries. Under this backdrop, the Fleming Fund aid programme managed by the Department of Health and Social Care of the United Kingdom supports about 25 countries in Africa and Asia to deal with antimicrobial resistance. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to take necessary action to implement the National Strategic Plan on Combating Antimicrobial Resistance 2023-2028 with the support of the Fleming Fund under that grant programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Cooperation Agreement between the Ministry of Health of Sri Lanka and the Latter-day Saint Charities (LDSC), United States of America
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions of the Agreement reached between the Ministry of Health and the Latter-day Saint Charities of the United States of America in order to obtain special wheelchairs for persons with spinal cord injuries, Sri Lanka has received a consignment of wheelchairs and other mobility aids as  donations. Upon a request made by the Ministry of Health considering the severe shortage of oncology pharmaceuticals existed during the recent past, the Latter-day Saint Charities has agreed to supply a stock of 13 types of such drugs to Sri Lanka as a donation through the registered suppliers of the National Medicines Regulatory Authority. Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to grant its concurrence to pursue action, based on the facts presented by the Minister of Health regarding the acceptance of the relevant donation, following the accepted procedure.

title: Vesting the National Cinnamon Research and Training Center at Palolpitiya, Thihagoda, with the Department of Cinnamon Development
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑08‑14 has granted approval to establish a new Department in the name of he Department of Cinnamon Development with effect from 2023‑09‑01. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to vest the National Cinnamon Research and Training Centre  falling under the purview of the Department of Export Agriculture at present with the newly established  Department of Cinnamon Development for its research activities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to vest the National Cinnamon Research and Training Centre and its all assets as well as all functions and duties carried out by  National Cinnamon Research and Training Centre, with the Department of Cinnamon Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining technical assistance under the "Sustainable Consumption and 	Production Outreach" implemented by the German Development 	Cooperation (GIZ)
decision_details: - 'Promoting public procurement practices that are sustainable in accordance with national policies and priorities' has been included as 7th sustainable development target under 'Ensuring Responsible Consumption and Production' identified as the 12th sustainable development goal by the United Nations. The Cabinet has previously granted approval for the National Policy on Green Procurement prepared to formally and adequately incorporate the green elements to the Government procurement process and to the National Framework on Eco‑Labeling prepared to implement for facilitating the identification of trustworthy green goods and services and for minimizing the practice of 'green washing' in the market. The German Development Cooperation has agreed to provide technical assistance under the 'Sustainable Consumption and Production Outreach' implemented in several Asian countries, for programmes scheduled to be implemented under the said policies. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to enter into an Implementation Agreement between the Ministry of Environment and the German Development Cooperation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of the Sri Lanka Thailand Free Trade Agreement
decision_details: - Improving the supply capacity, attracting export oriented Foreign Direct Investments and broadening market access for Sri Lankan goods and services have been identified as strategies to be essentially adopted for the growth of Sri Lankan economy. Accordingly, the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2018.01.16 has granted approval to initiate negotiations to enter into a Free Trade Agreement  with Thailand which is a largest economy and a largest outward investor in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). During the process of negotiations, the National Trade Negotiation Committee has consulted all relevant local stakeholders as well. Clearance of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs have been received for the complete draft Free Trade Agreement containing Preamble and 14 Chapters with Annexes which include enhancing trade and investments, conformity for domestic laws and regulations and facilitating the knowledge transfer, prepared after nine rounds of negotiations held between Sri Lanka and Thailand. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to sign the proposed Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement between both parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of the Cost of Living Allowance of the Government Employees
decision_details: - The Government had planned, through the Budget Proposals of the year 2024, to increase the Cost of Living Allowance of the government employees by Rs. 10,000/- from the month of January 2024 and to grant the said allowance from April 2024. Owing to the current difficult economic situation, various parties have requested to grant at least a part of that allowance within the first couple of months of the year. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to grant 50% of the increased Cost of Living Allowance viz. Rs. 5000/- to all government employees from the month of January 2024 and to increase some allowances paid to the Medical Officers and University Lectures, taking into account the pressure created by the economic situation prevailing in the country, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the Development of the Torrington Hockey Ground
decision_details: - Construction activities of the synthetic hockey playground located in Torrington have been carried out in the year 2009 and the turf of the said playground has become unfit for sports due to the expiration of time and the excessive use. The Asian Hockey Federation is in agreement to provide a synthetic hockey turf for the said playground free of charge. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs  to obtain the synthetic turf required for the Torrington Hockey Ground from the Asian Hockey Federation and to develop the said playground in accordance with  the international standards, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Poison, Opium and Dangerous Drugs (Disposal of court productions) Regulations of 2023
decision_details: - Under subsection (6) of section 77A of the Poison, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Ordinance, the Minister in charge of the subject of Justice has been vested with powers to prescribe by Regulations, the mechanism of disposal of court productions including a drug, substance, article or a preparation, with the concurrence of the Judicial Service Commission. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to submit  the Poison, Opium and Dangerous Drugs (Disposal of court productions) Regulations of 2023 published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2360/21 dated 2023‑11‑27, prescribing the mechanism of disposal of court productions including drug, substance, article or preparation as per the parameters of the law, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of 100,000 km of Alternative Roads, Bypasses and Rural Roads
decision_details: - It has been planned to improve 1,500 km of roads out of roads where the constructions have been initiated under the 100,000 km programme and  suspended at present, in the year 2024, to maintain the safety and transport compatibility. Rs. 20 billion has been estimated as the total cost for that purpose and it is scheduled to be completed the works within six (06) months in the year 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to implement the programme to make the selected roads suitable for transportation, within the period of first six months in the year, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of contract for Ground Handling Services of SriLankan Airlines Limited at Tokyo-Narita Airport (NRT), Japan
decision_details: - Bids have been invited following the limited international bidding procedure for the selection of a suitable service provider to provide ground handling services for the aircrafts of SriLankan Airlines Limited at Tokyo-Narita Airport, Japan and accordingly, 02 bids have been received. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the contract for the supply of  ground handling services at Tokyo-Narita Airport, Japan from 2024‑08‑01 to 2027‑07‑31, to  International Air Cargo Terminal Co. Ltd, the lowest evaluated substantially responsive bidder, as per the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Cooperation programme for 2023-2025 between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkmenistan
decision_details: - The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkmenistan have agreed to sign a Cooperation Programme for the period from 2023 to 2025. The objectives of this Cooperation Program are to promote, strengthen and expand bilateral relations including political, economic and cultural cooperation between the two countries, as well as focusing on issues of  mutual interest. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to implement the proposed Cooperation Programme between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Turkmenistan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re-opening of Sri Lanka Missions/Posts abroad
decision_details:
- It has been identified the need of re-opening the following Sri Lankan Missions which were temporarily closed during the period of 2021/2022 :

	(i)	Sri Lanka Consulate General in Cyprus, Nicosia,
	(ii)	Sri Lanka Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq,
	(iii) 	Sri Lanka Consulate General in Frankfurt, Germany.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to re-open the above-mentioned Sri Lankan Missions/Posts abroad, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Sri Lankan Embassy in Astana, Kazakhstan
decision_details: - In order to further develop the existing diplomatic relations between Kazakhstan and Sri Lanka, it has been recognized that it is appropriate to establish a Sri Lankan Embassy in Astana, Kazakhstan. The establishment of the  Secretariat of the Conference on Interaction and Confidence Building Measures in Asia (CICA) in Kazakhstan and Sri Lanka being a member of that Conference provide Sri Lanka a great opportunity to engage with the Central Asian Region. Also, since there it indicates a significant increase in tourist arrivals from Kazakhstan to Sri Lanka, the establishment of an embassy of Sri Lanka in Astana will help to further promote tourism and cultural cooperation between the two countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to establish the proposed Sri Lankan Embassy in Astana, Kazakhstan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of new Investment Zones
decision_details:
- In the Budget Speech 2022, it was emphasized the need to create an integrated mechanism between the public and private sectors to build up an export-oriented economy. Accordingly, it has been identified the appropriateness of developing the new Investment Zones as follows.

    • Establishment of new Investment Zones in the Northern, Eastern, North-Western and Southern Provinces.
    • Establishment of new Investment Zones in Mankulam, Paranthan Chemicals Company premises and Kankesanthurai Cement Corporation premises. 
    • Establishment of new Investment Zones in Iranawila and Trincomalee areas.
    • Expansion of the existing Investment Zones in Bingiriya and Hambantota.

The Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide technical assistance for the establishment of the proposed economic zones. Accordingly,  the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to develop the said Investment Zones based on a suitable Public-Private Partnership model, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a University of Science and Teachnology in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - With the objective of preparing the foundation to create a cadre of skilled	professionals to take the leadership in critical sectors of new scientific 	discoveries, technological  innovation and sustainable development, it has been 	identified the appropriateness of establishing a University of Science and 	Technology in collaboration with a renowned university in United States of 	America. Such a university will cater to utilize cutting-edge methodologies, 	foster global 	academic connections and create an environment for research and 	development. The  proposal made by the Hon. President to select one partner 	university from among several identified universities including UC Berkeley, 	UC Riverside, UC Davis, University of Michigan and establish the proposed 	University of Science and Technology as a Public-Private Partnership in 	collaboration with the said university, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Anuradhapura Maha Vihara Development Plan
decision_details: - Since the Maha Viharaya in Anuradhapura is a place with significant religious and historical importance in Sri Lanka, it has been identified the need to implement the exploration and conservation activities of the Maha Viharaya in a formal manner within a specific time frame. Accordingly, upon the notification of Hon. President,  Prof. Robbin Coningham, a senior foreign expert with international experience in the field of archaeology has submitted a project report on implementation of  the exploration, excavation and conservation project of the Maha Vihara. Through the said project report, it has been proposed to implement this project within a time period of 6 years from 2024 to 2029. The proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the exploration, excavation and conservation activities of the Maha Viharaya as per the project report of Prof. Robbin Coningham, jointly by the Presidential Secretariat and the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural affairs under the direct supervision of the Department of Archaeology and the Central Cultural Fund, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The recommendations submitted to the Hon. President by the Finance 	Commission for 2024
decision_details:
- Finance Commission has been established in terms of the Article 154R of the Constitution to assess the funds adequate for the Provincial Councils and to submit recommendations to apportioning the funds allocated for the Provincial Councils from the National Budget more meaningfully among the Provincial Councils  with the aim of achieving a balanced regional development in the country. The Cabinet granted approval for the following recommendations submitted to the Hon. President by the Commission for 2024.

    • Recommendations pertaining to the assessment of provincial capital and recurrent needs for 2024.
    • Recommendations pertaining to the apportionment of public grants among the Provincial Councils for 2024.
    • Policy recommendations pertaining to meaningful allocation of resources for the Provincial Councils and use of such resources more effectively.

      In addition, the Cabinet approval was also granted to submit the Report of the Finance Commission with recommendations submitted by the same Commission for 2024 to the Parliament in terms of the provisions of paragraph (7) of Article 154R of the Constitution.

title: Implementation of an International Application to Person (A2P) SMS Digital Hub
decision_details: - A2P is a communication model and an application, typically a computer programme or software that sends messages or notifications to individuals or end‑users. Short Message Service (SMS) is a critical communication medium for citizens, businesses and government agencies and is widely used for a various purposes, including business and transaction evaluations. These messages are delivered to a mobile device by an individual through an application or system, such as text messages (SMS), multimedia messages (MMS) or other forms of messaging. It has been observed that the widespread use of SMS services leads to fraud, spam and unauthorized activities. In order to face such challenges, it has been found the necessity of having a centralized SMS Firewall solution for the regulation of SMS exchanges. Accordingly, Infobip, a private company based in the United Kingdom, has submitted a proposal for the implementation of an international A2P digital SMS hub and the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint a Technical Committee comprising of representatives from the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policy, Ministry of Technology and the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka to evaluate the said proposal and submit recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of the Reforestation and Tree Cover Act
decision_details: - Under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, Sri Lanka has agreed to increase the forest cover of Sri Lanka to 32% of its total land area by the year 2030, and to increase the amount of carbon sequestrated by forests by 7% over the current situation. For that purpose, afforestation, replacement of degraded forests, and increase of forest cover in Government and private lands outside the forest are currently being carried out. These tree planting programmes are carried out with the participation of various parties, and although their benefits accrue to the entire nation, it has been recognized that the benefits of tree planting should be shared among all the parties who contributed to it, in order to encourage them. Currently, there are no legal provisions to provide products such as fruits, leaves, flowers, wood, resin obtained by tree planting in public places to the stakeholders who contributed to tree planting. Also, it has been identified the suitability of establishing a National Tree Planting Fund in order to have the support of the private sector, non-Governmental organizations and international organizations to obtain funds for the implementation of tree planting activities more effectively. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to introduce a new Act called "Reforestation and Tree Cover Act" incorporating provisions relating to the said tasks, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Electronic Transactions (e-Grama Niladari Information System) Regulations No.01 of 2022
decision_details: - The Electronic Transactions (e‑Grama Niladari Information System) Regulations No. 01 of 2022 made by the Minister of Technology under the provisions of the Electronic Transactions Act No.19 of 2006 have been published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2311/40 dated 2022‑12‑22. According to the said Regulations, facilities will be provided to use electronic documents and electronic records for the efficient delivery of services through the respective District Secretariats, Divisional Secretariats and the Grama Niladhari Officers. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to submit the said Regulation to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of 61 oil storage tanks in the Upper Tank Farm at China Bay, Trincomalee on Build, Operate and Transfer (BOT) basis Business Model
decision_details: - The Upper Tank Farm at China Bay, Trincomalee consists of 99 fuel storage tanks, and as decided at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑01‑03, approval has been granted to lease out 61 tanks from among them to Trinco Petroleum Terminal (Pvt.) Ltd., for a period of 50 years. The initial steps have already been commenced including carrying out a feasibility study for the development of said 61 oil tanks. The feasibility study has recommended to develop this project under 07 phases within 16 years, and under the first phase, it has been planned to refurbish 09 tanks which are economically viable, installation of a pipeline with a length of 1.75 km, and construct other allied facilities. It has been proposed to follow the business model of Build, Operate and Transfer (BOT) for the implementation of this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to follow the relevant procurement process in order to select a suitable investor to implement the proposed development plan to be carried out under the first phase, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Sri Lankan High Commission in Wellington, New Zeeland
decision_details: - In order to further develop the existing diplomatic relations between New Zealand and Sri Lanka, it has been recognized that it is appropriate to establish a Sri Lankan High Commission in Wellington, New Zealand and the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to proceed accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and the Russian Federation for the Cooperation of Sports
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has been granted on 2021‑07‑12 to sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) for Cooperation in Sports between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Russian Federation. However, due to the submission of several amendments to the said MoU after receiving the Cabinet approval, the Agreement could not be signed as expected. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the revised draft MoU incorporating the said amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transferring a portion of land in extent of 05 acres belonging to the Melsiripura Farm for construction of a playground
decision_details: - A request has been made to transfer a portion of land in extent of 05 acres from the Melsiripura Farm belonging to the National Livestock Development Board, to the Ibbagamuwa Pradeshiya Sabha for the construction of a public playground. Accordingly, the concurrence of the Board of Directors of the National Livestock Development Board has been received to allocate an extent of 05 acres from the Medamulla Division of the said farm. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to transfer the said land to the Ibbagamuwa Pradeshiya Sabha, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka for Cooperation on Ocean Country Partnership Programme
decision_details: - The Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is leading the global initiatives on ocean health at present. Accordingly, special attention has been given to establish a Euro 500 million 'Blue Planet Fund' and provide necessary funds from that to the partner countries in order to protect at least 30% of the global ocean by 2030 and to achieve marine protection and sustainable blue economy. The Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (DEFRA) in the United Kingdom has planned a range of programmes at bilateral and multilateral level to deliver the outcomes of the "Blue Planet Fund". Sri Lanka has been identified as a potential recipient country for assistance under the Ocean Country Partnership Programme which is one of programmes out of that. Accordingly, it has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding among the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland for the support of the Ocean Country Partnership Programme. The views have been obtained from other relevant Ministries and the Department of External Resources for the draft MoU for that purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to sign the said MoU, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the Technical Assistance from the Government of Federal Republic of Germany for the “Vocational Training in Sri Lanka Phase II Project”
decision_details: - The Federal Republic of Germany has agreed to provide a grant of Euro 7 million during the period of 2023 - 2026 for the implementation of the "Vocational Training in Sri lanka Phase II Project" with a view to further developing the technical, vocational education and training sector in Sri Lanka. the Deutsche Gesellschaft fur Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmBH functions as the implementing agency for the said project on behalf of the Federal Republic of Germany. An Agreement is scheduled to be signed between the GIZ Institute and the Ministry of Education for the implementation of the proposed Project and the observations of the Department of External Resources and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the the clearance of the Attorney General have been obtained for the draft Agreement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to sign the proposed Agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designating the TIQRI Software PTE Ltd as a secondary business of strategic importance
decision_details: - TIQRI Software PTE Ltd has submitted a proposal to start an information technology business in Colombo Port City with an initial foreign direct investment of USD 100,000. This project has fulfilled the required qualifications to be granted exemptions or incentives under 4(3)(b) of the Colombo Port City (Guidelines on the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic Importance) Regulations, No.2 of 2023. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotions to grant relevant exemptions or incentives in terms of the provisions in the said Act and publish the project as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance by an Order in the Gazette and thereafter to table the said Order in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designating Asiri Port City Hospital (Private) Limited as a Primary 	Business of Strategies Importance
decision_details: - Asiri Port City Hospital (Private) Limited has submitted a proposal to implement a project for the development of a Hospital at the Colombo Port City under an investment of US$ 100 million. Qualifications for granting of exemptions or incentives have been fulfilled under 2(b) of the Colombo Port City (Guidelines on the Grant of Exemptions or Incentives to Businesses of Strategic Importance) Regulations, No.2 of 2023. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to award the relevant exemptions or incentives under the said provisions and after publishing the said project as a Primary Business of Strategic Importance by an Order in the Gazette, to table the said Order in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the United National Nuclear 	Security Administration and the Sri Lanka Navy concerning prevention 	of illicit trafficking in nuclear and other radioactive material
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the United National Nuclear Security Administration and the Sri Lanka Navy concerning prevention of illicit trafficking in nuclear and other radioactive material. The observations of the Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Regulatory Council, the Sri Lanka Atomic Energy Board, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Department of National Planning and the clearance of the Attorney General have been obtained for the draft MoU prepared for that purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to sign the 	proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding between the General Sir John	Kotelawala Defence University and the Turkish Aerospace Inc.
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding pertaining to 	the Cooperation on Human Resources Development between the General Sir 	John Kotelawala Defencce University and the Turkish Aerospace Inc. It is 	possible to reap many benefits including receiving the opportunity for students 	in the General Sir John Kotelawala Defencce University to participate in the 	International Internship Programme at the Turkish Aerospace Inc. as an intern 	trainee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity 	as the 	Minister of Defence to sign the proposed Memorandum of	Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agriculture Sector Modernization Programme
decision_details:
- The need to increase the manufacturing productivity of the country by efficiently and effectively utilizing the underutilized resources in Sri Lanka's agriculture has been identified. Accordingly, the agricultural sector needs to be modernized rapidly in order to achieve the objectives of increasing the income and productivity of farmers, regulating the market, increasing the export‑oriented products, creating agro entrepreneurs by attracting the youth community towards the agriculture and using information technology for the agricultural sector. The Cabinet granted its concurrence for the following steps proposed by the Hon. President in relation to the implementation of the Agricultural Sector Modernization Programme. 

*	Preparation of a National Policy Framework with the participation of experts in the field to get the contribution of the agricultural sector in the role of building a developed Sri Lanka by the year 2048. 

*	Establishment of an Agriculture Sector Modernization Secretariat under the Presidential Secretariat.

*	Establishment of "Agricultural Sector Modernization Services and Knowledge Hubs" at the Divisional Secretariat level enabling to implement agricultural sector modernization services effectively and sustainably as well as in a well-coordinated manner.

*	Making amendments to the Agrarian Development Act including other legal amendments to implement the proposed programme.

title: Proposed Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement (SLTFTA)
decision_details: - The Ninth Round of Negotiations on the proposed Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement has been held from 2023‑12‑18 to 2023‑12‑20 in Colombo. The relevant negotiations have been concluded at present and the same has been referred to Working Group on Legal and Institutional Issues for legal scrubbing. At the Ninth Round of Negotiations, both parties have agreed to include provisions so as to remove 50% of the applicable duties on the HS Codes categorized in the Sensitive Track of the Tariff Liberalization Programme as a single point removal at the beginning of the 16th year from the date of implementation of the Agreement, under this Agreement and thereby reducing the duration of the Tariff Liberalization Programme from 18 years to 16 years. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President to pursue action as per the said consensus, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Terms of Reference for the Anti-money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) National Coordinating Committee and Establishment of a Task Force
decision_details: - The Anti‑money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) National Coordinating Committee consists of representatives from the relevant Government agencies, law enforcement agencies, regulatory authorities and other stakeholders involved in AML/CFT efforts. In order to streamline the existing process of the National Coordinating Committee, Terms of Reference for that Committee have been drafted. It has also been identified the essentiality of establishing a Task Force to ensure the effective coordination among Government agencies, financial institutions, regulatory authorities and other stakeholders in finding solutions to the problems arising in anti‑money laundering and countering the financing of terrorism. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies on the proposed Terms of Reference for the National Coordinating Committee and to establish a Task Force, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of eggs from farms recommended by the Department of Animal Production and Health to stabilize the price of eggs in the domestic market
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑08‑14 has granted approval to import eggs from the Indian market identified by the Department of Animal Production and Health to stabilize the price of eggs in the domestic market. Accordingly, Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation Limited has imported 155 million eggs at present and necessary steps have been taken to import another 18 million eggs before 2023‑12‑31. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to further import eggs from Indian farms which have already been recommended by the Department of Animal Production and Health, since there is a trend of increasing the retail price of eggs in the domestic open market at present, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allowing the Private Sector to import 50,000 MT of GR 11 variety of Rice, similar to Keeri Samba Rice
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑11‑20 to import 50,000 Metric Tons of rice as per the recommendation of the Food Policy Committee in order to control the price of rice in the market. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to import 50,000 Metric Tons of GR 11 rice equivalent to Keeri Samba rice by the private sector, in order to provide advantage of the price to the consumers by creating a competition in the price of Keeri Samba rice and Samba rice in the local market, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Institutional Reforms for Digital Transformation
decision_details: - It has been identified the necessity to create an agency equipped with a comprehensive mandate in order to function more effectively in Sri Lanka's digital transformation and harness its potential. Accordingly, necessary amendments have to be made to the Information and Communication Technology Act, No.27 of 2003, enabling to establish s Digital Transformation Agency to provide strategic and policy leadership, investment advice and oversight to drive the Government's digital transformation process, and to establish a National Center for Artificial Intelligence as a part of the Digital Transformation Agency to implement the National Artificial Intelligence Strategy. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft an amending Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the National Savings Bank Act, No.30 of 1971
decision_details: - It has been identified that due to the limitations in the National Savings Bank Act No.30 of 1971, it has become difficult for the National Savings Bank to operate in the competitive and dynamic financial market. Therefore, certain clauses of the National Savings Bank Act should be amended in order to further expand the operations of the Bank through maintaining sustainable growth for the institution, identifying new business opportunities and building a new business model. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Standards to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft an amending Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Social Security Contribution Levy Act, No.25 of 2022
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑10‑30 to amend the Social Security Contribution Levy Act, No.25 of 2022 in order to reduce the liable turnover from Rs.120 million per annum to Rs.60 million per annum to be effective from 2024‑01‑01. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commission for Truth, Unity and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka Bill
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑04‑03 to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill on the Truth and Reconciliation Mechanism. Accordingly, the "Commission for Truth, Unity and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka Bill" has been prepared on the guidance given by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Foreign Affairs. The clearance of the Attorney General has also been received for the said Bill. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President; the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette enabling the General Public and the interested parties to submit their views and suggestions in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a relief for Public Officers who are entitled to Political Rights and contested at the Local Government Election
decision_details:
- The Commissioner General of Elections has informed the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government that it is appropriate to appoint a committee to solve the issues that have arisen due to the indefinite postponement of the Local Government Election 2023. Accordingly, the concurrence of the Election Commission has been received to implement the recommendations of the Report submitted by the Committee appointed by the Secretary of the said Ministry. Based on the recommendations of the said Committee, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Council and Local Government to proceed as follows, was approved by the Cabinet:

(i) 	In case where an officer entitled to political rights who has faced difficulties due to getting transferred to a service station located outside the electorate from which he/she contests the election makes an appeal regarding the same, allowing the said officer to report for duty to his/her permanent place of work after considering it by the Head of the Institution and obtaining an affidavit from the respective officer to effect that he/she is not engaged in political activities, political campaigns or promotions at the relevant place of work.

(ii) 	Payment of basic salary considering the period from 2023‑04‑25 to 2023‑05‑08 as a period of leave with pay.

(iii)	Making compulsory to the officers who have submitted nominations for the Local Government Election 2023, to report for duty as per the Public Administration Circular No.07/2023 dated 2023‑05‑08.
(iv) 	Accordingly, issuance of a Public Administration Circular including the 	above matters to solve the issues of the Government Officers who have 	entitled to political rights.

title: Submission of Sri Lanka National Commission for UNESCO Bill to Parliament
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑03‑20 to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the Sri Lanka National Commission for UNESCO Bill. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit the same to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Approval for the National Aeronautical Search and Rescue Plan
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions of the Civil Aviation Act No.14 of 2010, the National Aeronautical Search and Rescue Plan has been prepared by the Civil Aviation Authority, and it has been published as a Rule by the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2347/02 dated 2023‑08‑28. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to table the said Rule in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project for the establishment of 60 Smart Classrooms for Advanced Level Students in the selected Plantation Schools in the Nuwara Eliya, Kandy and Badulla Districts
decision_details: - The Government of India has agreed to provide funds for implementation of a pilot project to establish 60 Smart Classrooms for Advanced Level students in the selected Plantation Schools in the Nuwara Eliya, Kandy and Badulla Districts within a period of two years.
