decision_details: - The Government of Japan has agreed to provide a grant of Japanese Yen 200 million (approximately LKR 435 Million) under the Economic and Social Development Programme of the Government of Japan, with the objective of developing cold chain facilities and empowering the fisheries sector with modern electrical equipment to ensure a high value addition to the marine products to upgrade the living standard of the fishermen in the Northern and Eastern Provinces of Sri Lanka. It is expected to secure ice making machines for the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources, digital platform scales for Ceylon Fishery Harbours Corporation, fishing nets for the National Aquaculture Development Authority, prefabricated refrigerators/freezers and refrigerator Cargo trucks for the Ceylon Fisheries Corporation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to obtain the said grant assistance and to enter into the respective agreements thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Shop and Office Employees (Regulation of Employment and Remuneration) Act, No.19 of 1954 to meet the current needs
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted its approval at the meeting held on 2022‑08‑08 to amend  the Shop and Office Employees (Regulation of Employment and Remuneration) Act, No.19 of 1954 in a manner that enables the women employed at night in offices engaged in information technology based businesses, knowledge process outsoucing businesses, business process outsourcing institutions and offices which handle accounting,	administrative and technical work for the business organizations located in the other	countries.  The Shop and Office Employees (Regulation of Employment and Remuneration) (Amendment) Bill prepared  accordingly by the Legal Draftsman has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval,was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Powers of Attorney Ordinance
decision_details: - Steps had been taken to amend the Powers of Attorney Ordinance by the Act, No.28 of 2022, with the objective of preventing fraudulent activities committed by the Power of Attorney holders relating to lands. Subsequent to the enforcement of the said amendments, several legal complications have arisen especially on the foreign Powers of Attorney, cancellation and revocation of Powers of Attorney and the time period given to register a Power of Attorney prepared before the enforcement of the respective amendments.  Therefore, the approval was granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑05‑08 to prepare a Bill to further amend the Powers of Attorney Ordinance. The Powers of Attorney (Amendment) Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman as per the said approval,  has received the clearance of the Attorney General. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Sri Lanka Transport Board Act No.27 of 2005
decision_details: - The necessity of amending the certain provisions in the Sri Lanka Transport Board Act No.27 of 2005 has been identified taking into consideration the need of making adequate legal provisions to take legal action against offenses committed by passengers and other parties depriving of revenue to be received by the Sri Lanka Transport Board and new reforms and trends which have taken place in the passenger transport service after introducing the Sri Lanka Transport Board Act, No.27 of 2005.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Sri Lanka Transport Board Act, No.27 of 2005, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Motor Traffic Act
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑06‑05 has granted approval to implement the recommendations of the Report submitted by the Officials' Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Prime Minister to examine the matters relating to the implementation of the e-Motoring Project and submit recommendations to the Cabinet. It has been identified the necessity of amending the the Motor Traffic Act as appropriate to provide for necessary interim provisions for the implementation of the said Project and for matters incidental. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Acting Minister of Transport and Highways to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of an Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority
decision_details: - Ensuring accountability, credibility, clarity and professionalism of Members of Parliament are essential factors in enhancing the public trust in the efficacy, transparency and equity of the legislature. Therefore, Members of Parliament should, at all times, exercise their powers, privileges, functions and duties with probity and integrity. Taking into consideration that there is a mechanism for the implementation of a Code of Conduct for the Members of Parliament in most countries in the world and and for monitoring such activities, It has been identified the necessity of establishing an independent institution for preparing a Code of Conduct for the Members of Parliament in this country as well and for monitoring the same. Accordingly, the proposal jointly submitted by the Hon. Prime Minister and the Minster of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to obtain the views of the Speaker of Parliament and all Party Leaders on the initial draft prepared for the above purpose and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to formulate a Bill taking also into account the said views, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding between the International Centre for Migration Policy Development and the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment
decision_details: - It has been planned to establish a Migrant Resource Centre in the Eastern Province for providing adequate, timely, reliable information and guidance to migrants, returned migrants and prospective migrants to enable them to make informed decisions to reduce the risks and challenges they face when traveling, working and living abroad, and the Government of New Zealand has expressed its willingness to grant required assistance for the purpose. Accordingly, the Government of New Zealand has agreed to provide a grant of 350,000 New Zealand dollars for the implementation of the proposed project by the International Center for Migration Policy Development through the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment of New Zealand. The proposal made by the Minister of Labor and Foreign Employment to sign a memorandum of understanding between the International Center for Migration Policy Development in New Zealand and the Ministry of Labor and Foreign Employment of Sri Lanka in order to establish the proposed Centre, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between the National 	Archives of 	Sri Lanka and the National Archives of the Netherlands
decision_details: - Archives of about 310 liner meters consisting of approximately 7,500 volumes created by the Dutch East India Company, which have been included in the Memory of the World Register by UNESCO recognizing the importance of the same for the study of both Asian history and world history are in the custody of the National Archives of Sri Lanka. Under 04 joint Agreements entered into between  the  National Archives of Sri Lanka and the National Archives of the Netherlands during the period from 2001 to 2013, 1,701 copies of negative microfilms of 5066 volumes have been sent to the Netherlands and microfilms made using them have been preserved by the National Archives of Sri Lanka at present. It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding Concerning Archives Cooperation for a period of five years from 2024 to 2028 to continue this cooperation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to sign the relevant Memorandum of Understanding between the National Archives of the Netherlands and the National Archives of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Education and the Peace Corps of the United States of America
decision_details: - The Peace Corps programmes supported by the United States Congress have been implemented in Sri Lanka during the periods from 1962 - 1964, 1983 - 1998 and 2004 - 2006. According to a memorandum of understanding signed between the Ministry of Education and the Peace Corps in 2018, a consensus has been reached between the two parties to implement a programme to improve English language education in Sri Lanka by providing volunteers for a period of five (05) years. However, due to the Easter Sunday attack and the Covid‑19 pandemic situation, Peace Corps has not been able to implement the programme as scheduled. Since the Peace Corps has now agreed to re-implement the said programme in Sri Lanka, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to extend the MoU signed between the two parties for a further period of 05 years with effect from August 2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Enhancing Small and Medium-sized Enterprises Finance Project
decision_details: - With the financial assistance of the Asian Development Bank amounting to US$ 165 million, the Government has implemented the 'Small and Medium sized Enterprises Line of Credit Project' to provide investment and working capital loans to small and medium sized entrepreneurs, at concessionary interest rates. Also, the necessary steps have been taken to establish the National Credit Guarantee Institution as a solution to the issues faced by small and medium sized entrepreneurs, owing to the banks giving priority to collateral‑based lending rather than cash flow‑based lending. The Government has planned to implement a new project called 'Enhancing Small and Medium‑sized Enterprises Finance Project' for entrepreneurs who have found it more difficult to secure funds for their businesses, and for the purpose, the Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide funds of US$ 100 million. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to obtain the said loan and to enter into related agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of short term strategies for the promotion of Tourism Industry
decision_details:
- Many Asian tourist destinations have entered into a tough competition to regain the tourism market share diminished in the wake of Covid‑19 pandemic and many countries are taking measures to grant visas to tourists free of charge.  Therefore, several new tourism promotion programmes have been planned to implement for the revival of the tourism industry of Sri Lanka, which experienced a setback owing to the Easter Sunday attack, the Covid‑19 pandemic and the subsequent severe economic downturn. Accordingly, with the objective of increasing the number of tourists visiting Sri Lanka to 05 million during the next 03 years, the Cabinet approved the following proposals jointly submitted by the Hon. Prime Minister, Minister of Tourism and Lands, Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Minister of Public Security.

i. 	immediate implementation of a  programme to issue free visa for the tourists from China, India, Russia, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia and Japan for the period up to 2024‑03‑31, as a pilot project.  

ii. 	Providing the opportunity for tourists to purchase a one-time ticket package at the airport or through online platforms for all locations where fees are levied, enabling them to access the world heritage sites seamlessly and unobstructedly.

iii. 	Providing the opportunity to purchase tickets for tourist compartments of the Sri Lanka Railways via online platforms or at the airport itself as a unified ticket.

title: Extension of Sri Lanka - Australia Trade and Investment Framework	Arrangement
decision_details: - Australia is an important Foreign Direct Investment partner of Sri Lanka and the 5th source of tourist arrival destinations. The Trade and Invetment Framework Arrangement has been signed between Sri Lanka and Australia on 2017-11-02 with the perspective of enhancing bilateral trade and investment relations between the two countries. The proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to extend the said Agreement for the next five (05) years from 2023-10-10 enabling the continuous maintenance of trade and investment cooperation as mentioned in the said agreement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Investment Promotion and the National Development and Reform Commission of the People's Republic of China
decision_details: - The National Development and Reform Commission of the People's Republic of China and the Ministry of Investment Promotion of Sri Lanka has expressed their concurrence to enter into an Memorandum of Understanding in order to promote production capacity and investment cooperation between the two parties. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Hydrographic Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023-05-08 has granted approval to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to impose required provisions to develop a Maritime Hydrographic Unit with the objective of improving Sri Lanka as the Marine Center of South Asia region. The Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The Joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bill titled as 'Secured Transactions'
decision_details:
- The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2018-06-19 has granted approval to repeal the Secured Transactions Act, No. 49 of 2009 and introduce a fresh Act imposing provisions to establish the Secured Transaction Registration Authority and amend the  Acts concurrently as follows. 

    • Prescription (Amendment) Bill
    • Trust Receipts (Amendment) Bill
    • Mortgage (Amendment) Bill
    • Finance Leasing (Amendment) Bill
    • Inland Trust Receipts (Amendment) Bill
    • Companies (Amendment) Bill
    • Registration of Documents (Amendment) Bill

Accordingly, the Secretary, Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies has been instructed at the Cabinet meeting held on 2021-05-03 to examine further on Bills prepared by the Legal Draftsman along with the relevant authorities. The relevant Bills have been updated by the Legal Draftsman and have received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Hon.President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bills in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit them to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enactment of the Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority Act
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2021‑03‑23 to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to repeal the Microfinance Act, No.6 of 2016 and enact the Microfinance and Credit Regulatory Authority. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Formulation of the National Land Commission Act
decision_details: - In accordance with the Appendix II of the List 1 of the Ninth Schedule to the Thirteenth Amendment to the Constitution, provisions have been made that a Land Commission should be established. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill, based on the preliminary draft prepared for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: En-route Navigation Facility Charges Regulations No.01 of 2023
decision_details: - En-route Navigation Facility Charges Regulations have been promulgated in 1981, 	enabling to impose an En-route Navigation Facility Charge for the aircraft navigating through the Colombo Flight Information Region. Those regulations have not been 	amended during last period of years. Therefore, taking into account the Convention on International Civil Aviation Policies and the current global trends, En-route Navigation Facility Charges Regulations have been amended 	and said new regulations have been published as En-route Navigation Facility Charges Regulations No.01 of 2023 through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2319/64 and dated 2023‑02‑16. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to table the Regulations so published, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting outer boundary survey and preparation of boundary maps of the estates managed under the Regional Plantation Companies, Sri Lanka State Plantation Corporation and Janatha Estates Development Board
decision_details: - The project for conducting outer boundary survey and preparation of boundary maps of the estates managed under the Regional Plantation Companies, Sri Lanka State Plantation Corporation and the Janatha Estates Development Board has been commenced in 2018 and surveying has been done covering a considerable extent of the relevant lands. The proposal made by the Minister of Industries to extend the said project until 2027, enabling to cover the remaining extent of lands that remains to be surveyed, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Payment of compensation for the damaged crops in the Yala Season 2023
decision_details: - Approximately 58,770 acres of paddy and other crops have been damaged in the Yala Season 2023 due to the inability to supply of adequate water upon the adverse weather condition which prevailed recently thereby affecting about 53,965 farmers. Accordingly, the Cabinet, taking into consideration a proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture pertaining to the payment of compensations to the farmers so affected, decided to allocate necessary provisions for the payment of compensations, under the Crop Insurance Scheme which is currently in operation, despite the severe financial condition encountered by the country.

title: Providing Housing Units under the Urban Regeneration Project to the 	families occupying in the settlement with less facilities in the land called 	Hathbodhiyawatta, Narahenpita and developing the said land
decision_details: - There is a low-income settlement on a land block of Government-owned land called Hathbodhiyawatta located in the Kirula Grama Niladhari Division, Narahenpita in extent of 01 Acres 03 Roods and 10 Perches and those housing units are often subject to disasters during the rainy seasons. It has been proposed to provide the families occupying in the said settlement, with the alternative housing units from the housing schemes constructed by the Urban Development Authority under the Urban Regeneration Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to provide housing units from the housing schemes constructed in the Colombo city under the Urban Regeneration Project, to the occupants of the said land and thereafter to transfer the said land to the Urban Development Authority under section 6(1) of the State Land Ordinance to implement a mixed development project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sale of Housing Units of Lake Crest Residencies Housing Project at Angoda, 	Mandawila on freehold basis
decision_details: - The possession of housing units of the Lake Crest Residencies Housing Project at Angoda, Mandawila comprising of 500 units implemented by the Urban Development Authority, has been handed over to the housing recipients in the year 2018. The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to grant freehold deeds to the housing recipients who have completed the relevant payments, according to the Condominium Property Law and to the other housing recipients after completing the relevant payments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recognition of Medical Degree Courses of Internationally Recognized 	Universities in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑05‑02 has granted approval to appoint a Committee chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minster to submit appropriate recommendations to formulate a National Policy with standards and criteria to be based for the recognition of Medical Degree courses of internationally recognized Universities, in Sri Lanka and to amend the provisions of the Medical Ordinance to suit the present day needs. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Health to take necessary action to impose required legal provisions enabling to recognize the Medical Degrees awarded by foreign universities ranked 01 to 1000 as per the international ranking systems, based on the Report containing the recommendations of the Committee so appointed, was approved by the Cabinet.

title:
Appointment of an Advisory Committee to the Department of Community 
	Based Corrections
decision_details: - It has been recommended at the Committee on Public Accounts held on 2023‑06‑09	to appoint an Advisory Committee, since a continuous supervision and a follow up is necessary to discharge the duties carried out by the Department of Community Based Corrections coming under the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms. Accordingly, The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to appoint the proposed Advisory Committee under the chairmanship of the Secretary, Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and consisting of other relevant Heads of Institutions and experts in the relevant field, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Pavithra Wanniarachchi Sahurda Foundation (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - Pavithra Wanniarachchi Sahurda Foundation (Incorporation) Bill has been presented  to Parliament as a Private Member's Bill by Hon. Lalith Ellawala, Member of Parliament. The Preliminary draft in concern has been duly prepared by the Legal Draftsman and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. The proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the relevant Bill in terms of the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Recognition and Enforcement of International Settlement Agreements resulting from Mediation Bill
decision_details: - The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022-10-25 to draft a Bill to prepare laws to give effect to the United Nations Convention on International Settlement Agreements resulting from Mediation (Singapore Convention on Mediation), domestically. The Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman accordingly has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Mediation Board Act, No.72 of 1988
decision_details: - The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023-02-27 to amend the Mediation Board Act No.72 of 1988 by amending the provisions pertaining to the appointment of the members of the Mediation Board Commission, jurisdiction of Mediation Boards and by introducing some other relevant amendments.  Accordingly, the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman has received the clearance of the Attorney General. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Shaili Educational Foundation (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - Shaili Educational Foundation (Incorporation) Bill has been presented to Parliament as a Private Member's Bill by Hon. Dr. (Mrs.) Harini Amarasuriya, Member of the Parliament. The Preliminary draft in concern has been properly prepared by the Legal Draftsman and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. The proposal made by the Minister of Education to submit a Report to  Parliament recommending the relevant Bill in terms of the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6) of Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of 70MW, Alternative Current (AC) ground mounted solar Photovoltanic (PV) power plants with 1-5 MW capacity on build, own and operate basis
decision_details: - Proposals have been called from prospective investors interested in establishing 70MW, Alternative Current (AC) ground mounted solar Photovoltanic (PV) power plants with 1-5 MW capacity on build, own and operate basis  with 20 year operational period so as to connect 11 grid substations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to grant approval to the relevant investors to implement projects for 08 grid substations of Ampara, Anuradhapura, Galle, Habarana, Kurunegala Madampe, Maho and Matara, based on the recommendations submitted by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee after evaluation of their proposals, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of 1996 housing units for low income families under the Chinese Aid Programme
decision_details: - The Government of China has concurred to grant financial aid of Yuan 552 million to the Government of Sri Lanka to construct 1996 housing units as an assistance to the Urban Regeneration Project which is being implemented as per the decision made to relocate residents from settlements with limited facilities in the Western Province and settle them in the housing Units of Urban Housing Schemes with improved amenities. The Government of Sri Lanka, under the entire project, will carry out the land development activities and provide necessary infrastructure up to the boundary of the work sites.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minster of Urban Development and Housing  to sign the implementation Agreement of the relevant project with the Government of China, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a New Commercial High Court
decision_details: - Necessary action needs to be taken to maintain more conducive investment atmosphere in the country in achieving the development targets.  Considering the situation, the necessity of establishing a new Commercial High Court has been identified in order to ensure the expeditious resolution of the current high volume of cases pending with regard to commercial matters. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to establish the relevant Commercial High Court at No. 80, Adhikarana Mawatha, Colombo 12, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing inland fish production through stocking of fish seeds in reservoirs
decision_details: - The inland fisheries and aquaculture sector plays a significant role in the rural economy of Sri Lanka and highly contributes to the increase of food security and nutrition and for providing employment opportunities. In order to carry out  economically effective inland fish production with high growth in the reservoirs of the country, approximately 500 million fish fingerlings should be continuously stocked annually. However, it has not yet been able to fully utilize the potential of the existing reservoirs for culture-based fisheries due to the insufficient fish seed stocking. Although, 230 million fish fingerlings and 80 million freshwater prawn post larvae were initially planned to be stocked in the reservoirs in the year 2023, the said plan had to be changed due to the drying up of the reservoirs owing to the dry weather condition which prevailed in the recent past. Accordingly,  taking into account the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries  to secure budgetary provisions required for the implementation of the programme for producing 100 million fish fingerlings and 50 million freshwater prawn post larvae and stocking into the reservoirs during the remaining period of this year, by revising the said plan, the Cabinet approved the provision of additional allocations of Rs. 100 million for the said tasks for the year 2023.

title: Providing facilities at the Oluwil Fishery Harbour to carry out fish 	processing activities by Tess (Pvt) Ltd.
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has previously been granted to provide facilities at the Oluwil Fishery Harbour to carry out fish processing activities by Tess (Pvt) Ltd. re-activating the fish processing plant which has been idle on the premises of the Oluvil Fishery Harbour. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to provide the fish processing plant located at the Oluwil Fishery Harbour to Tess (Pvt) Ltd., on lease basis for a period of 10 years, subject to levying the relevant lease rental recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee monthly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Streamlining the inquiries conducted into consumer complaints received 	by the Consumer Affairs Authority
decision_details: - Under the provisions of the Consumer Affairs Authority Act, No.9 of 2003, legal provisions have been provided for the Consumer Affairs Authority to intervene in consumer complaints. Also, the Department of Measurement, Standards and Services established by the Measurement Units, Standards and Services Act, No.35 of 1995 conducts market raids together with the Consumer Affairs Authority with a view to protecting the consumer rights.  Accordingly, the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security having informed the Cabinet on the programme planned to implement to educate consumers and manufacturers regarding the protection of consumer rights and fair trade practices as one of the important steps to reduce the time and effort spent on investigating consumer complaints and giving decisions thereto, to decentralize the investigation procedure and make provisions to conduct them district level in order to make the process of investigating complaints more efficient, and to establish a National Operations Centre aiming to conduct the special raids through an integrated programme, decided to grant the concurrence of the Cabinet for the same.

title: Granting State owned lands for a Solar Power Project of 100 MW, on lease 	basis
decision_details: - The proposal to take over a land in extent of 219.72 hectares located in the Siyambalanduwa Divisional Secretariat Division of the Monaragala District to the Sri Lanka Sustainable Energy Authority for a 100 MW solar power project was taken up for discussion at the  Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑08‑07, and a decision was taken to discuss with the Ministry of  Tourism and Lands in that regard and submit information related thereto, to the Cabinet. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to lease out the relevant extent of land to the Sri Lanka Sustainable Energy Authority for a period of 25 years, along with the provisions enabling to sub‑lease the said land to the selected renewable energy developer, as per the recommendation of the Ministry of Tourism and Lands.

title: Establishment of a University on Education by upgrading the National 	Colleges of Education to the status of Campuses of Universities
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2019‑12‑04, a Committee of Experts has been appointed under the chairmanship of Senior Professor Gunapala Nanayakkara for the purpose of submitting recommendations on administrative and legal procedures to be followed in upgrading the existing National Colleges of Education to the status of the campuses of the universities, with the aim of establishing all graduate teacher cadre in Lanka.  As per the recommendations of the said Committee, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to instruct the Legal Draftsman to take necessary action to draft a new Bill for imposing legal provisions to upgrade 19 out of the 20 existing National Colleges of Education to the status of campuses and to establish a new university called Sri Lanka University of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Regulation of Chemical Substances affecting National Security
decision_details: - A large number of different chemical substances are used in Sri Lanka for peaceful uses such as industrial, agricultural, medical and research purposes. It has been observed that, out of which some chemical substances such as Nitric Acid, Chlorine, Hydrogen Peroxide, Potassium Cyanide, Sodium Cyanide, Nitromethane and Sodium Azide have a dual-use nature that can be used for peaceful as well as illicit purposes. It has been recognized that there is a risk of using those chemicals which are used in various industries such as dairy, beverages, oil related industries, water purification for harmful activities that threaten the national security. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to enact legal provisions to regulate such chemical substances to prevent their misuse, and to vest that regulatory role with the National Authority for Implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Appropriation Bill for the year 2024 to Parliament
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑07‑31 to prepare the Appropriation Bill for the financial year 2024. Accordingly, clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Appropriation Bill for the financial year 2024 prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Public Debt Management Institution (PDMA)
decision_details: - The Importance of establishing an independent Public Debt Management Institution as an institutional reform has been emphasized through the Interim Budget of the year 2022 and improving debt management and transparency have also been identified as priority areas under the Extended Fund Facility of the International Monetary Fund. The International Monetary Fund and the World Bank have provided technical assistance for the establishment of the proposed Public Debt Management Institution. After consultation with relevant stakeholders, the debt management reform plan, debt management institutional framework and legal framework have now been designed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Acting Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the  Public Debt Management Bill, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining policy based special lending facility from the Asian Development Bank for the Financial Sector Stability and Reform Programme
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has conducted initial discussions with the Asian Development Bank to obtain 02 policy based lending facilities amounting to US$ 200 million each for implementing two sub-programmes under the  Financial Sector Stability and Reform Programme. Under the said first Sub-programme, it has been proposed to implement immediate reforms to enhance the crisis management regulatory framework and stabilize the financial sector, and under the second Sub-programme, it has been proposed to build a resilient and inclusive financial system. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into a loan agreement with the Asian Development Bank to obtain US$ 200 million for the first Sub-programme at an interest rate of 2% per annum, with a repayment period of 25 years including a grace period of 05 years, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017
decision_details: - With the objective of ensuring that the well-being of disabled children in the society is  prioritized and they receive comprehensive care, it has been proposed that it is appropriate to make amendments to the Inland Revenue Act so that any charitable organization established as a legal entity or registered under any law enforced for the registration of social service organizations that provides health facilities to children in collaboration with Government health care/education system can claim tax relief. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Acting Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Inland Revenue Act by incorporating the necessary legal provisions for that purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: 28th Session of the Conference of Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in Dubai, UAE
decision_details: - The 28th Session of the Conference of Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (COP 28) is scheduled to be held in Dubai, United Arab Emirates from 2023.11.30 to 2023.12.12. In that Conference, Sri Lanka, together with most vulnerable countries due to climate change, expects to present a proposal to create platform named as "Climate Justice Forum" that will lead developing countries to have a common voice regarding their concerns and unlock the pledges and commitments of developed countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to maintain a Country Pavilion during the conference for the active participation of the delegations participating in the 28th Conference of Parties to the United Nations Framework Convention and showcase the national level initiatives related to climate change in the pavilion, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of 04 shipments of Gas oil within the next four (04) months period
decision_details: - Bids have been invited under term contract basis for procurement of 04 shipments of gas oil for Ceylon Petroleum Corporation within the next four (04) months period from 2023-11-01 to 2024-02-29. It has been received 05 bids for that.  The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to M/s Petrochina International (Singapore) Pte.Ltd based on the	recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Accessories for Buoy Mooring used for offloading petroleum in the sea near Muthurajawela
decision_details: - Bids have been invited according to the International Competitive Bidding Procedure to procure 26 marine hoses and relevant accessories required for Buoy Mooring which is used to offload shiploads of petroleum in the sea near Muthurajawela and only one bid has been received. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to M/s. Industrial Products Asia Pacific (Pte) Ltd. as recommended by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee that evaluated the said bid, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute and the Levan Mikeladze Diplomatic Training and Research Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute coming under the purview of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Levan Mikeladze Diplomatic Training and Research Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Georgia to establish cooperation pertaining to sharing of expertise, exchange of academic staff, exchange of students, joint research programmes as well as sharing of teaching methodologies and other relevant areas. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign the said proposed Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties in parallel with the 25th anniversary celebrations of the establishment of diplomatic relations between two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Taking steps to prevent and control forest fires
decision_details: - Given the man-made fires in the forests, there is a tendency to increase the risk of forest fires rapidly especially during dry whether conditions.  This situation commonly can be seen in the districts of Badulla, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Matale, Monaragala, Polonnaruwa, Kurunegala, Puttalam and Rathnapura.  About 150 forest fires have been reported so far this year and in consequence of that, approximately 2,600 hectares of forests have been destroyed. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to implement a programme to prevent and extinguish the forest fires with the assistance of the Government mechanism and other relevant parties from national level to village level, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bill on the Establishment of National Women's Commission
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022-09-05 to establish an independent commission named as National Women's Commission through an Act of Parliament, enabling to make necessary recommendations to Parliament through the Minister-in-charge to provide leadership for women's rights and gender equality and intervene for the issues related to gender equity and equality. Accordingly, the said Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman was submitted by the Hon. President in  his capacity as the Minister of Women, Children Affairs and Social Empowerment to the Cabinet and it was decided to grant concurrence of the Cabinet in principle for the same.

title: Bill on Gender Equality
decision_details: - It is evident  that Sri Lanka is lagging behind with regard to Gender equality in Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment is taking measures to minimize the gender imbalances. Accordingly, approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022-09-05 to prepare a Bill to introduce the necessary legal provisions with the objective of Gender equality and women empowerment. Accordingly, the said Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman was submitted to the Cabinet by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Children Affairs and Social Empowerment and it was decided to grant concurrence of the Cabinet in principle, for the same.

title: Accession to the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons
decision_details: - The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting on 2021-12-20 to take necessary action to sign the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign he Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons by Sri Lanka at the Conference held with related to the said Treaty in parallel to the UN General Assembly scheduled to be conducted in New York in September 2023,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the State of Kuwait on the Establishment of a Bilateral Consultation Mechanism
decision_details: - In the discussions held between the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the State of Kuwait, an agreement has been reached regarding the establishment of a bilateral consultation mechanism  between the two countries. Accordingly, aiming to promote friendly relations and cooperation in the political, economic and other fields between the two countries, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on the establishment of a bilateral consultation mechanism in parallel with the 78th Session of the United Nations General Assembly to be held in New York in September 2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of an Order published in terms of the provisions of the Sri Lanka Export Development Act, No.40 of 1979, for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - According to the existing duty structure, the duty levied on the importation of certain raw materials used by local printing ink manufacturers for ink manufacturing is higher  than the printing ink imported as finished products thereby causing a disadvantageous situation to local printing ink manufacturers. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to present the Order published in the Government Gazette dated 2023‑07‑21 in terms of the provisions of the Sri Lanka Export Development Act, No.40 of 1979 in order to rectify the same, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term contract for the procurement of 04 shipments of Gasoline of 92 Unl within the next four months period
decision_details: - Bids have been invited for a term contract from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to purchase 04 shipments of Gasoline 92 Unl for a period of 04 months from 2023‑09‑21 to 2024‑01‑21. For the purpose, 04 companies have submitted bids. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the said procurement to M/s. Vitol Asia Pte. Ltd, as per the recommendation of the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Investment Proposal for a Solar Power/Battery Storage Project at Poonakary Tank in Kilinochchi
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has been granted to call for Expressions of Interest from prospective investors to develop renewable energy projects with a capacity of 50 MW or more in order to support the implementation of expeditious renewable energy development programmes in the country. Accordingly, United Solar Energy SL (Pvt.) Ltd. has submitted a proposal to develop a solar power plant of 700 MW with a battery energy storage system, at Poonkari Tank, Kilinochchi enabling to provide a power supply of 134 MW. It has been proposed to implement the proposed project with a total investment of US$ 1,727 million and as a 100% foreign direct investment, out of which US$ 500 million will be allocated to be utilized for local project components. As a part of the proposed project, the project proponent company has proposed to construct 03 barrages around the Poonkari tank at a cost of US $13.5 million to prevent the sea water intrusion and to rehabilitate the tank. Instead, the Northern Provincial Council, the Northern Provincial Irrigation Department and the Department of Agrarian Development have already agreed to provide 1,080 acres of the shallow area of the tank to the said company on a 35-year lease agreement for the installation of the 700 MW solar power plant. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to accept the project proposal submitted by United Solar Energy SL (Pvt.) Ltd. in principle and to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee to evaluate the said proposal and submit recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting a plot of land which contains a storied housing complex owned by the Urban Development Authority, with the University of Colombo
decision_details: - The Board of Management of the Urban Development Authority has granted approval to vest the land in extent of 0.2761 hectares containing a storied housing complex with 144 housing units located at Kalinga Mawatha, Narahenpita, with the University of Colombo. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to vest the said plot of land with storied housing complex with the University of Colombo, as a free grant, to be utilized to provide hostel facilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementing  a Pilot Project for Beire Lake Water Quality Improvement
decision_details: - As per a proposal submitted by Groepo Pte Ltd (GPL), a Singapore company with Japanese ownership, approval in principle of the Cabinet was granted at the Meeting held on 2023‑07‑17 to pursue action to implement a Pilot Project together with several Government Institutions to improve the water quality of the Beire Lake using micro-nano bubble technology, carbon fiber biofilm technology and eco‑friendly enzymes. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the joint proposal made by Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to implement the  proposed pilot project for a period of 05 years, subject to providing necessary guidance to implement the said project by an Experts Committee comprising of experts in the field of water quality in all universities of the country and representatives of all relevant research and other agencies, taking into account the further information presented by the project investor, and thereafter, arrive at a decision regarding the further implementation of the project, based on the outcome achieved.

title: Appreciation of the Contribution of Upcountry Tamils to the Sri Lankan Economy
decision_details: - Upcountry Tamils who migrated to Sri Lanka from India around 200 years ago, live in Central, Sabaragamuwa and Southern Provinces and they contribute to the national economy in various ways. Their contribution is around 1/3 of the total income of the plantation sector. Accordingly, the Cabinet concurred with the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the programmes identified with a view to upgrading the living standards of Upcountry Tamil community in collaboration with the Ministry of Plantation Industries and other relevant State institutions to commemorate the completion of 200 years since the arrival of the first generation of the Upcountry Tamil Community to Sri Lanka by February 2023.

title: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2019‑10‑29 has granted approval to prepare the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill. The Central Bank of Sri Lanka Bill prepared so has been published in the Government Gazette on 2019‑11‑01 and although it has been submitted to Parliament for approval, it has not been placed on the Order paper. The preliminary draft has been developed incorporating new amendments enabling to fulfill the duties of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka effectively and efficiently to be suited with the present day needs. Accordingly, the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman has been submitted to the Cabinet by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and it was decided to grant approval to the said Bill.

title: Establishment of an Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs
decision_details: - In the Interim Budget 2022, the Hon. President has proposed to establish an Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs to function as a central point for coordination to obtain the support of Sri Lankans living abroad. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to take necessary action to establish the proposed “Office for Overseas Sri Lankan Affairs” to obtain the service of 03 million Sri Lankans living abroad for the development of this country and to maintain the activities of the said Office properly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Regulations issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No. 21 of 2022 and Imports Control Regulations on Payment Terms No. 22 of 2022 issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Institute of Charted Shipbrokers of Sri Lanka (Incorporation) Bill
decision_details: - The Institute of Chartered Shipbrokers of Sri Lanka has been established in the year 1987 under the Ceylon Shipping Corporation with the patronage of the Institute of Charted Shipbrokers of England and it comprises of Fellow Members and Associated Members. The prime objective of this institute is to establish professionalism and uplift professionalism of shipbrokers. Further, providing opportunities to its members through study programmes, seminars and workshops to promote professionalism in the discipline and make training opportunities available for youth who have interest in the said field are among the objectives of the Institute. A private Member's Bill has been submitted to Parliament by the Hon. Buddika Pathirana, Member of Parliament in the Matara District to establish the same through a Parliament Act in order to maintain its activities properly and effectively. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to submit a Report to Parliament recommending the said draft Bill as per the provisions of the Standing Order 52(6), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the validity period of the Loan of the Supporting Electricity Supply Reliability Improvement Project
decision_details: - Supporting Electricity Supply Reliability Improvement Project is implemented under the Asian Development Bank (ADB) and two grants extended by the Clean Energy Financing Partnership Facility and the Japan Funds for Poverty Reduction. Action has been taken to extend the deadline for the completion of activities under Package - 4, up to 2023‑11‑29.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to extend the validity period of the ADB Loan facility up to 2024‑03‑31 enabling to secure the required funds, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining additional provisions required for renovation and 	conservation of the National Art Gallery
decision_details: - Although the renovation works of the National Art Gallery have been planned to complete during this year, owing to the situation prevailed in the country, it has not been possible to finish the expected task. Nearly 80% of the renovation work has been completed at present and related plans and estimates have been prepared by the Project Advisory Unit of the Faculty of Architecture, University of Moratuwa for the completion of remaining works. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to secure required provisions so that the remaining renovation works can be completed in the year 2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rural Finance Programme implemented under the Smallholder Tea and 	Rubber Revitalization Project
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka and the International Fund for Agricultural Development have entered into an agreement for the implementation of the Smallholder Tea and Rubber Revitalization Project. Under the said project, "Rural Finance Program" is being implemented and the program is due to be terminated on 2022‑12‑31. Another amount of Rs.172.35 million out of the money allocated for that program is to be released to the beneficiaries as loans. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation Industries to extend the period of the duration of the said program till 2023‑06‑30, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of new Visa Categories for the Colombo Port City
decision_details:
- Issuance of visa to the investors and other relevant parties who wish to arrive for miscellaneous services such as international trade, shipping and operations, finance, information technology and tourism to be established in the Colombo Port City and relevant acts incidental thereto have to be accomplished by the Department of Immigration and Emigration. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to take necessary action to take necessary action to introduce following visa categories, based on the recommendations of the Colombo Port City Commission, was approved by the Cabinet: 

*	"Investor Visa" category for investors under the residence visa category
* 	“Employment visa” category for employees
* 	“CPC Residential Property Leaseholder visa" category for foreigners residing in the Colombo Port City on lease basis.

title: Setting up a Training Centre of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign 	Employment for the Monaragala District
decision_details: - Although Monaragala District is geographically the second largest district, no office of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment or a training Centre is operated within the district. The closest training centres to the said district are located at Haliela in Badulla District, Tangalla in Hambanthota district and Ampara. It is possible to use the training Centre located in Bibile road, Monaragala which is presently under the custody of the Department of Divineguma to set up a district training centre of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment thereby providing required training facilities for those who seek foreign employment in low-income earning families. As such the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment; and the Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment to hand over the training Centre and premises located in Bibile road, Monaragala to the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Institute of Economics and Trade, Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It is highly important for the Members of Parliament and Senior Public Officials to have a training on Economics and Trade affairs enabling them to reach informed decisions formulating and implementing National Policies. In order to facilitate for the purpose, it has been found appropriate to establish an Institute by the name of "Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade" by an Act of Parliament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to establish the Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Parliamentary Elections Act No.1 of 1981
decision_details: - According to section 8(8) of the Parliamentary Elections Act, No.1 of 1981, the Election Commission has published a Code of Conduct relating to the conduct of political parties, independent groups and candidates contesting the election, thorough the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2178/25 dated 2020‑06‑03. It has been identified that it would be appropriate to amend the Parliamentary Elections Act, No.1 of 1981 in order to include actions to be taken in the event of violating this Code of Conduct and to include provisions stating that those will be effective during his/her tenure in the office and enable to provide the opportunity to identified persons holding special positions to vote at a special polling station apart from the polling station allocated for them. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a draft Bill to amend the said Act by incorporating provisions thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Legalization of Media Guidelines issued under the Article 104B(5)(a) of the Constitution
decision_details: - In terms of the Article 104B(5)(a) of the 1978 Constitution, Media Guidelines have been published by the Election Commission under the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2178/24 dated 2020‑06‑03. Nevertheless, provisions pertaining to action that could be taken in the event of violating such guidelines have not been enacted yet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to include the provisions which indicate that the violation of media guidelines is an election offence in the Presidential Elections (Special Provisions) Act, the Parliamentary Election Act, Local Authorities Elections Ordinance and the Provincial Councils Elections Act or to draft a Bill incorporating relevant provisions enabling take action treating the violation of media guidelines as an offence under each Act related to elections, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting approval in principal for the Procedural Rules of the Public Service Commission
decision_details: - The Procedural Rules of the Public Service Commission implemented with effect from 2009‑04‑02 have been redrafted to be adopted with the present day needs and rules and regulations. The final draft of the Procedural Rules has been prepared incorporating the proposals submitted after further studying the said draft Procedural Rules by the Officials' Committee appointed by the Cabinet. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to grant approval in principal for the Procedural Rules prepared by the Public Service Commission, in terms of the Article 55(1) of the Constitution and implement the same with effect from 2023‑01‑01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening legal provisions to prohibit sexual harassment, sexual assault 	and sexual bribery and punish the offenders of such criminal acts
decision_details: - Committing sexual harassment violates the fundamental human rights and freedom and provisions related thereto are included in section 345 of the Penal Code. It is observed that this problem continues to exist even though the law provides for the imposition of punishment for such crimes. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a draft Bill enabling to amend the Penal Code by incorporating sections which make sexual harassment and all forms of sexual assaults as criminal acts and provide stringent punishment therefor and include a new section to make sexual bribery an offence, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978
decision_details: - The Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2021‑07‑30 has been issued promulgating relevant Regulations in terms of the provisions of the Judicature Act enabling the Courts in the Northern Province to exercise jurisdictions to enforce financial statutes enacted by the Northern Provincial Council. When the approval of the Council was sought on 2021‑12‑13 to present the said Regulations in Parliament, the Cabinet decided that the enforcement process of the relevant financial statutes should be implemented simultaneously for both Northern and Eastern Provinces. Accordingly, the Hon. Minister of Justice has taken measures to impose Regulations in accordance with the provisions of the Judicature Act, nominating the Magistrates Courts and District Courts within the Eastern Province to hear and determine matters pertaining to all actions, proceeding or matters arising out of any Financial Statute imposed by the Eastern Provincial Council. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to present the Regulations so imposed , for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Water Supply of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Environment, Climate Change and Technology of the Republic of Maldives on Technical Cooperation towards Development of Water and Sewerage Sector
decision_details: - A proposal has been made to sign a Memorandum of Understanding on Technical Cooperation towards Development of Water and Sewerage Sector between Sri Lanka and the Maldives. Agreement of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the clearance of the Attorney General have been received for the draft agreement prepared for the purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of "Mindfulness" Programme for School Students
decision_details: - The Ministry of Education together with the "Sathi Pasala Foundation" of Ven. Udairiyagama Dhammajeeva Thero, the founder of "Sathi Pasala" have planned to implement the programme of "Mindfulness" for school students. The programme is expected to be implemented in every school in the island as an educational programme that helps to prevent the misbehaviour of students by providing the school students with the skill they need to strengthen their personality while being resilient to complex and dynamic society. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement a pilot programme on each Wednesday from 2023‑01‑04 to 2023‑03‑24 and thereafter to implement the said program every week on Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 7.30 am to 7.40 am for 10 minutes.

title: Upgrading of Ampara and Mannar Urban Councils as Municipal 	Councils
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑08‑08 to take necessary action to convert the capital cities which remain as urban councils in several districts, into municipal councils without spending additional allocations while using the existing infrastructure facilities, office facilities and human resources. Taking into consideration the said approval, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Governments to upgrade Ampara and Mannar in order to facilitate the fulfillment of the desired development tasks in the said two cities, which are the main cities of Ampara and Mannar districts, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between Sri Lanka and 	Maldives on immigration purposes
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign an MoU between Sri Lanka and Maldives for the cooperation in immigration purposes at the bilateral relations between the two countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to sign an MoU to develop and strengthen the cooperation in immigration purposes between the two countries with a view to assisting the management of border controlling for mutual benefits, facilitating the mutual cooperation for skill development in the areas of human resource system and technology, exchanging of training facilities among immigration officers in the promotion of human resources, prevention of international crimes such as illegal migration, human trafficking and smuggling of persons and promotion of cooperation on the issues related to blacklisted passengers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Australian Volunteers Programme 2022 - 2027
decision_details: - The Australian Volunteers Programme funded by the Government of Australia is being implemented across 26 countries and grants are provided under the said programme to make change through locally-led work and to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals. A Memorandum of Understanding has been entered into between Australia and Sri Lanka in the year 2017 in order to implement the said programme in Sri Lanka and the time period of the said MoU has expired by now. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign a Memorandum of Subsidiary Arrangement (MSA) to implement the said programme for another period of five years in Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparing the Bill to establish the Parliamentary Budget Office
decision_details: - The Hon. President submitted a preliminary draft for the establishment of the Parliamentary Budget Office for consideration at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑10‑31 for consideration and it was decided to refer the said preliminary draft to all party leaders of Parliament and seek their views on the matters therein. Accordingly, the Hon. Prime Minister has discussed with the party leaders regarding the preliminary draft and the views expressed at that discussion were brought to the notice of the Cabinet. As such, The Cabinet decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the draft Bill based on the preliminary draft already prepared, taking also into consideration the said views.

title: Mediation (Settlement of Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill
decision_details: - Although, the Commercial Mediation Center of Sri Lanka Act No.44 of 2000 was passed by Parliament for the establishment of a Commercial Mediation Center, the anticipated functions could not be fulfilled through the said Act due to the various technical reasons and certain limitations. At present, most of countries adopt voluntary mediation to settle disputes and most of such countries have taken action to introduce rules and regulations for voluntary mediation. Further, such countries have made necessary legislation to authorize their Courts to take action against the parties for an unreasonable refusal to voluntary mediation. It has been found necessary to introduce new legislation to the legal system of this country to encourage towards voluntary mediation giving due attention to the said international tendency. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to take necessary action to prepare the Mediation (Settlement of Civil and Commercial Disputes) Bill in order to repeal the Commercial Mediation Center of Sri Lanka Act No. 44 of 2000 and make provisions for legal provisions on voluntary mediation for civil and commercial disputes and incidental maters related thereto, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Mediation Board Act, No.72 of 1988
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2022‑09‑22 to amend the Mediation Board Act, No.72 of 1988 for introducing provisions pertaining to the appointment of members of the Commission, determining the jurisdiction of Mediation Boards, disputes that can not be settled and filing cases before courts in respect of such disputes, to be suited with the present day needs. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received to the draft Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting Legal Powers to Maintain the Sri Lanka Navy Hydrographic Service 	at National Level
decision_details: - The proposal for the vesting of marine hydrographic affairs in Sri Lanka's local waters and Exclusive Economic Zone to the Sri Lanka Navy as a non-naval duty was taken up for consideration at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑09‑05 and a Cabinet Sub‑Committee was appointed under the chairmanship of the Minister of Ports Shipping and Aviation to further study the said proposal and make recommendations.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to vest the marine hydrographic affairs in Sri Lanka's local waters and Exclusive Economic Zone to the Sri Lanka Navy as a non-naval duty by a Gazette Notification and to establish a National Hydrography Office so that all the agencies dealing with this subject can work together as per the recommendations of the said Committee , was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the National Environmental Action Plan 2022 - 2030
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑06‑20 for the National Environmental Policy. In order to implement the said policy, the Ministry of Environment has prepared the National Environmental Action Plan for the period of 2022 - 2030 in collaboration with all relevant parties while adhering to the Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations and giving consideration to the environmental challenges of the twenty first century. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to implement the said action plan and establish the Committee on Integrated Environment & Development Policy under the chairmanship of the Secretary, to the President in order to take policy decisions at national level and monitor the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposal of an allotment of land for the College of General Practitioners of 	Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The College of General Practitioners of Sri Lanka has been established in terms of the provisions of the Act, No.26 of 1974 in order to promote the education of medical practitioner in Sri Lanka. A request has been made to allocate a plot of land to establish and maintain a new office complex for the said College. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism and Lands to transfer an allotment of land in extent of 21.30 perches located at the Thimbirigasyaya Divisional Secretariat Division, belonging to the Government to the College of General Practitioners of Sri Lanka, by way of a free grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the assistance of the Asia Foundation to continuously maintain 	the mediation related activities of the Community Mediation Boards and 	Special Land Mediation Boards
decision_details: - The Asia Foundation which has supported the mediation programme in sri Lanka since its inception has agreed to grant further financial support to continuously maintain and strengthen the mediation related activities of the Community Mediation Boards and Special Land Mediation Boards. Accordingly, the Asia Foundation has agreed to provide a grant of Rs.127 million for the said purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to sign a Memorandum of Understanding to obtain the aforesaid grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Ministry of Health of Sri Lanka and the Christian Medical College of Vellore, India
decision_details: - A bone marrow transplant programme was started in the year 2015 at the Lady Ridgeway Children's Hospital and the Cristian Medical College of Vellore, India has assisted in training the required staff for the said programme in 2017. At present, the basic infrastructure facilities for bone marrow transplant have been established in the Lady Ridgeway Children's Hospital and the said Medical College has agreed to formally provide assistance in the fields of consultation and training in order to maintain its functioning productively. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Health and the Christian Medical College of Vellore, India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting the South Asian Sub-Regional Committee Meeting and Project Proposal Development Training Programme of the Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research
decision_details: - Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research is an inter-government network of 22 member countries working towards an Asia-Pacific Region capable of effectively addressing the challenges of global change and sustainability. The prime objective of the said network is to conduct policy-based research required for the global sustainable development in the Asia-Pacific Region and develop the capacity of the region. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Minister of Environment on action taken to host to conduct the South Asian Sub-Regional Committee Meeting and Project Proposal Development Training Programme of the Asia-Pacific Network for Global Change Research in Colombo from 2022‑11‑29 to 2022‑12‑01, by the Government of Sri Lanka.

title: Extending the validity period of the Order issued under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017
decision_details: - Orders have been issued from time to time as per the provisions of the Foreign Exchange Act to suspend/restrict the foreign exchange outflow pertaining to the certain capital transactions taking into account the negative impact that may cause to the foreign exchange market. The validity period of the currently issued Order would expire on 2022‑12‑29. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economy and Policy Development to take necessary action to extend the validity period of the Order issued under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 for another period of six (06) months with effect from 2022‑12‑30, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of Regulations under the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017, to accommodate Short Term Foreign Loans from overseas to finance payments for the import of raw materials by Local Subsidiaries
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to impose Regulations under section 7(1) of the Foreign Exchange Act, No.12 of 2017 to facilitate the payments utilizing the foreign exchange remitted by mother companies of local subsidiaries located outside Sri lanka or companies within the same group of companies, when importing raw materials by the said local subsidiaries to produce goods for the local market, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Imposing Regulations under Section 47(1) of the Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940
decision_details: - The Department of Archaeology and other State Institutions have the capacity to take legal action against an individual violating the Antiquities Ordinance by unlawfully damaging a site or property of archaeological importance. Accordingly, the aforesaid State Institutions contribute the protection of the archaeological places in Sri Lanka and conservation of the same on behalf of the future generation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to take necessary action to impose appropriate regulations as per the provisions of the Antiquities Ordinance No.9 of 1940, enabling to grant an allowance from the Antiquities Gift Fund with a view to further motivating the staff members of the said institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the Buddhist Temporalities Ordinance No.19 of 1931 and drafting the Theravada Bhikku Kathikavath (Registration) Bill
