Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, the Cabinet granted approval to appoint a Committee comprising of the representation of the parties including Religious Leaders, Experts in the field of legal profession, Members of the  Security Forces, Conductors of Rehabilitation programmes for drug addicts for the purpose of obtaining recommendations to amend the said Ordinance in accordance with the present requirements and to amend the Ordinance based on the recommendations made by the aforesaid Committee.

title: Amendment to the Registration of Documents Ordinance (Caveat)
decision_details: - At present no buyer will buy a land with a Caveat and a land of that type can not be mortgaged to any  lending institution. Certain fraudulent people are found to have obtained Caveat orders from courts for certain lands which they have no legal right to claim ownership or interest and used such Caveat Orders as a tactical means of taking extortion from the actual owner.  In order to prevent the occurrence of such incidents, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice to amend the Registration of Documents Ordinance as proposed by the Law Commission and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a bill for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhuman and Degrading Treatment or Punishment Act, No.22 of 1994
decision_details: - Torture and other cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment is explicitly prohibited by Article 11 of the Constitution. Such people should be condemned and punished in the strongest possible manner. Therefore, it has been identified that fines in the Convention against Torture and other Cruel, Inhuman and Degrading Treatment or Punishment Act, No.22 of 1994 should be revised to suite to the present day requirement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a bill for the purpose of amending the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the National Transport Commission  Act, No. 37 of 1991
decision_details: - It has been identified that certain provisions in the National Transport Commission Act No 37 of 1991 are not applicable to meet the complexity in present transport system. Therefore, it has been identified that it is appropriate to amend the said Act and accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Justice to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a bill to amend the said Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Universities Act, No.16 of 1978 for inclusion of provisions required for the establishment of Universities with specific purposes in this country in order to convert Colleges of Nursing and Teacher Training Colleges into Universities
decision_details: - It has been identified the need to create globally competitive professionals with high professional recognition and proficiency, enhancing the quality of Nursing and Teaching professions in order to build a knowledge based economy through human resource development within the Government Policy Framework “Vistas of Prosperity”. At present, there is a high demand for nursing and teaching professionals in global competitive job market. The need to improve the quality of Nursing Colleges operating under the supervision and regulation of the Ministry of Health and Teacher Training Colleges which produce teaching professionals functioning under the Ministry of Education has also been identified and it is observed that establishing of two separate universities for the said purpose is appropriate. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Education and the Minister of Health to amend the Universities Act, No.16 of 1978, enabling to establish the proposed two universities as universities with specific purposes, deviating from the traditional modal universities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submitting the General Sir John Kotelawala National Defence University Bill in Parliament
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2013‑03‑01 to repeal the existing  General Sir John Kotelawala National Defence University Act and to introduce a new Act to further expand the academic activities of the General Sir John Kotelawala National Defence University for the purpose of enhancing its role and functions as a National Defence University. Accordingly, the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman has been published in the Government Gazette and the proposal made by H.E. the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to present the said Gazette Notification in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Kithul Crop' to be nominated as a major plantation crop in Sri Lanka and establishment of the Kithul Development Board
decision_details: - Kithul related production industry which is endemic to Sri Lanka is recognized as a highly potential industry for earning foreign exchange and various actions have been taken to uplift the Kithul industry during the previous periods. It has been found that expansion of Kithul related industry under the programme to create a public centred economy across the promotion of local products implemented by the present government is appropriate. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to nominate Kithul crop as a major plantation crop and to establish the Kithul Development Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Access to Biological Material and Fair and Equitable Benefit Sharing
decision_details: - Sri Lanka is considered to be the leading country in Asia in is bio-diversity and  the country is also internationally recognized as a country which is abundant  with fertile marshy lands / wet lands, coastal belts and marine bio – diversity. Despite the actions have been taken to conserve the bio – diversity and to  prevent bio-theft and bio-piracy, it seems that such misappropriations continuous occur. It is also observed that, Sri Lanka would lose the benefits to be accrued to the country, if  the specimens that are sent out of the country for taxonomic identification, would be used by the developed countries for making new products without having obtanied the consent of Sri Lanka. As a remedy for the problem, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment, pertaining to the “National Policy on Access to Biological Material and Fair and Equitable Benefit Sharing” which has been drafted with the participation of all stakeholders under the guidance of the Special Committee on the  National Policy on Access to Biological Material and Fair and Equitable Benefit Sharing, functioning under the Ministry of Environment and its implementation mechanism by the State Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Gem and Jewellery (License Fee) Regulations No.1 of 2020 for approval in Parliament
decision_details: - Each regulation made by the Minister in charge as per the provisions of Section 53 of the National Gem and Jewellery Authority Act No. 50 of 1993, should be published in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament for approval. Accordingly,  the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to present the “Gem and Jewellery (License Fee) Regulations No.1 of 2020” published by the Gazette Notification 2020‑03‑01 by the Minister in charge of the subject for the purpose of formalizing the fees charged for the services provided by the said Authority, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Application of Land Acquisition (Compensation) Regulations 2013 for the Road Projects of Ruwanpura Expressway Project and the Port City Elevated Expressway Project
decision_details: - Measures have been taken to compensate for the lands acquired for 18 projects implemented under the Ministry of Highways, in terms of the provisions of the “Land Acquisition (Compensation) Regulations 2013” published under the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No.1864/54. Under those provisions, the affected parties may possible to presence themselves to the Land Acquisition and Resettlement Committee and obtain concessions in addition to the statutory compensation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Highways to make apply the Land Acquisition (Compensation) Regulations 2013 also for the Road Projects of Ruwanpura Expressway Project and the Port City Elevated Expressway Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: “Irrigation Prosperity” Accelerated Irrigation Rehabilitation Programme
decision_details: - Since there is not any specific financial source for maintaining approximately 50,000 rural small scale rural tanks, anicuts and canal systems and cascade systems scattered throughout the island, it has been found difficult to maintain them. Due to this situation, it is observed that approximately 1,000 rural irrigation systems are destroyed at the end of monsoon rains of each year and  as a result of that, around 150,000 acres of cultivable paddy lands have been turned baron. As a remedy for the issue, an accelerated two year programme named ‘Irrigation Prosperity’ has been planned to be implemented in order to re - activate 5,000 small scale rural irrigation and drinking water systems under the guidance of the Presidential Task Force on Economic Revival and Poverty Alleviation with the objective of increasing the national food production. The proposed programme has been planned to be implemented deviating from the contract procedure and using human resources and machines owned by the Government with the participation of rural level religious leadership, farmer community, school system, youth community as well as the contribution of the Private sector, subject to obtaining labour from the rural farmer community  on daily payment basis as far as possible. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Minister of Irrigation, that the initiatives pertaining to the inauguration of the said programme for 1000 rural reservoirs, on 2021‑02‑04 has been organized.

title: Designing of the Vehicle Number Plate Issuance Process in a way that is convenient for clients by removing the provincial letter
decision_details: - In the process of vehicle registration, Provincial identification letters are added to vehicle number plates, thereby making ease the process of the vehicular emission test and in the issuance of annual revenue licenses. However, both the customers as well as the Department of Motor Traffic have  encountered many difficulties since the number plates have to be changed at each instance the right of ownership of the vehicles are transferred between provinces. Since a unique number is issued to each registered vehicle at the time of registration, the identity of each vehicle can be easily recognized via the departmental data base. Considering those facts, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport to remove the provincial letters at time of issuance of vehicle number plates, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining approval to adopt the Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi - Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC)  Charter
decision_details: - The Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi - Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) was established in the year 1997 as a forum to stimulate corporation in the Bay of Bengal region. The cooperation is comprised of seven (07) countries namely Bangladesh, Bhutan, Nepal, Myanmar, India, Sri Lanka and Thailand. As decided at the Fourth Summit held in Kathmandu in 2018, initiatives have been taken to prepare a draft Charter  for the purpose of formulating institutional guidelines for the cooperation and the formulation of the said Charter has been completed at the 21st Session of the Senior Official's Meeting of the BIMSTEC. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Foreign Minister to adopt the said Charter as a member state at the 5th Summit of BIMSTEC scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka in early 2021, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Sri Lanka Consulate General Office in Antananarivo, Madagascar
decision_details: - The diplomatic relations between Sri Lanka and Madagascar have been initiated in the year 2001 and Sri Lanka High Commission in Victoria, Seashells is concurrently accredited to Madagascar. Considering the enormous economic opportunities available for Sri Lanka as well as the requirements of migrant Sri Lankans and businessmen residing in Madagascar, it seems appropriate to set up a Consulate General Office in Madagascar. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Foreign Minister   for opening a Sri Lanka Consulate General Office in Madagascar.

title: Amendment of the project period and number of houses constructed under the 'Virusumithuru Housing Project'
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet decision dated 2017‑04‑04, the 'Virusumithuru Housing Project' is implemented by the National Housing Development Authority together with the Ranaviru Sewa Authority for the families of the war heroes who have sacrificed their lives and injured at the battle field operations. The project duration is 04 years and it was scheduled to be completed by 2020. However, another 346 beneficiaries for the construction of new houses and 2,454 beneficiaries for completion of constructions of the partially constructed houses have been selected under the project. Therefore, the Cabinet approved the joint proposal made by H.E the President and the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing to amend the scope of the said project enabling to complete 4000 partially built houses since there is a rising demand for the completion of such houses and to build 450 new houses as well as to extend the project duration until the end of 2022.

title: Making a Free Grant for the land where the Faculty of Graduate Studies of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University has been located
decision_details: - The Faculty of Graduate Studies of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University has been established in a plot of land in extent of 01 rood and 37.2 perches. The said land plot has been taken over by the Government in terms of the interim provision 38(A) of the Land Acquisition Act. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to vest the said plot of land with General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University as a free grant under the Section 6(1) of the State Lands Ordinance, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract of 10MW Wind Power Plant for the Trincomalee Grid Substation
decision_details: - It has been decided to add  a wind power capacity 60 MW for the electricity supply system through Trincomalee, Mannar, Bolawatta, Madampe and Kappalthure Grid Substations with the view to increase the usage of renewable energy sources. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power to award the contract for the purchase of 10MW wind power capacity for a time period of 20 years for Trincomalee Grid Substation at the rate of Rs.14.52 per unit (14.52 LKR/Kwh)and to construct the above mentioned power plant inter connectedly to the transmission network for the Capital City Holdings (Pvt)Ltd., by following the international competitive bidding procedure and as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Negotiating, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the 100 MW Siyambalanduwa Solar Power Plant under the Private Sector Investment
decision_details: - The necessary preliminary steps such as feasibility study, allocation of lands, environmental impact assessment etc., have been taken at present to implement the Siyabalanduwa Solar Power Plant. The assistance of the Asian Development Bank has been received to conduct an implementation method on the development of that power plant and the financial analysis. The said analysis has proved that the single power plant of 100MW and transmission facilities should be implemented as a single procument of 100 MW single power plant and transmission facilities, if it is to obtain the lowest charge for power purchase for the generation and transmission of a unit of electricity according to the various capacity opportunities that could be implemented. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Power to initiate the procurement procedure by the Ceylon Electricity Board, the licensee of transmission, to implement the proposed project through private sector investments and to construct the power line from Medagama to Ampara by the Ceylon Electricity Board under the aforementioned project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the Contract for the Supply, Installation and Supervision of two 132/33kV, 45MVA Power Transformers for the Wagawatta Grid Substation
decision_details: - Competitive Bids have been called to award the contract for the Supply, Installation and Supervision of two 132/33kV, 45MVA Power Transformers for the Wagawatta Grid Substation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power to award the said contract to  M/s PT.CG. Power Systems, Indonesia to a sum of Rs.245.62 million (Excluding VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for the construction of the Engineering Faculty Building of the University of Sri Jayawardenepura
decision_details: - International Competitive Bids have been called for construction of the Engineering Faculty Building of the University of Sri Jayawardhanapura under the Science and Technology Human Resources Development Project on design and build basis. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the said contract to M/s Sanken Constructions (Pvt) Ltd., to a sum of Rs.3,624.96 million (Excluding VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee , was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Yakkala, Werellawatta Middle Income Housing Project
decision_details: - The Urban Development Authority has planned to implement a middle income housing project with 500 houses in the Werellawatta area in Yakkala under 03 phases. Preliminary work is prepared to construct 154 houses under its first phase as a 12-storey building comprising of 132 houses of 600 square feet and 22 houses of 900 square feet. The total estimated cost of the project is Rs.1503.30 million and the cost of construction is expected to be secured through pre-sales. Accordingly the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing for the implementation of the proposed project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of two buildings consisting of 30 houses under the Soyzapura Relocation Housing Project
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2014‑10‑16 to implement the Soysapura Relocation Housing Project for the construction of 05 buildings consisting 20 houses each to relocate 48 dilapidated two-storey, half-rented houses and 24 dilapidated shanties located within the premises of the Soysapura Housing Scheme. Accordingly, the relevant families have been resettled in 60 houses constructed in 3 buildings. Though, 40 houses on a pre-sale basis were planned to be built in the remaining two buildings it has been observed that only 30 houses can be constructed under the existing provisions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing to construct 30 houses each consisting of 550 square feet on pre-sale basis, as a building consisting of 20 houses and a building consisting of 10 houses under the Soysapura Housing Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Building for the proposed Army Base Hospital at Pallekale
decision_details: - A new base hospital is designed to be constructed at Pallekele, Kandy to provide basic medical treatment to army personnel serving and residing in Kandy and surrounding districts. For the purpose, it is expected to construct a 3 storey building and the estimated cost is Rs.376.22 million. Accordingly the proposal made by H.E the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence  to complete the construction of the proposed hospital within a year using the labour of other ranks of the Sri Lanka Army Professionals and to secure provisions required for the purpose from the General Treasury, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase the quality seed production required to enhance the availability of crop production in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The "Food Production National Program", launched in the Yala season 2020 to reduce imports by cultivating locally grown crops, is now being successfully implemented. Since it is difficult for the Department of Agriculture alone to provide quality seeds to increase harvests and the area of cultivated lands the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture to implement a formal program in collaboration with the Provincial and Inter-Provincial Departments of Agriculture and the Seed Producers' Institutions in the Mahaweli areas, enabling the farmers to produce their own  seed requirements in respective areas.

title: Establishment of the 1000 Acre Fodder Silage Baling Project  at the Polonnaruwa Farm of the National Livestock Development Board
decision_details: - Lack of quality roughage has been identified as a major issue in large scale dairy farms belonging to the National Livestock Development Board and generally, one dairy cow should be fed with roughage of about 10% of her body weight. As a remedy to this situation, it has been planned to commence a Fodder Silage Baling Project within 1000 acres  of the Polonnaruwa farm of the National Livestock Development Board. As its initial stage, it has been planned to cultivate 1000 acres of nutritive maize and sorghum and produce mechanized baled silage and to import 2000 dairy cows and keep them in the farms as the second phase of the project, Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agricultur to obtain 60% of the total capital expenditure estimated for the project as a government contribution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securing necessary financial support for the working capital requirement of the Laksala
decision_details: - Revenue earned by Laksala  has dropped by 90% due to the absence of foreign tourists due to the Covid-19 pandemic, making it difficult to run the institution. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to secure the necessary provisions from the General Treasury for salaries and working capital requirements including other essential expenses required to function the Laksala, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Formulating a Long-Term 'Human Resource Development Plan' for the Public Service
decision_details: - Formulation and implementation of a long-term "Human Resource Development Plan" has been identified as an urgent programme for enhancing the performance and productivity of the public sector. Public Administration Circular No. 02/2018 dated 2018‑01‑24, emphasizes the need of preparing a Human Resource Development Plan by every State Institution. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Services, Provincial Councils and Local Government to formulate a long term "Human Resource Development Plan" with the participation of all relevant parties to enhance the efficiency and productivity of the public service, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the number of National Schools to 1000
decision_details: - Policy approval has been granted by the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2019‑12‑10 to implement an appropriate program to establish 1000 new National Schools covering all Divisional Secretariat Divisions. Accordingly, the program is planned to be implemented in three phases and the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement the relevant programme to develop one selected Provincial Council School as a National School in each of the 123 Divisional Secretariat Divisions in which there are no National Schools as the first phase, to upgrade 673 schools selected on the basis of identified criteria as National Schools under the second phase and to further develop the existing 373 National Schools under the third phase,was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Institutional Name of the Children's Secretariat as the 'National Secretariat for Early Childhood Development'
decision_details: - The "Children's Secretariat" which has been established in the year 1979, functions as the central institution that executes the National Policy on Early Childhood Care and Development. Though the institute also plays a special role in the field of early childhood education, it seems that, the current institutional name of the said Secretariat does not imply that role. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to amend the institutional name of “Children's Secretariat” as “National Secretariat for Early Childhood Development”, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the method of payment of four housing projects implemented with the Indian Government Aid
decision_details: - The Government of India has granted an award of Rs.300 million each for implementing 04 projects for the construction of houses for low – income families and the relevant projects are being implemented by the National Housing Development Authority. Steps will be taken to release applicable funds followed by a progress report submitted to the Indian High Commission by National Housing Development Authority upon the completion of the relevant construction by the beneficiaries with their cost. However, since the house owners do not have sufficient funds to complete the construction as supposed that the progress of the project lies at a lower level. Therefore the Indian High Commission has agreed to release the initial payment required for the construction at the inauguration of work and continue to release the rest of the instalments on the progress of the construction. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing for taking necessary action to implement the said projects,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation Act, No.15 of 1968
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2015‑12‑02 for further amendment of the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation Act, No. 15 of 1968 (Amended) as amended by the Acts, No. 27 of 1976, No. 52 of 1982, No. 35 of 2006 and No. 11 of 2019. Accordingly, clearance from the Attorney General has been received for the draft bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing to publish the said draft bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter present the same in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Performing essential renovation and rehabilitation activities of the Mahinda Rajapaksa National Tele Cinema Park
decision_details: - Mahinda Rajapaksha National Tele Cinema Park has been established for earmarking a renaissance in the local cinema and tele creations sector by providing studios and scenic background facilities as well as accommodation and other facilities for artists of the said field, on a concessionary basis. 13 local films, 18 tele dramas and 08 songs for advertisements have been produced up to date since the year 2010. Since this park has not been properly maintained for the past four years, most of the physical resources of the institution are being deteriorated. Therefore, it has been identified that prompt actions should be taken to carry out essential renovations of the tele cinema park and accordingly, the the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs for allocating funds from the General Treasury during the years 2021 and 2022 for the purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining provisions for the working capital requirements of the Central Cultural Fund
decision_details: - The income of the Central Cultural Fund has been declined due to the complete collapsing down of the tourism industry with the expansion of the global Corona pandemic. Although, actions have been taken previously to obtain a loan of Rs.135 million for the activities of the said fund having obtained the Cabinet approval, it has been observed that, the amount obtained is not sufficient for maintaining the institutional activities. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of  Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs for obtaining Rs.50 million from the General Treasury for settling the bills relevant to the conservation and construction activities presently being performed by the institution, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the published Gazette Notifications for approval in Parliament
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance for the submission of the following Gazette Notifications in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

(i) 	Gazette Notifications issued under the Ports and Airports Development Levy Act, No. 18 of 2011;

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2191/25 dated 2020-09-02 

*	  Gazette Notification No. 2198/57 dated 2020-10-23

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2199/2 dated 2020-10-26

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2203/37 dated 2020-11-28

(ii) 	Gazette Notifications issued under the Excise (Special Provisions) Act No. 13 of 1989;

*	Gazette Notification No. 2189/47 dated 2020-08-21

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2197/3 dated 2020-10-12

(iii) 	the Gazette Notification No. 2194/6 dated 2020-09-21 published under the Finance Act No. 25 of 2003

(iv)	Gazette Notifications under the Strategic Development Projects Act No. 14 of 2008

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2201/6 dated 2020-11-10

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2202/3 dated 2020-11-16

*	 Gazette Notification No. 2203/16 dated 2020-11-24.

title: Project to manufacture semi steel radial tyres and all steel radial tyres for export market
decision_details: - Shandong Haohua Tire Co. Limited of China has submitted a project proposal to the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka with an investment of US$ 300 million for the establishment of a project within the premises of Hambantota International Port for manufacturing semi - steel radial tyres and total steel radial tyres for the export market. The board of investment of Sri Lanka has given its consent for the implementation of this project as a strategic development project under the Strategic Development Act (Amended) No. 14 of 2008. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to grant the relevant tax concessions as per the provisions furnished by the Strategic Development Act, subject to inauguration of the project within a period of 36 months and export at least 80% of the total production, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Construction Contract of 27.7km long Tunnel Section in 95.86km long North Central Main Canal Project
decision_details: - It has been planned to construct a 27.7 km tunnel from Koduruwawa to Namalpura via the protected forests and sanctuaries in Minneriya, Girithale and Hurulu as a package of the Mahaweli Water Security Investment Programme which is implemented under the funds of the Asian Development Bank. For the purpose, international competitive bids have been invited to select a suitable contractor. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation to award the relevant contract to the China State Construction Engineering Corporation Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Committee to look into the irregularities that occurred in the Grand Hyatt Project
decision_details: - The Grand Hyatt Hotel Project is implemented by the Sino Lanka (Pvt) Ltd, which possesses the ownership of the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation, Employees’ Provident Fund and Litro Gas Lanka Ltd. The hotel was scheduled to open in business activities during the first quarter of 2016 afterwards the completion of construction. Provided that, most of the agreements signed by the previous Government were terminated by the new board of directors of the Sino Lanka (Pvt) Ltd. which was appointed following the 2015 presidential election without any justifiable reason and has been entered into agreements with new contractors for aforementioned work phases. Therefore, some companies have initiated legal proceedings and it has been decided that the Sino Lanka (Pvt) Ltd shall pay approximately a sum of Rs.1.8 billion as compensation. The current cost of the the project, which was originally planned to be completed at an estimated cost of Rs.30 billion , has been re-estimated to be around Rs.60 billion. Therefore, approval has been granted by the Cabinet for proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to appoint a committee to investigate whether the Government has incurred a financial loss as it appears that the situation has arisen due to the irregularities committed by the previous management of the Sino Lanka (Pvt) Ltd.

title: Construction of the new Court Complex, Kalutara
decision_details: - Kaluthara Court Complex which is already being operated within a land and buildings with an archaeological value and the Ministry of Justice has been endowed a plot of land in extent of 1.064 hectares to build a New Court Complex under the Kaluthara Urban Development Project. Therefore the proposal made by the Minister of Justice to award the consultancy service for the construction of the new Court Complex to the Central Engineering Consultancy Bureau, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the term contract for the import of Gasoline for a period of eight months from 2020-12-01 to 2021-07-31
decision_details: - Bids have been called from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to import 1,564,500 Bbls +10/-5% of Gasoline (92 Unl) & 535,500 Bbls +10/-5% of Gasoline (95 Unl) during the period of eight months from 2020‑12‑01 to 2021‑07‑31. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to award the relevant procurement to M/s BB Energy (Asia) pte. Ltd., Singapore, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of the contract for the supply and distribution of Arial Bundled Conductor Alu. (ABC) 230/400V 3x70+54.6+16 sqmm - 2000km
decision_details: - Competitive bids have been called for the supply of Arial Bundled Conductors for distribution zone 2 of the Ceylon Electricity Board. Accordingly, the proposal made by Minister of power to award the contract for the supply and distribution of Arial Bundled Conductor Alu. (ABC) 230/400V 3x70+54.6+16 sqmm - 2000km of the Ceylon Electricity Board to M/s ACL Cables PLC as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Suraksha Student Insurance Coverage 2020/2021
decision_details: - Proposals have been invited from Government-owned insurance companies for “Suraksha” student insurance. In response to the invitation, only the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation has submitted a proposal. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the Procurement for the securing of Suraksha Student Insurance Scheme to the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, following the negotiations conducted with the said Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development and Conservation of the National Art Gallery
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been received on several occasions for the renovation of the National Art Gallery. Although the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2018‑08‑21 has granted approval to allocate Rs. 42 million for the purpose, relevant renovations have not been carried out. Main building of the Art Gallery is in a dilapidated condition due to water leaking from the main rain water pipe that was installed to drain the rainwater and it needs to be repaired immediately. Accordingly, the proposal presented by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to obtain the services of the Sri Lanka Navy and carry out the relevant repairs of the National Art Gallery, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Livestock Development Projects for the year 2021
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement “Saubhagya” Diary Development Programme and the "Dairy Development Centres" project in the year 2021 to increase local milk production under the State Ministry of Livestock, Farm Promotion and Dairy & Egg Related Industries. Activities such as improving efficiency of animal breeding, animal nutrition, animal health conditions and creating eco‑friendly farms through animal waste management are planned under the “Sauubhagya” Dairy Development Programme. The Dairy Development Centres Establishment Project aims to develop the milk value chain process by upgrading artificial insemination Centres, providing the necessary inputs and training, and networking Veterinary Surgeon's offices. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture to secure provisions within the 2021-2023 Medium Term Budget Framework for the implementation of these projects, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of Postal Stamps in Commemoration of 50 years of Sri Lanka-Singapore Diplomatic Relations
decision_details: - The Department of Posts of Sri Lanka and Singapore Post Limited have agreed to issue two stamps each in commemoration of 50 years of Sri Lanka-Singapore diplomatic relations. Accordingly, it is planned to create stamps under a common theme "Oceanic Bio Conservation" for both parties and to exchange each 4000 stamps and 1000 commemorative leaflets between the two parties. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Media to sign a Memorandum of Understanding for the purpose between the two countries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Facilitating the issuance of vehicle number plates and driving licenses to the client public through the speed post courier service
decision_details: - The vehicle registration certificate, vehicle number plates and a sticker are issued when registering a vehicle. Under the existing system, one has to come to the Department of Motor Traffic spending considerable time and expense in order to obtain them. Further, there seems to be some delay in sending new driver's licenses by registered mail to clients. As a remedy for the issue, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport to implement a suitable programme in collaboration with the Postal Department enabling to deliver them to the client's home under the express courier service implemented by the Postal Department, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a National Policy to Collect Sex-and Age- Disaggregated Data and Information
decision_details: - The difficulty in obtaining information on gender and age disaggregated data with the exception of a limited number of census and surveys by the Department of Census and Statistics and the surveys of the health sector has become an issue in the policy and planning process. This information is essential for identifying Government-prioritized needs, especially in the field of child and women's development, and for understanding their trends and determining plans and strategies for addressing them. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to make it compulsory to collect information based on gender and age group in all census, surveys and studies conducted by Ministries, Departments and Statutory Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing number of sports schools, development of infrastructure facilities in sports schools and increasing nutrition allowances and other allowances for the sports scholarship holders
decision_details:
- Measures have been taken in the year 1989 to inaugurate sports schools in all the districts, having one sports school in each district in the island. A programme has been planned collectively by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Youth & Sports in order to implement the said concept more productively. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the following joint proposals made by the Minister of Education and the Minister of Youth & Sports.

*	Development of infrastructure facilities in 26 existing sports schools.

*	 Development of the following schools as special sports schools.

i. 	Inauguration and development of a new bi - lingual National School by the name of ‘Cricket Sports School’ within the premises of Sooriyawewa International Cricket Stadium and enrol students to the grade six (6) from the year 2021.

ii.	Development of Pelwatte Navodya School as a sports school for athletics/ Volleyball.

iii. Development of Mahinda Rajapaksha Vidyalaya, Pitipana for athletics.

iv. Development of Murunkan Maha Vidyalaya, Mannar for football / athletics.

*	Construction of new school hostels in the sport schools where there are no hostels and development of the existing hostels.

*	 Increase of sports scholarships and other allowances to suit the current requirements.

title: Providing relief to those who have been affected due to Weras Ganga Storm water Drainage and Environment Improvement project
decision_details:
- Construction work of the Weras Ganga Storm water Drainage and Environment Improvement project has been inaugurated in 2013 with the objective of flood control in Colombo and suburbs, improvement of environmental systems, conservation of wetlands, conservation of sanctuaries as well as expanding the cannel system. Actions have been taken to compensate 80% of the value recommended by the Department of Valuation for the buildings and other constructions which will be affected by the said project and to pay a housing rental for obtaining temporary housing facilities for a period of 06 months for the people whose residences are totally evacuated under the project. The lands required for the project have been acquired by now and the construction work is scheduled to be concluded by the year 2020.

The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development & Housing for further payment of housing rental paid for residing in temporary houses for an additional period until compensation is paid at a time the payment of statutory compensation decided for them is delayed more than 06 months due to unavoidable reasons and to pay 100% of the total estimated amount recommended by the Department of Valuation for the construction houses and buildings that are totally evacuated.

title: Construction of the Administrative Complex-Polonnaruwa
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2016‑10‑18 for the construction of the administrative complex of Polonnaruwa. The building has been constructed under the supervision of the Urban Development Authority having spent Rs.1,018 million. It has been planned to accommodate 19 Government and Semi – Government institutions in this building complex. Another Rs.265 million has been estimated to be spent for completion of its construction activities comprised of affixing air conditioning system, installation of electricity generators, completion of remaining work of the auditorium as well as landscaping. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development & Housing to secure required allocations to the State Ministry of Urban Development, Coast Conservation, Waste Disposal and Community Cleanliness for completion of construction work of the said building, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Acquiring the 48 Waththa land where the Sinhapura Housing Complex has been built to the Urban Settlement Development Authority
decision_details: - Under two phases of the Sinhapura Housing Scheme Project, housing facilities have been provided to 120 low - income families living amidst minimum facilities within the Colombo Municipal Council area within a block of land in extent of 0.4423 hectares belonging to Wanathamulla of Divisional Secretariat Division, Thimbirigasyaya. The said housing programme has been implemented by an establishment called Real Estate Exchange (Pvt.) Limited which was fallen under the then Ministry which was vested with the subject of Housing, and has spent Rs. 174.15 million of budgetary allocations from the General Treasury for the purpose. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development & Housing for transferring the relevant plot of land to the Urban Development Authority as a free grant, enabling to issue deeds for those low – income families who have been granted houses, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the published Gazette Extraordinary Notifications to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to submit six Gazette Extraordinary Notifications published under the Special Commodity Levy Act, No.48 of 2007, one Gazette Extraordinary Notification published under the Revenue Protection Act, No.19 of 1962 and one Gazette Extraordinary Notification issued in respect of imposing Surcharge on customs import duty for imported fuel in terms of the provisions of Customs Ordinance, to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the validity period of the Order issued under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act No. 12 of 2017 on restriction of Foreign Exchange Outflows
decision_details: - The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2020‑06‑24 granted approval to issue an Order valid for a period of 06 months under section 22 of the Foreign Exchange Act No. 12 of 2017 to impose restrictions relating to outward foreign exchange capital transactions. Accordingly, the said Order has been imposed by the Gazette Extraordinary Notification dated 2020‑07‑02 and its validity period will expire on 2021‑01‑01. It has been found that it would be appropriate to extend the period of the same for another 06 months. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to take necessary action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the term of the Committee established to make recommendations to regularize and make efficient the State Banking System to strengthen the National Economy
decision_details: - The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2020‑07‑22 granted approval to establish a Committee to submit appropriate recommendations within 03 months to regularize and make efficient the state banking system to strengthen the National economy. However, due to the prevailing situation in the country, the work of the committee could not be completed as expected. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to extend the term of the Committee for a period of three months with effect from 2020‑11‑18, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Programme for the Budget Debate - 2021
decision_details: - Programme for the Budget Debate for the Financial Year 2021 prepared by the Office of the Leader of the House of Parliament and the Committee Stage Programme prepared by the Office of the Leader of the Opposition of Parliament, were submitted by the Hon. Prime Minister for the attention of the Cabinet. Accordingly, the Cabinet noted that it has been scheduled to conduct the Budget Speech on 2020‑11‑17, the Second Reading of the Budget from 2020‑11‑18 to 21, and that 16 days have been allocated for the Committee Stage from 2020‑11‑23 to 2020‑12‑10 and that the Third Reading Vote will take place on 2020.12.10.

title: Purchasing a Maintenance andEmergency Response Vessel (MERV) 	for The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation
decision_details: - The fact that hiring a Maintenance and Emergency Response Vessel for the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation was discussed at the Cabinet meeting held on 2020‑07‑22 and it was decided at that Cabinet meeting to explore the possibility of providing relevant services by purchasing a Maintenance andEmergency Response Vessel by the Sri Lanka Navy.Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to purchase a new Maintenance and Emergency Response Vessel by the Sri Lanka Navy thereby connecting ships to two Single Point Buoy Moorings of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, to provide tanker discharging operations and other necessary services and to purchase the said vessel from the Colombo Dockyard Company as agreed during the deliberations with the participation of the Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Defence and officials concerned, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Eppawala, Rajanganaya, Nochchiyagama & Giribawa Water Supply Project
decision_details: - A detailed financial proposal has been called from a Swiss Company to implement the Eppawala, Rajanganaya, Nochchiyagama and Giribawa Water Supply Project on the recommendation of the then Cabinet Sub Committee on Economic Management. The cost of the project presented by the said company was found to be very high. Therefore, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply, the Cabinet granted its approval to implement the said project under the local funds within the Medium‑Term Budgetary Framework pursuant to the plans prepared by the National Water Supply and Drainage Board by revising the scope of the said project.

title: The proposed Voluntary Retirement Scheme of Sri Lankan Airlines Ltd.
decision_details: - It has been decided to implement a Voluntary Retirement Scheme due to the financial crisis of the Sri Lankan Airlines Ltd. and a Three – Member Committee headed by the Secretary to the State Ministry of Aviation and Export Zones Development has been appointed to examine this matter. The said Committee has recommended to implement the proposed Voluntary Retirement Scheme without any hindrance to the operations of the Company for the next three years. It is expected that approximately 560 employees will be retired under this scheme andit has been estimated that Rs1.46 billion would be the cost on it. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Tourism to implement the aforesaid Retirement Scheme, was approved by the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka and Council of Scientific and Industrial Research Institute of Himalayan Bio-Resource Technology, India
decision_details: - The Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka has been awarded a grant to conduct a two year research project under the Indo – Sri Lanka Joint Research Programme on “High throughput genotyping to expedite the genetic characterization and dissection of important agronomic traits of tea”. The main objective of this research is to develop the molecular biology techniques required to accelerate the tea breeding programmes by reducing the time taken for cultivar development. Accordingly,the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Tea Research institute of Sri Lanka and the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research Institute of Himalayan Bio Resource Technology, India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing production relief for six (06) selected crops under the Saubhagya 	Food 	Production 	National Program
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has been granted to provide guaranteed price for 16 crops and to provide seeds with the intervention of the Government with a view to encouraging local farmers. It seems appropriate to provide government assistance to farmers for obtaining seeds to meet the annual consumption requirement of Maize, Chillie, Big Onion, Red Onion, Potato and Black Gram locally, which are currently restricted to import. Accordingly, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, the Cabinet granted approvalto provide a 50% subsidy for the cost incurred on obtaining seeds up to one (1) acre of Maize and up to 1/2 acre of Chilli, Big Onion, Red Onion, Potato and Black Gram for the Maha season 2020/2021.

title: Transfer of Ownership of the Fertilizer Testing Laboratory of Ceylon Fertilizer Company to the National Fertilizer Secretariat
decision_details: - Fertilizer Testing Laboratory of Ceylon Fertilizer Company issues certificates to the relevant institutions after testing fertilizer samples. Since the Ceylon Fertilizer Company is a commercial institute engaged in the fertilizer supply process, it seems inappropriate to engage in the regulatory function of testing samples. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture to transfer the ownership of the Fertilizer Testing Laboratory with its all movable and immovable assets to National Fertilizer Secretariat, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Use of environmentally-friendly materials to cover the roofs of Schools and Pre-Schools in place of Asbestos roofing sheets
decision_details: - It has been identified through the studies of the World Health Organization (WHO)that all types of asbestos cause various diseases such as lung cancer and laryngeal cancer at present. Therefore, the use of environmentally-friendlysubstitutes for roofs in buildings of schools and Pre-Schools instead of asbestos enables to prevent school and Pre-School children being exposed to asbestos and it would be an important step that could be taken for the safety of their health. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to use locally manufactured roofing tiles and other environmentally-friendly substitutes forroofs in schools and Pre-Schools to be built in future instead of asbestosroofing sheets considering adverse effects that could be caused by asbestos to the future generation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Centre of Excellence in Robotics Application - CERA
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2016‑08‑09 forthe establishment of Centre of Excellence in Robotics Application. With the establishment of the said Centre, it was expected to function as a technology transfer agency for the design, development and conduct of research with respect to robotic systems and vehicles for Government and industrial customers. Through the applications of this Centre, it is possible to provide services required by many local industries and to raise funds needed for the existence of the Institution. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to establish the Centre of Excellence in Robotics Application as a limited company under the Companies Act No. 7 of 2007 and maintenance of its activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Changing the name of Manthai Salt Limited as 'National Salt Company' and transferring the ownership of all government owned Salterns in the Northern Province to the National Salt Company
decision_details: - The Ceylon Salt Company was established by privatizing the Sri Lanka Salt Corporation in 1990 and all Salterns except the Salterns located in Northern Province were brought under the purview of the said Company. Subsequently, in the year 2001, a State-owned public company called Manthai Salt Ltd. was established and the administrativeand the operational activities of the Salterns located in the Northern Province were brought under the said Company. In accordance with the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No. 2196/27 dated 2020‑10‑06, the Manthai Salt Ltd. and the Elephant Pass Saltern have been incorporated as two public enterprises under the purview of the Ministry of Industries. Further, it has been found that maintenance of all Salterns located in the Northern Province under a single administrative structure would be economically and administratively more advantageous other than maintaining those as separate limited companies. Accordingly, taking into account the present needs, the proposal made by the the Minister of Industries to change the company name of Manthai Salt Ltd. functioning as a fully State-owned company under the Ministry of Industries, as “National Salt Company” and to transfer the ownership, administrative activities and operational activities of the Elephant Pass Saltern located in the Northern Province to the National Salt Company, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the proposed Gin-Nilwala Diversion project for the optimal use of water from the Gin and Nilwala rivers
decision_details: - The rivers Gin and Nilwala carry 2000 and 1200 cubic meters of water to the ocean, respectively. The Gin -Nilwala project has been proposed to implement for the purpose of diverting the excess water of the said two rivers in order to avoid shortage of drinking and irrigation water in the Hambantota District and also to control the floods in these rivers and studies in this regard are nearing its completion. Taking into consideration the proposals made by the Minister of Irrigation and the need to expedite the project, the Cabinet approval was granted to implement the project in phased out manner, utilizing local funds.

title: Entering into an Agreement between Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation (SLBC) and the Encompass Digital Media Services Limited - London for the transmission of overseas programmmes
decision_details: - The services of the TrincomaleeBroadcasting Station commenced as per the Agreement entered into between the Government of Sri Lanka and Deutsche Welle, the overseas broadcasting service of the Federal Republic of Germanin 1980 andthe operational activities of the said station have been entrusted with the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation in the year 2012. Subsequently, programmes were transmitted through the said station along with foreign media institutions. The Encompass Digital Media Services Limited - London, operating its business activities from Londonhas submitted a business proposal to transmit overseas programmes via short wave and medium wave and accordingly, foreign exchange of US$ 49,000 and US$ 16,000 can be earned respectively by the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation per month by providing its air time to the said Company. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Mass Mediato enter into aBroadcasting Agreement between the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation and the Encompass Digital Media Services Limited - London for the transmission of overseas programmes using TrincomaleeBroadcasting Station of the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of an Arbitration System to settle the disputes of the Employees in the Public Sector
decision_details: - It is apparent that there are also instances where protests, demonstrations, strikes etc. conducted by certain employees in the public sector at present,resulting impediments to achieve theNational development goals. Although it is possible to take action to minimize disputes and strikes in the private sector in terms of the provisions of the Labour Dispute Act No.43 of 1950, the Government sector possesses no such methodology. Through the Government's Policy Framework of ‘Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour’, it has been pointed out that a mechanism similar to the arbitration system adopted by the private sector to solve the employee disputes at present would be introduced to solve the employee disputes in the public sector as well. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Services, Provincial Councils and Local Government, to appoint a committee comprising of relevant Secretaries to ministries and relevant trade union representatives, in order to introduce amechanism fortified with four aspects; dialogue,consultation, mediation and arbitration which can be agreed by all in order to avoid and settle disputes in the public sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presenting an appropriate methodology for determining and identifying 	the National Heritage of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Issues have arisen in identifying the Nation Heritages of Sri Lanka due to the absence of specific criteria or mechanism for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to appoint a Committee comprising of Experts /Scholars in the relevant fields to prepare a methodology in consultation with the views of the general public for the identification of tangible and intangible national heritages which ensures Sri Lankan cultural identity, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Training Multi-purpose Development Assistants
decision_details:
- Activities pertaining to the recruitment of 100,000 Multi-purpose Development Assistants by the Department of Multi-purpose Development Task Force are being conducted by now. It has been planned to subject all those who recruited accordingly to a training under 25 fields and award them NVQ 3 certificate. As such, the Cabinet approved the the proposal made by H.E the President for entrusting the National Apprentice and Industrial Training Authority (NAITA)
to conduct the said training simultaneously in 332 Divisional Secretariat Divisions island wide for a period of 5 ½ months.

title: Acquiring a block of land for the Divisional Secretariat, Ratmalana
decision_details: - It has been planned to construct a new building complex for the Divisional Secretariat, Ratmalana enabling to render an optimum public service to the general public in the area, since space of the current building which is situated in a block of land of 26 perches is inadequate. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and Disaster Management and the Minister of Transport to allocate a block of land in extent of 100 perches belonging to the Department of Sri Lanka Railways identified for the construction of the Divisional Secretariat, Ratmalana, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Regulations related to the process of charging visa fees of the Department of Immigration and Emigration
decision_details: - The Cabinet, at its meeting held on 2018‑01‑09 has granted approval to amend the regulations issued in 1956 pertaining to the 	Immigration and Emigration Act No. 20 of 1948 so as to suit with present. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of 	Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and 	Disaster Management to present the amended Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman for the purpose in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Museum of Weapons
decision_details: - It has been identified that it would be appropriate to implement a proper programme to collect and preserve, maintain and protect ancient weapons including stone tools found in archaeological excavations, the traditional weapons used in the past which are now subject to extinct and modern weapons. Accordingly, considering the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister, approval was granted for the establishment of a separate unit for preservation of weapons within one of the most appropriate museums which is presently under the purview of the Department of National Museum.

title: Implementing Digital Strategies and empowering the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA)
decision_details:
- The Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka has been entrusted the responsibility of recommending a National Digital Policy and Strategy to be implemented during the period 2020-2025 under the Government's new policy framework. Accordingly, the said Institution has prepared a National Digital Policy and Implementation Strategies for Sri Lanka. It has been recommended to initiate 03 new programme units by the said programme as follows.

i.	Digital Government - This unit will carry out programmes for digital transformation process of Government institutions and empowerment of citizens of Sri Lanka.

ii.	Digital Economy - This unit will facilitate innovations, entrepreneurship and starting up new companies by capacity building, introducing new technology and expansion of the industry by creating an environment for foreign direct investment .

iii.	Digital Services - This unit will establish, mange and maintain IT infrastructure required for government services and provide consultancy services to initiate and manage the digital transformation process. 
As such, the proposal made by H.E the President to restructure the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka enabling to fulfill the aforesaid duties and responsibilities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Unique Digital Identity (SL-UDI) Framework and e-NIC Project
decision_details:
- The Government adopts an Unique Digital Identity Framework and a strategy to facilitate the said framework in order to achieve the goal 'Smart Nation' which is one of the ten key goals of the national policy framework 'Vistas of Prosperity and Splendour'.  Further the said programme has been given priority as a national level programme. The Unique Digital Identity Framework for Sri Lanka has been prepared together with the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka and the Department for the Registration of Persons and implementation of the e-NIC project has been identified as one of the components to be implemented under the said Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E the President to implement the following proposals was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Granting approval to the Unique Digital Identity Framework for Sri Lanka finalized 	by the Programme Preparation Committee.

*	Appointment of a Presidential Task Force to provide the necessary guidance to establish the Unique Digital Identity Framework for Sri Lanka.

*	Vesting the responsibility of implementation of the Unique Digital Identity Framework Project for Sri Lanka with the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka.

*	Implementation of the e-NIC Project together with the Information 	and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka and the Department for the Registration of Persons.


*	Making required amendments to the Registration of Persons Act No.32 	of 1968 to facilitate the implementation of Unique Digital Identity Framework for Sri Lanka and the e-NIC Project.

*	Completion of the said project by 2022‑12‑31.

title: Selling of paddy stocks in the possession of the District Secretaries/Government Agents and the paddy stocks belonging to the Paddy Marketing Board through Sathosa outlets by threshing them into rice
decision_details: - Considering the facts that the current rice shortage in the market and the reluctance shown by the owners of rice mills to supply sufficient rice stocks under the controlled price, the Cabinet of Ministers granted approval to take necessary measures to sell paddy stocks in the possession of the District Secretaries/Government Agents and the paddy stocks belonging to the Paddy Marketing Board through Sathosa outlets to consumers under the controlled price, after threshing them into rice.

title: COVID-19 (Temporary Provisions) Act
decision_details: - It has emerged the need of taking a certain temporary measure to provide legal protection to all relevant parties and persons in dispensation of justice on pending court cases due to the COVID - 19 pandemic. Particularly, as per the COVID- 19 pandemic condition, it has become appropriate to make provisions for such measures to be taken deviating to the ordered time limit, when certain persons are ordered to take certain measures within specified time limits. Accordingly, the Cabinet of Ministers approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Justice to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the COVID -19 Bill (Temporary Provisions) to impose relevant provisions including such identified matters.

title: Awarding the long term contracts for the importation of Petrol and Diesel for the period of eight months from 2020/11/01 to 2020/06/30
decision_details:
- The Cabinet approved the proposals submitted by the Minister of Energy to award the following long term contracts for the importation of Petrol and Diesel for the period of eight months from 2020‑11‑01 to 2020‑06‑30, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. 
* 	Awarding the procument to M/s ES Energy DMCC,U.A.E to supply 1,800,000 barrels of Petrol (92 Unl) 
*	 Awarding the procument to M/s Swiss Singapore Overseas Enterprises Pte. Ltd., in Singapore to supply 1,680,000 barrels of Diesel that contain maximum sulphur percentage 0.05.

title: The contract for supplying and laying of water distribution systems in the Jaffna city area
decision_details: - The Cabinet approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Water Supply, to award the contract for the supplying and laying of water distribution system in the Jaffna city area, which is one of the components of Jaffna – Kilinochchi Water Supply and Sanitation Project, to M/s NCC Company to a sum of Rs.3,160.20 Million (with VAT) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.

title: Construction of New Bridge Across the Rajagiriya Nawala Canal connecting Angampitiya Road at Ethulkotte and School Lane at Nawala, Rajagiriya
decision_details: - Limited competitive bids were called to award the contract for the construction of a new bridge across Rajagiriya – Nawala canal connecting Angampitiya Road at Ethulkotte and School Lane, Rajagiriya at Nawala. Accordingly, the proposal submitted by the Minister of Highways to award the relevant contract to the State Development and Construction Corporation for a sum of Rs.1,698.55 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for Construction of Gandara Fishery Harbour
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2019‑07‑07 to implement the project for the construction of the Gandara Fishery Harbor in the Devinuwara Divisional Secretariat Division in the Matara District. Accordingly, competitive bids have been called for this purpose and the Cabinet approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Fisheries to award this contract to RR SENOK JV to a sum of Rs. 5,367.69 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.

title: Awarding Contract for the Construction of the Technology Faculty Building of the Sabaragamuwa Universityof Sri Lanka
decision_details: - International competitive bidding procedure has been followed to select a suitable contractor for the construction of the Technology Faculty Building of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka under the Asian Development Bank funded Science and Technology Human Resources Development Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the above contract to M/s International Constructions Consortium (Pvt) Ltd, to a sum of US$ 3.01 million and Rs 1,507.24 million (without VAT), as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contract for the Construction of the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences Building - Phase 1 of the University of Ruhuna
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2018‑09‑11 to implement the Phase I of the project for the Construction of the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences Building of the University of Ruhuna. Accordingly, National Competitive Biding Procedure has been followed to select a suitable contractor for the purpose. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the said contract to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., to a sum of Rs. 1,501.73 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of Contract for selection of an Engineering Consultancy Service Firm for the construction of the Medical Faculty of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has signed an agreement with the Saudi Development Fund to obtain a loan of 187.5 million Saudi Riyals to establish the Medical Faculty of the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, competitive bids have been invited for the selection of a consultancy firm for the establishment of the said Medical Faculty. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to award the the relevant consultancy service contract to M/s DAR Engineering of Saudi Arabia, to a sum of 5.37 million Saudi Riyals, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Consultancy Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Ragama-Peralanda Wetland Recreational Park
decision_details: - The Urban Development Authority has planned to implement a Recreational Park project in the vicinity of Peralanda Wetlands located within the Ragama-Peralanda residential area. Accordingly the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to award the relevant contract as a direct contract to the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation and to provide the necessary consultancy services by the Urban Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978
decision_details:
- The Special Committee appointed to amend the Code of Criminal Procedure Act and the Penal Code has recommended the appointment of "Recorder Judges to the High Court" and the conducting of pre-trial conference in High Courts. 

Accordingly, the draft bill for amending the Code of Criminal Procedure Act No 15 of 1979 is being drafted at present, for the purpose of introducing the procedure for pre-trial conference.

Although it is possible to appoint a Recorder Judge to the Court to deal with all the pre-trial and post-trial matters, in terms of the provisions of the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978, no appointments have been made so far, due to some technical issues in existence. Since the conduct of pre-trial and post-trial hearings is a judicial function, the relevant appointments should be made by the Judicial Service Commission from among the Judges presently serving. Further, it has been identified that it is appropriate to change the designation “ Recorder” in the Judicature Act as “Recorder Judge”. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, to amend the Judicature Act, No.2 of 1978, incorporating the said provisions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief to tea smallholders for the affected tea plantations due to excessive heat and drought condition
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2020‑06‑03 to implement a program to provide tea plants to tea smallholders free of charge to restore tea plantations damaged due to excessive heat and and drought condition. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the information submitted by the Minister of Plantation that 3.5 million tea plants worth Rs. 105 million had been distributed by the Tea Smallholdings Development Authority and another 2.5 million tea plants worth Rs. 75 million are planned to be distributed within this year.

title: Granting State Lands to Landless War Heroes for Residential Purposes
decision_details: - With the introduction of a new methodology for disposition of state lands to war heroes, having revised the previous policy existed, at the Cabinet meeting held on 2016‑07‑18, the some war heroes who have been granted lands under the previous policy are reported to have faced numerous hardships. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Lands to introduce a new methodology to eliminate these inequalities that have occurred in providing relief to the war heroes belonging to the same category, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of necessary scrap metal for the Local Small Scale Industrialists
decision_details:
- Issues relating to the metal industry had been discussed by the “Inter-Ministerial Task Force on Industry and Enterprise” and the “Presidential Task Force on Economic Revival and Poverty Alleviation” at their meetings. As determined at those discussions, steps have been taken to stop the export of Copper, Aluminium, Stainless Steel, High Carbon Steel, Brass, Cast Iron, Aluminium Ingots and Zinc Ingots with immediate effect, with a view to providing sufficient raw materials for the local metal industrialists. According to a research conducted by the Sri Lanka Industrial Development Board and the University of Moratuwa, it has been proved that there is a high demand for scrap Iron, Cast Iron, Aluminium, Copper and Brass by the local industrialists and the demand for Zinc, Manganese, High Carbon Steel and Stainless Steel is also being increased. 

The demand for Scrap Metal is expected to be increased further in line with policies of the Government pertaining to the promotion of local industries. Therefore, it has been found that it is appropriate to reconsider the current permission that has been given for the export of Copper Wire and to suspend the export of Copper Wire in order to encourage production of more value added products.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to use the scrap metal of Iron, Copper, Aluminium, Stainless Steel, High Carbon Steel, Brass , Cast Iron and Aluminium Ingots and Zinc Ingots and Copper Wire only for the local industries and to permit to export the unusable Scrap Metal only on the recommendation of the Sri Lanka Industrial Development Board and the other relevant institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing opportunity for sale of products of the Government Institutions in the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation
decision_details:
- It is been planned to expand the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation which is currently operating at the Narahenpita Dedicated Economic Center and establish a sales center called “Rajawasa” in order to facilitate the customers to obtain the products manufactured and sold in the following Government Institutions under one roof at a reasonable price.
*	 Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation
*	Ceylon Fisheries Corporation
*	Educational Publications Department 
*	 Sri Lanka Tea Board
*	 State Pharmaceuticals Corporation 
*	 B.B.C. Lanka Limited 
*	 Cooperative Development Department 
*	 Lanka Sathosa Limited
*	 Ceylon Cashew Corporation
*	 Mantai Salt Company
*	 Litro Gas Limited
*	 State Timber Corporation
*	 Colombo Commercial Fertilizers Limited
*	Ceylon Fertilizer Company Limited
*	 Milco (Pvt.) Ltd
*	 Coconut Development Authority
*	 State Printing Corporation 

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade to modernize the premises where the showroom of the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation presently located and to establish the proposed “Rajawasa” Sales Center, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing relief for continuing inter-provincial bus operations in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic situation
decision_details:
