- It has been decided to waive off the following charges from the bus operators with effect from March 2020 for continuing inter-provincial bus operations amidst the COVID - 19 pandemic situation. 

*	Permit renewal fees 
*	Late fees 
*	Tender fees 
*	Log fees 
*	Entrance fees 
*	Expressway temporary permit fees

However, it has been identified that the bus operators need to be provided with relief enabling them to provide quality and efficient passenger transport service, since they have confronted with numerous constrains due to re-emergence of the pandemic situation. Accordingly, considering a proposal made by the Minister of Transport, the Cabinet granted approval for further providing the said concessions to the bus operators until the end of this year.

title: Establishment of a Dedicated Pharmaceutical Zone at Arabokka Estate, Hambantota
decision_details: - The Presidential Task Force for Economic Revival and Poverty Alleviation has identified the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry as one of the potential industries that could attract foreign direct investments as well as earn foreign exchange. Therefore, it has been planned to establish a special pharmaceutical manufacturing zone with modern facilities within an area in extent of 400 acres of the Arabokka estate in Hambantota enabling to attract the world renowned pharmaceutical manufacturing companies. It is expected to declare the said project as a Strategic Development Project and grant concessions and incentives for the investors who invest in the said pharmaceutical manufacturing zone. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health for the establishment of 20 pharmaceutical manufacturing companies in 200 acres as phase I of this Project and another 20 pharmaceutical manufacturing companies in 200 more acres as its phase II and to furnish necessary infrastructure facilities by the Board of Investments of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Paediatric Surgical Ward at the Teaching Hospital, Ratnapura
decision_details: - Teaching Hospital, Ratnapura is the largest tertiary care hospital in the Sabaragamuwa province thus providing services to a large number of patients from other provinces as well. Adhering to the need of a surgical ward with proper facilities for the pediatric ward complex consisted of 116 beds, it has been planned to construct a paediatric surgical ward in the second storey of the relevant paediatric ward building. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Health for the construction of the proposed paediatric surgical ward with the funding of the donors and to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Health and the relevant donors for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reservation of Borrow Area for Offshore Sand Mining
decision_details: - The requirement of long-term reserving of a borrow area for offshore sand mining has been arisen for mining sand for the construction industry and as well as for the projects implemented by Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation. The institution has satisfied its sand requirement since the year 1994 by mining sand within an offshore area of 61 square kilometers, having obtained exploration license periodically. Considering the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing, the Cabinet decided to grant approval to permit the the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation for offshore sand mining from the said borrow area of 61 square kilo meters for a period of 10 years, subject to carrying out an Environmental Impact Assessment.

title: Model Memorandum of Understanding on Police Cooperation
decision_details: - It has been observed that entering into bilateral memoranda of understanding with the foreign police organizations who perform their duties in a highly efficient manner with the help of modern technology, will enable our police officers to share their experience, knowledge, skills and internationally recognized practices and standards on modern police duties. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and Disaster Management to enter into Memoranda of Understanding between the Ministry under which the subject of police falls and the foreign police organizations under the guidance of the Foreign Ministry to establish police cooperation under 17 fields such as terrorist activities, terrorist financing, drug related crimes, human trafficking and smuggling, money laundering, cybercrime etc, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of security services to hospitals and other institutions under the Ministry of Health for the year 2020/2021
decision_details: - The contract has to be awarded for the supply of security services to hospitals and other institutions under the Ministry of Health for the year 2020/2021. Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the supply of security services for 35 hospitals and institutions in the Western Province to Rakna Arakshaka Lanka Limited and to award the supply of security services for 26 hospitals and institutions located outside the Western Province to LRDC Services (Pvt) Ltd, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing locally manufactured sarees as uniforms for Dhamma School teachers
decision_details: - Granting of uniforms to the Dhamma School teachers serving in the Buddhist Dhamma Schools throughout the island is being implemented since the year 2004 and accordingly, 76,000 sarees are required for the year 2020 to be awarded as uniforms to Buddhist Dhamma School teachers .  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to purchase 76000 sarees made by local textile manufacturers at Rs. 2,400/- per each, to a sum of Rs. 182.4 million from Lanka Salusala Limited, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re-establishment of the Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board
decision_details: - Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board has been established under the provisions of section 2 of the State Agricultural Corporations Act No 11 of 1972. At its meeting held on 2008‑07‑16, the Cabinet decided that the functions of the said Board be vested with the Department of Export Agriculture and the institution be closed with effect from 2008‑07‑27. However, the Spices and Allied Products Marketing Board currently falls under the purview of the State Ministry of Development of Minor Crops including Sugarcane, Maize, Cashew, Pepper, Cinnamon, Cloves, Betel Related Industries and Export Promotion. Since the necessity of having a formal mechanism to implement the programmes and projects identified by the said State Ministry, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to reactivate the Spices and allied products Marketing Board and continue its activities, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Establishment of a New Refinery of 100,000 barrels per day (bblspd) at Sapugaskanda for the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation
decision_details:
- As the existing capacity of the refinery located at Sapugaskanda belonging to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation is only 40,000 (bblspd), the Corporation refinery meets only 25 % of the local demand for refined petroleum products. The remaining 75% has to be imported, relying much on the foreign exchange. Although a feasibility study had been conducted in 2010 for the renovation and expansion of the refinery to increase that capacity up to 100,000 (bblspd), the subsequent technological changes that have taken place in that field have made it impossible to proceed on the results of the feasibility study.

Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Energy to take necessary action to initiate a new feasibility study by the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to determine the scope, technical, operational and financial feasibility of the project which is to be implemented with a focus on several alternative proposals to enhance the existing refinery capacity of petroleum products, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Streamlining the Fertilizer Production and Distribution System in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Production, supply and application of fertilizer should be scientifically handled in order to ensure a sustainable soil quality to produce quality crops for a healthy food production process. Therefore, a proper Fertilizer Supply Chain Management System with appropriate technological procedures that do not lead to fertilizer wastage, scarcity and deviation from standards, should be followed. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, to take necessary action to provide infrastructure facilities with scientific standards and components based on an automated centralized methodology upon instructions of the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka, including the completion of National Fertilizer Secretariat with modern technologies, upgrading existing laboratories and strengthening the district level operating and evaluation system including a field inspection mechanism to be established in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Institute of Nanotechnology, to its scope, was approved by the Cabinet .

title: Obtaining used empty bullet Casings and disposed Armor Plates as raw materials for the industries of traditional artisans
decision_details: - Attention has been drawn to solve the issues confronted by the traditional craft industries and rural industries in order to empower the industrialists who involved in those sectors, since such industries can have a huge impact on the economy of Sri Lanka. Accordingly, it has been planned to supply the manufactures the raw materials at a concessionary basis, enabling them to price such goods in order to compete with the imported goods in the market. For the purpose, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to obtain the empty bullet casings (Brass) and disposed armour plates used by the Sri Lanka Army, the Sri Lanka Air Force and the Sri Lanka Navy to the National Crafts Council, deviating from procurement procedure and subject to the pricing formula  approved by the Cabinet in the year 2017 and also to purchase copper, brass and aluminum etc disposed by the Sri Lanka Telecom, the Department of Sri Lanka Railways, the Ceylon Electricity Board and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board at a concessionary price to the National Crafts Council, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining discarded rails of the Department of Sri Lanka Railways for the construction of electric fences and protective fences to minimize the elephant-human conflict
decision_details:
- At present, Elephant - human conflicts are reported in 133 Divisional Secretariat Divisions in 19 Districts in Sri Lanka. Construction of protective fences and electric fences are the key measures from among the measures taken by the Department of Wild Life Conservation to control this situation. Approximately 4,500 km of electric fences have already been erected by now in the aforementioned 133 Divisional Secretariat Divisions while approximately 1,500 km of electric fences, and elephant retention centres with protective fences have been planned to be constructed. Although, timber posts are being used to construct these fences at present those are frequently subject to fall down by elephants. Using of concrete posts too is beyond practical approach due to difficulties found in renovating them.

Therefore, it has been proposed to utilize discarded rails as an alternative solution for the purpose. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Conservation and the Minister of Transport to obtain the discarded rails by the Department of Sri Lanka Railways to the Department of Wild Life Conservation, on free of charge, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Programme for the Establishment of Export Production Villages
decision_details: - It has been designed to implement an Export Production Villages Programme enabling to develop rural products within a formal business model and connect them with the export supply chain as well as to upgrading local manufacturing industries to produce import substitutions. This programme aims to mobilize homogeneous producers scattered in a particular area as an Export Production Village Company and provide with them opportunity to produce their productions to the export market and also to address the issues having minimized the challenges to be faced by them. Further, it is expected to establish Export Production Villages covering the sectors of Agriculture, Fisheries, Industry and Services and to enter into future trade agreements with leading export companies thereby ensuring the sustainability of the said Export Production Villages. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, to implement the said proposed programme by the Sri Lanka Export Development Board utilizing the necessary provisions, under the guidance of the Ministry of Trade, was approved in principle, by the Cabinet.

title: Performing teaching activities by means of television and radio services under the Distance education system
decision_details: - Considering the difficulties erupted for the continuation of teaching activities in the schools due to the COVID - 19 pandemic situation, approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to use both “Eye Channel” and “Nethra Channel” to perform teaching activities by means of television and radio services under the distance education system. With the re-emergence of COVID - 19 pandemic in the country, it has been perceived that optimal alternative distance educational methodologies are essential to be applied for the continuation of educational activities, since re-opening of schools as scheduled seems to be not practical at present. Therefore, it has been planned to prepare and telecast television educational programmes from grades 3 to 13 in all the three languages; Sinhala, Tamil and English. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to implement a series of Educational prorammes with the assistance of the State and private television and radio channels in collaboration with the National Institute of Education and the State Ministry of Education Reforms, Open Universities & Distance Learning Promotion, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extending the grace period agreed on the payment of the salaries to the private sector employees in the wake of the crisis caused by the Covid-19 pandemic
decision_details:
- A Task Force has been appointed representing Employers, Trade Unions, the National Labour Advisory Council, the Ministry of Labour and the Department of Labour has been appointed to look into the payment of salaries to the private sector employees in the wake of the crisis caused by the Covid-19 pandemic. The said Task Force has agreed to take action as follows from May to September, 2020.
    • Retaining the jobs of employees of institutions which suspended operations due to the Covid 19 pandemic. 
    • to make arrangements to deploy employees on a roster basis or any other suitable method enabling them to serve proportionately where the institution that can't deploy all their workers in the duty due to the requirement of maintaining social distancing.

    • to pay either 50% of the basic salary of the relevant month in which employee last received his full salary or Rs.14,500, whichever is more remunerative to the employee, in respect of employees of the institutions which had a requirement to retain their workers at home due to the absence of work. 
    • to pay contributions to the Employees’ Provident Fund and the Employees Trust Fund by the employer for the salaries so paid.

The Cabinet noted that the matters submitted by the Minister of Labour to the effect that the said Task Force is in agreement to take action as mentioned above up to December of this year as the spread of Covid-19 pandemic further continuing in the country.

title: Procurement for the supply of 2,000,000 Vials of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection BP, 30/70, 1000 IU/10 ml
decision_details: - International competitive bids were invited for the procurement of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection which is used to treat for the diabetic patients. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to award the procurement for the supply of 2,000,000 vials of Biphasic Isophane Insulin Injection BP, 30/70, 1000 IU/10 ml to M/s Wokhardt Limited at a total C&F price of US$ 3 million as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for construction of the Faculty Building Complex (Phase I) for the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, Sri Lanka
decision_details: - National competitive bidding procedure has been followed for the construction of the Faculty Building Complex (Phase 1) for the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, Sri Lanka. Accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to award the said contract to Sathuta Builders Pvt. Ltd, Kurunegala to a sum of Rs.797.81 million (without VAT) as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of houses for 14 selected devotees affected by the Easter Sunday attack at St. Sebastian's Church, Katuwapitiya, Negombo
decision_details: - The Cabinet approval was granted on 2019‑09‑17 to implement a housing project for the families affected by the bomb explosion that took place at St. Sebastian's Church, Katuwapitiya, Negombo on 2020‑09‑21. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to award the contract for the construction houses for 14 selected families at a cost of Rs. 3.24 million per each under the above programme to the State Engineering Corporation of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the “Swashakthi Loan Scheme” to provide loan facilities towards developing Small and Medium Scale Business Sector and generating employments
decision_details:
- In the year 2017, the “Swasakthi Loan Scheme” has been launched jointly by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka and the Small Business Development Division of the Ministry vested with the subject of Youth Affairs with an investment of Rs. 3500 million. Said loan scheme has been implemented through commercial banks and it provides loans to start a business based on a successful project plan. At present, under the said loan scheme, 13890 entrepreneurs have been provided with Rs. 3064 million. Accordingly, taking into consideration the nature of the project and the compliance with the current needs, the proposal made by the Minister of Youth and Sports, to provide loans to young entrepreneurs within the age of 18 and 40, subject to a maximum of one million rupees, for the implementation of new small and medium scale projects in the following business sectors, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	IT and computer related projects. 
*	Agricultural, dairy and animal husbandry projects. 
*	Projects related to tourism promotion. 
*	 Projects related to innovations and innovative machinery and plants. 
*	 Food processing products and related projects.

title: Handing over Raigam Korale Tea Shakthi Tea Factory to Raigam Tea Small 	Holdings Development Society
decision_details: - Due to the cease of the tea production activities of the Raigam Korale  Shakthi Tea Factory from April 2019 by the the Dikhena Tea Small Holder Development Society which had taken over the said tea factory on lease basis, tea smallholders who supplied their production to the said factory are faced with severe difficulties. Approximately Rs. 42 million had to be paid to the tea smallholders who supplied tea to the said factory, broker companies and other external parties by the the Dikhena Tea Small Holder Development Society. Taking into account the request made by the tea smallholders to restart the activities of the said factory, the proposal made by the Minister of Plantation to hand over the said factory on lease basis to Raigam Tea Small Holdings Development Society, which has the financial strength and 1,800 members to carry out production activities of the Factory, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed dedicated zone for textile manufacturing and related industries at Punnaikudah of Eravur-Pattu Divisional Secretariat Division in Batticaloa District
decision_details: - The establishment of an apparel industrial Zone in Eravur by the Board of Investment in collaboration with the Land Reforms Commission has been identified as a significant priority project of the Ministry of Industries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Industries to declare the apparel industrial zone proposed to be established at Punnaikudah of Eravur-Pattu Divisional Secretariat Division in Batticaloa District as a strategic Development Project as a 'Dedicated Zone for Textile Manufacturing and Related Industries', to vest 275 acres of land identified for the purpose and belonging to the Land Reforms Commission with the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka, to secure provisions required for the said project and to provide investment incentives for the investors those who are investing in that industrial zone, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Government of the Republic of India for obtaining Indian Grant Assistance to implement the High Impact Community Development Projects
decision_details: - The Government of India has extended their grant financing assistance to Sri Lanka since 2005 to implement small scale development projects in view of strengthening the bilateral relationship and development partnership between two countries. Under this grant financing programme, a large number of projects pertaining to the development of infrastructure in the fields such as education, health and community development have been implemented through the Government institutions, Local Authorities and Non Government Organizations. Under the same, the Government of India is in an agreement to provide financial assistance to Sri Lanka in order to implement high impact community development projects for a period of five years from 2020 to 2025. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to enter into a new MoU for the purpose with the Government of India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Wind Farm Projects in Mannar Island
decision_details: - Construction work of 100 MW Wind Power Plant in Mannar Island is now underway with an investment of US$ 200 million of the Asian Development Bank (ADB). The physical progress of the project is 73% and the construction is expected to be completed by early 2021. Of the US$ 200 million obtained for the project, a balance of US$ 47 million remains and it has been found that another 06 wind turbines could be installed using the said balance thereby increasing the power generation capacity of the said Plant by 20 MW. The Asian Development Bank has granted approval in principle for the capacity enhancing proposal and accordingly the proposal made by the Minister of Power to take action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a mechanism to utilize non-forest lands among the residual lands except conservation and reserved forests which are vested with the Conservator General of Forests for productive economic purposes
decision_details: - A decision had been taken in 2006, to transfer the powers vested with the Divisional Secretaries to authorize the use of the remaining non-forest lands of residual lands for activities such as chena cultivation, other farming and temporary economic activities to an Inter-Ministerial Committee. At its meeting held on 2020‑07‑01, Cabinet decided that it would be appropriate to introduce a simplified mechanism of granting permission to engage in such economic activities to minimize the hardships faced by those temporarily engaged in chena farming and other economic activities in such lands. Accordingly, having studied the issues, the officers of the Ministry of Wildlife and Forest Conservation, Ministry of Environment and the Ministry of Lands have formulated a new mechanism. As such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Conservation, the Minister of Environment and the Minister of Lands to implement the said mechanism, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Sri Lankan Embassies in Romania and Spain
decision_details: - Diplomatic relations between Romania and Sri Lanka commenced in the year 1957 and so far, very good bilateral relations have been established between the two countries. Further, Diplomatic relations between Spain and Sri Lanka commenced in 1955. Accordingly the proposal made by the Foreign Minister to establish Sri Lankan Embassies in the said two countries with a view to further developing the existing relations with those countries with Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Modernizing the process of conducting Examinations in the Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Department of Examinations of Sri Lanka conducts mainly 4 National Examinations related to school education and about 325 Institutional Examinations annually. The departmental staff carries out most of the work related to conducting those examinations following the usual office procedures and the necessity of digitalizing the examination process has been identified to maintain the accuracy and reliability of the examinations. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to purchase new technical equipment including internet facilities required to modernize the examination management process of the Department of Examinations, to train the respective staff to utilize the said devices and to establish Examination Evaluation Centres at provincial level to facilitate the exam evaluation process, was approved by the cabinet.

title: Re-allocating the Regidale Watte land at Kahapola, Piliyandala to the National Zoological Department
decision_details: - The Cabinet has granted approval in the year 2016 to acquire the Regidale Watte land at Kahapola, Piliyandala which was under the National Zoological Department to the then Ministry in charge of the subject of Buddhashasana and vest the same with the institution called “Light of Asia Foundation” under a Memorandum of Understanding for its project for the Erection of the Theme Park of Sakya Kingdom of Kapilawasthu in India. The said project had been scheduled to commence in the year 2017 and complete in March 2020, however its progress is still less than 5%. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Buddhashasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to cancel the Agreement entered into with the “Light of Asia Foundation” and acquire the said land back to the Ministry of Buddhashasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to re-transfer the said land to the National Zoological Department, retaining 5 acres of the land under the Ministry for its future development activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining Additional Financial assistance from the Asian Development Bank (ADB) for the Small and Medium Sized Enterprises Line of Credit Project
decision_details:
- The Asian Development Bank has given its consent to grant a loan amounting to US$ 165 million including an Emergency Response Component of US$ 100 miilion for the measures to be taken to provide solutions to mitigate the circumstances erupted and the negative impact confronted by the Small and Medium Scale Entrepreneurs due to the COVID -19 pandemic. In addition to the above loan, it has also been agreed to award a grant of US$ 1.25 million under the Japan Fund for Poverty Reduction. 
Further, it has been agreed to grant a concessionary loan amount of US$ 400 million for the Secondary Education Sector Improvement Project under the Results Based Lending financial modality of the Asian Development Bank.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to enter into the respective agreements with the Asian Development Bank to obtain the said loan amounts and the grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Capacity Expansion Project of the Colombo International Container Terminal
decision_details:
- The Project for the development of the South Container Terminal of Colombo Port was implemented under an investment of US$ 500 million and its construction was completed on 2016‑12‑01 and is in commercial operation at present. An Agreement has been entered into by the Colombo International Container Terminal Limited with the Sri Lanka Board of Investment to implement the aforesaid Project. Taking into account the present demand for the activities of the said Terminal and the prospective business opportunities, it has been decided to expand the said project enhancing the capacity of the Terminal without commencing new constructions. 
	Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance to introduce new equipment to upgrade and moderate the existing equipment investing US$ 90 million, and thereby implement the productivity enhancing project of the Terminal and to publish the relevant tax relief in accordance with the provisions of the Strategic Development Projects Act in the Government Gazette, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka Bill 2020
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft legislation to introduce a new Act, in place of the existing Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka Act No.36 of 1987, incorporating the provisions required to regulate the stock market of Sri Lanka in keeping with current international best practices, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of a Delimitation Committee to establish new Divisional Secretariat Divisions, to gazette the already established Divisional Secretariat Divisions and to establish and reconstitute of Grama Niladhari Divisions
decision_details: - Based on the administration and development requirements of the Government as well as the requirements of the public, many requests have been made by people's representatives as well as people's organizations for the establishment of new divisional secretariat divisions in certain areas of the country, reconstitution of some divisional secretariat divisions, delimitation and then gazette the already established divisions yet to be gazetted, establishment of new Grama Niladhari divisions and reconstitute of the existing Grama Niladhari divisions. Although, a Delimitation Committee has to be appointed for the purpose, every 05 years, the report of the last committee appointed in the year 2012, has not been published in the Government Gazette and accepted officially due to the technical deficiencies in the Report. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Irrigation and State Minister of Internal Security, Home Affairs and Disaster Management, to appoint a new Delimitation Committee for the purpose of carrying out the relevant functions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vesting/Acquisition of State and Private Lands with the Urban Development Authority for the proposed Urban Development Projects
decision_details: -The Urban Development Authority has planned to implement a number of urban development projects centered on major cities including the city of Colombo. Preliminary activities pertaining to these projects have already been initiated while the Urban Development Authority has to acquire both State owned as well as private owned plots of land already identified for this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing, to vest with the Urban Development Authority 39 plots of State owned land in terms of section 6(1) of the State Land Ordinance as a free grant and another 05 plots of private lands under the Land Acquisition Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Request for Proposals (RFP) to select investors for the development of 	lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority
decision_details:
-Taking into consideration the time taken in selecting suitable investors for the development of lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority in terms of the existing procedure adopted in this regard, the proposal made by the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to follow the procedure stated below for the same, was approved by the Cabinet. 

    • To authorize the Urban Development Authority to call for Requests for Proposals to alienate lands belonging to the said Authority for the development activities according to the proposed development plans with the full participation of the private sector as well as the Public-Private Partnership in terms of the Government Procurement Guidelines.
      
    • To invite proposals from the interested prospective investors through the Competitive Bidding Process for the development of lands belonging to the Urban Development Authority identified for the projects to be implemented with the Public-Private Partnership.

    • To appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee to evaluate the said proposals and Project Committees based on the nature of each project. 
    • In determining the value of the lands to base it on the the valuation of the Government Chief Valuer.
    • to alienate the relevant blocks of land to the selected investors on lease basis based on the recommendation of Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee and subject to the approval of the Cabinet.

title: Regulations under the Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000
decision_details:
-Regulation of Insurance Industry Act, No.43 of 2000 has been introduced replacing the previous Act No.25 of 1962, to establish the Insurance Board of Sri Lanka currently known as the Insurance Regulatory Commission making provision for the development, supervision and regulation of the insurance industry of Sri Lanka with the objective and responsibility of protecting the rights of the policyholders and potential policyholders by ensuring the conduct of the insurance business in Sri Lanka is carried out in professional manner with integrity and prudence.
	
	The Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to present the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2118/1 dated 2019‑04‑08 issued by virtue of the powers vested with the Minister of Finance, under section 112(3) to be read with section 16 of the new Act, for the purpose of amending the regulations under the previous Act issued through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 610/4 dated 1990‑05‑15, in Parliament.

title: Appointment of professionals with competency and experience as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors of Statutory Boards
decision_details: - The Government has emphasized the need for the appointment of professionals with competency and experience as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors when appointments are made as Chairmen and Members of the Boards of Directors in the Public Corporations, Statutory Boards inclusive of  State Owned Enterprises, to enable to achieve the set objectives and targets of the said Enterprises. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the President to make the necessary recommendations to enable the Ministers in‑charge of the relevant subjects to appoint graduates of a recognized University of Sri Lanka or a foreign University or persons with recognized professional qualifications and long term professional experience in the relevant field, based on the criteria approved previously by the Cabinet, except in the case of Ex-Officio Members, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Vote on Account - 2019
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously, to present a Vote on Account to secure the provision necessary for the first 04 months of the year, 2019.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to present a resolution in Parliament (Vote on Account) to incur a total  expenditure of Rs.1,735 billion made up of Rs.760 billion to maintain the Public Services of the Government, Rs.970 billion for providing services already authorized by various laws and Rs.5 billion for the Advanced Account Activities until an Appropriation Bill for the year 2019 is submitted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Parallel Roads for access to the houses situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte Railway Track
decision_details: - The construction activities of the Matara - Beliatte railway project is nearing completion and it is expected to commence train operations from the year 2019 covering the entire coastal railway track from Colombo to Beliatte. The need for the construction of parallel roads has been identified considering the necessity of providing access to the houses of the people living in the area  being situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte railway track. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to get the construction activities of 54 roads with a total length of 12.95 km done under the supervision of the Road Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Incurring the Government expenditure for the first four months of the 	year 2019
decision_details: - Since there is inadequate time to present the Budget for the year 2019 due to the recent shuffles in the composition of the Ministries, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to secure the budgetary provisions required to maintain the Government services uninterruptedly for the first four months of the year 2019 through a Vote on Account in compliance with the precedence followed in similar situations, until the Budget for the year 2019 is passed and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft the resolution in this regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The ongoing Government Procurements to be carried out without any delay
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to provide the necessary instructions to the Line Ministries to carry out the ongoing Government Procurement without any delay in accordance with the recent changes in the Ministerial portfolios, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Continuous implementation of the project on Education for Social Cohesion
decision_details: - The project of Education for Social Cohesion has been implemented successfully from the year 2005 under the technical grant assistance of the Government of Germany. This project is being implemented with the objective of enabling the children, the youth, their families and communities to live together harmoniously and peacefully in a multi-lingual society. The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany has provided a grant assistance of Euro 15.8 million for this project and has agreed to provide another Euro grant of 250,000 for the further implementation of the project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to sign Exchange of Notes to obtain the said grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the new building with seven storeys for the Faculty of Arts of the University of Peradeniya
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to award the contract for the construction of a building with seven storeys for the Faculty of Arts of the University of Peradeniya to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.397.3 million in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the civil work contract of the Project for enhancing the Deep Berth Capacity of the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - In order to coincide with the development activities carried out to gain competitive opportunities for handling larger container vessels arriving at the Port of Colombo, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the civil work component of the project for the enhancement of the deep berth capacity of the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, implemented by utilizing the funds of the said Authority to M/s China Harbour Engineering Company Ltd., as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Container Handling Equipment for the Jaya Container Terminal of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for purchasing 03 cranes required for container handling from ships to the shore for (JCT) - V under the modernization of  the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) - V of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority by utilizing the funds of the said Authority to M/s. Shanghai Zhenhua Heavy Industries Co. Ltd. for a sum of US$ 25.7 million, as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Agreements / Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) between the Local Authorities of Sri Lanka and the Provincial Entities of Foreign Countries under the Friendship City Concept
decision_details: - Various Local Authorities have implemented several programmes in collaboration with the different provincial entities of foreign countries under the Friendship City Concept. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to appoint an Officials' Committee representing all the relevant Ministries and Institutions to evaluate the proposals made in respect of such Programmes or Agreements and take necessary future course of action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving the efficiency of the Dairy Farms
decision_details: - Dairy cattle of around 5,000 belonging to the European Breeds and their crosses have been imported from Australia and New Zealend and distributed among the dairy farms scattered all over the Island in order to enhance the dairy production in Sri Lanka.  Although, the average production potential of these cattle is 20 to 25 Liters per day due to various reasons such as poor management standards and the environmental effects, a very low milk production of about 10 to 15 Liters per day is reported. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development and Rural Economic Affairs, to implement the projects planned for the improvement of the productivity of the farms and the enhancement of their efficiency and to appoint an Experts' Committee comprising of the representatives of the Department of Animal Production and Health and the National Livestock Development Board and to study the strategies needed in this respect and make recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing Facilities to increase Domestic Maize Production
decision_details: - Maize has been imported over the past few years as the domestic maize production was not sufficient to meet the market requirements due to adverse weather and several other issues. With the increase of domestic maize production, the importation of maize can be minimized thereby reducing the foreign exchange spent, as well as increasing the income of the local maize producers. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to provide loan facilities required to increase the domestic maize production under the loan schemes presently being implemented at concessionary interest rates, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Debt Recovery (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 1990
decision_details: - The Debt Recovery (Special Provisions) Act, No.2 of 1990 has been introduced with the objective of introducing an expeditious procedure for the recovery of debts. However, since the said Act covers only the lending institutions that were in existence, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to amend section 30 of the said Act to make legal provision required to include the Licensed Specialized Banks established subsequently for the purposes of this Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of 02 Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts for the Coast Guard of the Republic of Seychelles
decision_details: - During a state visit by H.E. the President in the Republic of Seychelles, H.E.  had acceded to a request made to construct two Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts for the coast guard of the Republic of Seychelles. Accordingly, with a view to strengthening the diplomatic relations between the two countries, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence, to carry out the construction activities of the Wave Rider Inshore Patrol Crafts by the Sri Lanka Navy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Empowering local potato farmers
decision_details: - The Government, with the increase of supply of potato in the market due to the bountiful harvest of potato in Welimada and suburban areas, has taken measures to purchase the potato harvest from the farmers with a view to ensuring a reasonable price for the products. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to secure provisions to settle the payments of the farmers for the potato stock purchased by the Consumer Co-operative Societies Federation Ltd., was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting post procurement reviews and detailed investigations
decision_details: - The Government has focused its attention to ensure that the state funds spent  on public procurement made for various requirements of the government, are value for money and to ascertain that such procurement is made in terms of the Government Procurement Guidelines.  Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, to implement the proposals for post procurement reviews and detailed investigations on all public procurement made by the government institutions avoiding duplication with the programmes of other Ministries, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Conducting the Forthcoming Provincial Councils Election
decision_details: Provisions have to be made expeditiously to hold the Provincial Councils Election since the official tenure of 06 provincial councils out of 09 have been expired by now. The delimitation of electorates required to hold elections under the Mixed Member Proportionate System presently being implemented to elect members for provincial councils which was introduced by the Provincial Councils Elections Act, No.2 of 1988 as amended by the Provincial Councils Elections (Amendment) Act, No.17 of 2017 has not yet been completed. As such, considering the exigency of holding the Provincial Council Election, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to draft legislation to hold the Provincial Council Elections under the previous proportional representative system, and to ensure 25% women candidates at the said election, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Provision of a seed paddy subsidy for paddy cultivation damaged by Plant Hoppers and Stem Borers during the Yala Season - 2018
decision_details: A vast damage has been caused to the paddy cultivation due to the rapid spread of brown plant hopper and yellow stem borer during the Yala season of 2018 in the Polonnaruwa and Ampara districts. Accordingly, it has been estimated that damages have been caused to 34,759 acres of paddy land owned by 18,280 farmers in the Polonnaruwa district and 7,402 acres of paddy land owned by 3,676 farmers in the Ampara district. Therefore, it has been found difficult for the farmers to obtain seed paddy for the Maha season of 2018/19. As such, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, and Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to grant a compensation of Rs.1,500 to Rs.3,000 per acre relative to the damages caused for the farmers who were affected due to the pest damages to purchase seed paddy for the Maha season of 2018/19, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme for Economic Revival
decision_details: Action is being taken by the Government to revive the economy by strengthening the local entrepreneurs and industries through relaxation of excessive taxes, empowering the agricultural sector and providing reliefs to the consumers through reduction of prices of the essential commodities. Under this, it has been proposed to provide various reliefs such as reduction of prices of fuel and the essential commodities, provision of debt reliefs to farmers,  small scale mill owners and the women living in drought affected areas, providing chemical fertilizer at concessionary price, lowering the high tax burden, providing tax concessions to local agriculture, constructions, small scale businessmen, those who are engaged in foreign employment, professionals and small and medium scale entrepreneurs, and uplifting the livelihood of the Samurdhi beneficiaries. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Rajapaksa, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs, to make amendments to the relevant Acts for obtaining the legal sanction required for the implementation of the proposals made by the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Economic Affairs on 2018‑11‑01, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of water to the areas of Inamaluwa, Kitulhitiyawa, Sigiriya, Habarana, Galewela and Thiththawelgolla under the Local Government Enhancement Sector Project
decision_details: It has been planned to implement water supply schemes to cater to the water supply needs of the people living in the areas of Inamaluwa, Kitulhitiyawa, Sigiriya, Habarana, Galewela and Thiththawelgolla under the Grater Dambulla Water Scheme of the Local Government Enhancement Sector Project. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports to award the contracts for the water supply extension to Inamaluwa and  Kitulhitiyawa areas, for a sum of Rs.491.9 million and the water supply extension to Sigiriya and Habarana areas, for a sum of Rs.415.3 million  to M/s PND, E&C Joint Venture, and the water supply extension to Galawela and Thiththawelgolla areas to M/s Squire Mech Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd. for a sum of Rs.660.6 million, in accordance with the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Supply of School Uniform Material for the year 2019
decision_details: The Government, through out a period of 25 years from the year 1993 up to now, has been engaged in supplying school uniform material to the school children of about 45 million in order to ensure the equality of educational opportunities to the children receiving free education. It has been found that it is financially profitable to supply uniform material obtained from the local cloth manufactures, as was done earlier, relative to the 'gift voucher method' adopted in recent times. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to provide the school children with uniform material for the year 2019, considering the saving of about Rs.50/- per meter of cloth and also the saving of the foreign exchange by obtaining cloth material from the local manufactures, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Nomination of  Cabinet Spokesmen
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers decided to nominate Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe,  Minister of Ports and Shipping and Hon. Keheliya Rambukwella, State Minister of Mass Media and Digital Infrastructure to function as the Cabinet Spokesmen.

title: Awarding of the contract for the construction of a building for the Faculty of Applied Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Education & Higher Education, to award the contract for the construction of laboratories and lecture halls specified to be constructed as Stage II ‑ Phase I of the new building complex proposed for the Faculty of Applied Sciences of the Sabaragamuwa University, to M/s Sathuta Builders (Pvt.) Ltd., for a sum of Rs.452.4 million, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project on 'Biomass Energy 2022' for Fueling the Economy
decision_details: - The importance of promoting the use of domestic energy resources has been identified with a view to minimizing the foreign exchange spent for the importation of fuels such as petroleum and coal for the energy needs of Sri Lanka, As such, a project named 'Biomass Energy 2022' has been planned  to develop 1000 entrepreneurs for growing of biomass energy and processing of agricultural waste as biomass energy through the establishment of 50 biomass energy collection and processing centres across the country. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Ranjith Siyambalapitiya, the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy, to implement this programme with the financial support of the public, private, as well as the foreign sector, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board Act
decision_details: - The necessity has arisen to amend the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board Act in keeping with the present economical and global trends. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to draft legislation to change the title of the Sri Lanka National Freedom from Hunger Campaign Board to read as the 'Sri Lanka Food Promotion and Agri Marketing Board' to revise the general objectives of the said Board, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of an Accelerated Agriculture Development Programme, “North East Agricultural Revival (Krushi Navodaya)”
decision_details: - It has been identified that the challenges such as low productivity, scarcity of seeds, land use issues, climate changes, inefficient post harvest management, problems associated with marketing and value addition, difficulties in water supply, problems relating to agricultural roads and rehabilitation of tanks, scarcity of infrastructure facilities and the dearth of officers to be engaged in the field have to be overcome to further improve the agricultural harvest of the Northern and Eastern Provinces. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to implement an accelerated Agricultural Development Programme, “North East Agricultural Revival (Krushi Navodaya)” in order to further increase the contribution made by the Northern and Eastern provinces to the national economy and to uplift the living standard of the people in those areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Abandoned Rural Tanks
decision_details: - In accordance with the database of the minor irrigation system and primary water sources of the Department of Agrarian Development, 14,421 tanks are in a state of operation at present and it has been identified that 1958 rural tanks have been abandoned  on the grounds of internal conflicts and the spread of infectious diseases. It is anticipated that around a  new cultivable extent of 97,900 acres can be cultivated by renovating these tanks. Further, taking also into consideration the benefits they provide for the nourishment of the ground water resources and to improve the forest cover and the wild life in the waste lands, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to renovate the tanks which are technically confirmed as suitable for renovation,  was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improving the facilities of the Sri Lanka Schools of Agriculture
decision_details: - In order to attract the the younger generation to the field of agriculture, 05 Sri Lanka Schools of Agriculture established in Kundasale, Pelwehera, Angunakolapelessa, Karapincha and Vavuniya produce Agricultural Diploma Holders of NVQ Level 6 providing them with the education pertaining to the new technology. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to increase the number of students recruited to the Schools of Agriculture and to provide them with a quality education and thereby enhancing the agricultural production of the country quantitatively and qualitatively with the cooperation of the Ministry of Skills Development and Vocational Training, as well, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Strengthening of the Crop Forecast Information System (CFIS) to minimize the gluts and scarcities of food crops
decision_details: - Crop Forecast Reports which include the data on the island-wide information on the prevailing crop situation,anticipated production in respect of the different seasons, crop damages and harvesting schedules are issued by the Department of Agriculture and such data can be considered the most reliable data base presently being used for making timely decisions including decisions regarding the importation of food crops. The said data base is presently being used through the software named 'Crop Forecast Information System (CFIS)'. Accordingly, with the objective of further utilizing the said information system efficiently and productively, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to upgrade the said Information System utilizing the resources available in the Agrarian Service Centres and the Deputy Director of Agriculture Offices established throughout the country, and the Mahaweli Zonal Offices, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tariffs Revision for the Services provided by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority and  the Jaya Bahalu Container Terminal (Pvt.) Ltd
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to revise the tariff charges for the services provided by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority and  the Jaya Bahalu Container Terminal (Pvt.) Ltd in keeping with the present market trends and enabling to provide a more qualitative service and to introduce a uniform method of  tariff rates among the harbours, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Headquarters building of the Sri Lanka Coast Guard Department
decision_details: - It has been decided to establish the Headquarters of the Sri Lanka Coast Guard Department with all facilities in close proximity with the Colombo city in order to maintain a proper coordination with the Government Institutions, to conduct meetings, seminars and bi‑lateral discussions and to supervise the coast guard operations and administrative functions enabling more efficient and effective performance of the duties of the Department which is entrusted with the safety of the Sri Lankan maritime zone and the protection of lives and property within the zone. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to construct an eleven storey building for the Headquarters of the said Department within the premises of the Wellawatta area where another office of the same Department has already been established, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Climate Change Mitigation Action Support Project
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted previously to implement the Climate Change Mitigation Action Support Project for the mitigation of the greenhouse gas emission, under the World Bank assistance. Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena, in his capacity as the Minister of Mahaweli Development and Environment, to establish a Project Management Unit comprising of the officials of the Ministry of Mahaweli Development and Environment and the persons with expertise knowledge in the relevant fields, for the proper management of the project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the NAVIS Terminal Management System at the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the Unity Container Terminal (UCT) at the Sri Lanka Ports Authority.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the improvement of the NAVIS Terminal Management System at the Jaya Container Terminal (JCT) and the Unity Container Terminal (UCT) at the Sri Lanka Ports Authority to ACCESS NAVIS Joint Venture in accordance with the recommendation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the Panadura Base Hospital and provision of medical equipment
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to award the procurement for the development of the Panadura Base Hospital and provision of medical equipment which provides medical services to the people living in the areas of Beruwala, Kalutara, Bandragama, Ratnapura, Moratuwa and Ratmalana for a sum of Euro million 106.4 to M/s GITEC IGIP Consultant GmbH of Germany, in accordance with the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding of the contracts for the construction under the Gampaha, Attanagalla, Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Project
decision_details: - The contract for the Gampaha, Attanagalla, Minuwangoda Integrated Water Supply Project has been been awarded to M/s China Machinery Engineering Corporation (CMEC). Under this project, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, has planned to carry out 08 major constructions as sub contracts. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Rauff Hakeem, the Minister of City Planning and Water Supply, to award the contract for the laying of fittings and DI/PVC Pipes for the Transmission and Distribution Mains in Attanagalla out of those sub contracts, to the Joint Venture of M/s Sierra Construction Limited and K D A Weerasinghe Co. (Pvt.) Limited, as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of parallel roads for the houses on one side of the Matara-Beliatta Railway.
decision_details: - The construction activities of the Matara-Beliatta Railway Project are nearing completion and it is expected to implement the railway operations from Colombo to Beliatta from the year 2019 covering the entire coastal line. Since the houses of the people living in the area are on one side of the Matara-Beliatta railway line, it has been found necessary to construct roads parallel to the said railway line in order to provide access to those houses. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to have the construction activities of 54 roads of 12.95 km in total length carried out under the supervision of the Road Development Authority (RDA), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement of Oil and Lubricants for the Sri Lanka Transport Board Buses.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to award the contract for the procurement of Oil and Lubricants for the buses of the Sri Lanka Transport Board to M/s Lanka IOC PLC, M/s Chevron Lubricant Lanka PLC and M/s McLarens Lubricant Ltd., as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Road Development Projects in the Northern and Eastern Provinces.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Ranil Wickremasinghe, the Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of National Policies and Economic Affairs, to award 05 Contract packages for the rehabilitation and improvement of the roads in the Northern and Eastern Provinces identified to be developed expeditiously by the District Development Committees of the said Provinces, to the recognized road construction companies as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee/ Project Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Tamil Medium National School in Kelaniya Education Zone.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. Mano Ganesan, the Minister of National Integration, Reconciliation and Official Languages, to establish a Tamil medium Hindu School named Arun Manickavasagam Hindu College, in Kelaniya Educational Zone to uplift the educational standards of the children studying in the Tamil medium in the Gampaha and the Wattala area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the facilities at the Vocational Training Centre,  Anamaduwa
decision_details: - It has been proposed to expand the facilities of the Vocational Training Centre at Anamaduwa with a view to conducting courses targeting the present job market. This will enable to conduct the courses such as Cookery, Bakery and Related Products, Computer Graphic Designing and Human Resource Management belonging to National Vocational Qualifications (NVQ) Level 4 (equivalent to G.C.E. A/L) which have a great demand in the job market. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Sagala Ratnayake, the Minister of Youth Affairs, Project Management and Southern Development, to secure Rs. 100 million for the same, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Presentation of the Extraordinary Gazette Notification that includes the list of prohibited substances in Parliament.
decision_details: - A list that includes prohibited substances and methods which are banned to be used by athletes is published by the World Anti-Doping Agency annually. At the same time, in terms of section 34 of the Convention against Doping in Sports Act, No.33 of 2013, the list of such substances declaring the prohibition of such substances in sports has been published in the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No.2083/32. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Faiszer Musthapha, the Minister of Provincial Councils, Local Government and Sports, to present the said Gazette Notification, in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of a Chiller for the Central Air Conditioning System of the Superior Courts Complex Building.
decision_details: - The proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Thalatha Atukorala, the Minister of Justice & Prison Reforms, to secure funds amounting to Rs 50 million to purchase a Chiller for the Central Air Conditioning System of the Superior Courts Complex, in order to supply the air conditioning facilities necessary to carry out the functions of the Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal, uninterruptedly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the outputs of the Fishery Infrastructure Facilities and Aquaculture Development of the Northern Province Sustainable Fisheries Development Project.
decision_details: - It has been planned to implement the Northern Province Sustainable Fisheries Development Project comprising of the 03 outputs of construction and development of fisheries harbour, anchorages and ferry,  aquaculture development and livelihood development with the financial assistance of US $ 174 million to be granted by the Asian Development Bank during the period from 2018 - 2024. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Vijith Vijayamuni Zoysa, the Minister of Fisheries & Aquatic Resources Development and Rural Economic Affairs, to establish a Project Implementation Unit(PIU) for the implementation of the project outputs of fisheries infrastructure facilities and  aquaculture, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Science & Technology Human Resources Development Project.
decision_details: -With the introduction of the 'Technology Stream' for the G.C.E. Advanced Level, the University Grants Commission has recognized 10 State Universities to award degrees for the new technology subjects.  As such, it has been planned to establish 03 Technological Faculties in the University of Kelaniya, Rajarata University and the Sabaragamuwa University and an Engineering Faculty in the University of Sri Jayawardhanapura.  Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Wijayadasa Rajapaksa, the Minister of Higher Education & Cultural Affairs, to secure Rs.26,400 million necessary for the Universities to  develop  their physical and human resources for the commencement of the said degree  programmes within the time frame from 2018-2023, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The restoration of the Kudawilachchiya and the Dematagala Tanks.
decision_details: - The water collected in the Mahawilachchiya Reservoir situated adjacent to the Wilpattu National Park is the only available source of water for drinking as well as agricultural purposes of the people of the area.  As the water collected in the said reservoir is not adequate for the needs of the people, the restoration of the Kudawilachchiya tank which is a large abandoned tank situated in the Wilpattu National Park has been proposed. Also as the rural tanks situated close to the Palagala area experience shortages of water frequently, it has been identified that a project could be implemented by the restoration of the abandoned Dematagala Tank with a feeder canal to supply additional water to the rural tanks by constructing an anicut across the Heven Ella Oya, as a remedial measure. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management, for the restoration of the Kudawilachchiya tank and the Dematagala tank, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Carrying out Geotechnical Investigations necessary for the Engineering Designs of the Kelani Flood Embankment.
decision_details: - It has been proposed to construct a flood embankment along the Kelani river from Hanwella up to the river mouth to mitigate the damage caused around the Kelani River Basin by floods. The said activities are planned to be carried out under 03 sub-projects.  A Geotechnical Investigation has to be carried out prior to the construction of the proposed flood embankments and as such, the proposal made by Hon. Duminda Dissanayake, the Minister of Irrigation and Water Resources & Disaster Management, to get the necessary activities done by the National Building Research Institute, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Exhibition, forum and award ceremony on Innovation in Agriculture
decision_details: - As a step towards modernization of the Agricultural sector in Sri Lanka, arrangements have been made to conduct an exhibition on Innovation in Agriculture, the Forum for Modernization of Agriculture and an Awards Ceremony for Stakeholders engaged in the Agriculture sector from 11th - 16th December, 2018 at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) in Colombo. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to conduct the said programme in association with all sectors engaged in the agricultural activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Modernization of the Seed and Planting Material Supply System of the Department of Agriculture
decision_details: - Due to the limitations prevailing in the essential facilities to be deployed for the production activities carried out in the seed farms of the Department of Agriculture, it has been difficult to produce seeds at the required quantities. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to secure the funds required for the mechanization of seed processing, establishment of a combined drying and processing complex at Maha Illuppallama, Ampara and Aluttarama, purchasing the necessary equipment for the Palwehera and Bataatha farms, construction of 04 seed stores in Rahangala, Seethaeliya, Bataatha and Ampara farms and the development of seeds and other supply facilities, through the Medium Term Budgetary Framework, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a National Level Analytical Laboratory.
decision_details: - The need for the establishment of a high level analytical laboratory to regulate the inputs of the chemical and organic fertilizer and the pesticides and to regulate the excessive usage and the residue levels contained in the locally produced food has been identified. With the establishment of such high level laboratory facilities it would be possible to provide low cost as well as more reliable analytical services to all stakeholders. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of Agriculture, to establish a national level analytical laboratory with an investment of Rs.286 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the quality of seeds and planting material.
decision_details: - In terms of the Seed Act, No.22 of 2003, the Department of Agriculture is vested with the legal authority and responsibility of controlling the quality of all planting material such as food crops, plantation crops, export agricultural crops, ornamental flowers and foliage, forest plants and medicinal herbal crops. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to provide the infrastructure facilities further needed for the seed testing laboratories that operate under the seed certification service of the Department of Agriculture to carry out the procedure presently being adopted in a more proper and an efficient manner, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Food safety enhancement.
decision_details: - The Centre for Excellence on Organic Agriculture (CEOA) at Makandura conducts research and technology transfer on Organic Agriculture and organic fertilizer while the Regional Agriculture Research and Development Centre (RARDC) conducts research in various other disciplines such as crop improvement soil and plant nutrition. It has been identified that there is a possibility for establishing a new centre for the development of Sustainable Agriculture by combining these two institutions. The combination of these two institutes will result in the creation of a premier institute which could hold the responsibility for providing training on eco-friendly agriculture and project activities Island wide productively, motivating promotion and research in organic agriculture and organic fertilizer and also as the premier institute for local organic certification and the National Reference Unit for soil micro biology. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Amaraweera, the Minister of  Agriculture, to combine the said two institutes and establish the Centre for Sustainable Agriculture and to provide the necessary facilities for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of Polduwa by-pass Road from Suhurupaya to Kanatta Road
decision_details: - Action is being taken to relocate the government administrative offices in the Administrative City of Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte and the development activities of the area have to be carried out parallelly. Under this, it was proposed to construct a road from Dematagoda to Outer Circular Highway (OCH) and the construction activities from Polduwa Junction to Koswatta has been commenced by now. The Stage I  of this project from Polduwa Junction to Suhurupaya has been completed and the Stage II from Suhurupaya to Kanatta Road is under construction. As such, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to secure the provisions of Rs.328.63 million required for the completion of the said construction activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Improvement of the sanitation facilities in the Kataragama Sacred City.
decision_details: - The Cabinet of Ministers has previously granted approval to implement the Development Project at Kataragama Sacred city. In addition to this project, considering the inadequate sanitation facilities and solid waste disposal mechanism for the general public visiting the sacred city, the proposal made by Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka, the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development, to construct the required sanitation blocks in the Kataragama and Kebiliththa areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building Complex for the Anuradhapura District Secretariat.
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the space limitations prevailing in the building where the Anuradhapura District Secretariat is being maintained and with a view to providing more qualitative public service, the proposal made by Hon. Vajira Abeywardena, the Minister of Home Affairs, to construct a building complex of 150,000 sq.ft. with 07 floors with an investment of Rs.1,731.3 million, in place of the building being used to maintain the Anuradhapura District Secretariat and around 30 other offices of different Government Institutions, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Removal of sand dunes accumulated at the Harbour Mouth of the Oluvil Port.
decision_details: - Difficulty in entering the fishing boats into the harbor due to the accumulation of sand dunes in the harbour mouth of the Oluvil Port has caused disruptions for the livelihood of the fishermen in the said area. As such, the information bought to the notice of the Cabinet of Ministers by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, the Minister of Ports and Shipping, that measures are being taken to remove sand dunes accumulated in the harbour mouth of the port using dredgers enabling to use the Port without interrupting the fishing activities, was noted by the Cabinet.

title: Upgrading of the existing Analogue X-Ray System to Digital X-Ray System in the Government Hospitals.
decision_details: - Digital X-Ray images have been identified as the best effective technological  method for a successful early diagnosis of a disease.  As such, a proposal has been made to use digital X-Ray systems instead of  the analogue X-Ray systems already used in the Government Hospitals. Under the said project, it has been planned to retrofit 50  analogue X-Ray machines already existing in the hospitals with Digital Radiology panels and obtain 25 Digital Mobile X-Ray systems. Therefore, the proposal made by Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne, the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine, to procure a quality technological Advanced digital radiography system, utilizing the funds to be received through the concessionary financing of 'FINEXPO' from the Kingdom of Belguim, was approved by the Cabinet.
